Job Title: 2022 Focused Analytics Solutions Team (FAST) Full-Time Analyst Program - Data Science
Job Description:
Chase is the U.S. Consumer & Community Banking (CCB) business within JPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE: JPM), a leading global financial services firm with assets of $2.5 trillion and operations worldwide.
Serving nearly half of America's households with a broad range of financial services, including: personal banking, credit cards, mortgages, auto financing, investment advice, small business loans and payment processing, the firm places a strong emphasis on digital banking, financial fitness, innovation, leadership, analytics and strategy. Here is a snapshot of where we rank today:

#1 Credit card issuer in the U.S.
#1 Most visited online banking portal
#1 Mobile banking app
#1 Amongst Millennials for checking, savings and credit cards

The newly formed CCB Data & Analytics team is the engine that powers Chase with insights that are used to create competitive advantages for our business, with an emphasis on creating value for our customers.
Unifying data and analytics talent across Chase, the team encompasses a variety of Data & Analytics disciplines, from data governance and data strategy/partnerships, to reporting, data science and machine learning. You will partner closely with our technology partners, leveraging the cutting edge data and analytics infrastructure they have constructed to ensure front-line impact through transformational projects across sales and marketing.
Within the broader CCB Data & Analytics team, the CCB Focused Analytics Solutions Team (FAST) is responsible for working across CCB to develop and execute actionable data science and analytical solutions.
The team leverages Big Data in a consulting-style environment that places a premium on creative problem solving and client interaction, working on a wide range of strategic, highly visible projects with internal clients, including: Consumer Banking, Home Lending, Card Services, Business Banking and Auto Finance.
What to expect
Beginning in September 2022, FAST Analysts will gain exposure to a variety of analytics techniques, business lines and datasets while uncovering creative and innovative ways to solve business problems using an assortment of data science methods, algorithms and techniques. FAST Analysts will spend 1-2 years in the group in a consulting-like atmosphere that will provide exposure to many different topics and Lines of Business across Chase's consumer businesses. Projects can range from 4 weeks to a few months, offering significant opportunities for a variety of experiences. It is expected that an Analysts will eventually leave FAST for a Line of Business or other role, but the timing is on your schedule: If you find a place you love within the first year, you can move as soon as you find a position you love. If you enjoy the variety of FAST, you can stay longer than 2 years and help train our future classes while continuing to lead a variety of projects across Chase's businesses.
In addition to comprehensive on-the-job training, the program kicks-off with a training "bootcamp" and offers mentorship opportunities to ensure you are equipped with the tools to succeed.
As a Data Science Analyst you will make a meaningful impact by:

Using your knowledge and technical skills to help uncover novel use cases of Big Data analytics that can be deployed at scale across the business
Building an in-depth understanding of the business and available data assets
Collaborating across teams to deliver the best solution for client, working with a wide range of internal resources
Executing the analytics and prototyping the solutions: collect and clean data from diverse data sources and locate new data sources, build and test solutions, supporting the plan to operationalize and scale them, etc.
Effectively communicating proposed solutions and the analytic insights of your work to all stakeholders

Chase's FAST group is an opportunity to accelerate your career through hands-on data analytics, management and professional networking experience, and career control that is generally not available in other 'rotational' programs.
Program participants will be placed in the following locations, based on candidate interest and business need:
Chicago, Illinois
Wilmington, Delaware
Columbus, Ohio
Plano, Texas
About you
We're looking for highly-motivated team players with the initiative and insight to develop innovative analytic solutions
Key Qualifications:

Enrolled in a Bachelor's degree in a quantitative discipline such as Statistics, Economics, Applied Mathematics, Operations Research, Business, Computer Science, etc., with course work in statistics and data analysis/data science
Attend college/university in the U.S.
Authorization to work permanently in the U.S.
Minimum preferred cumulative GPA of 3.2 on a 4.0 scale
Expected graduation date of December 2021 - Summer 2022

Desirable Skills:
Exceptional analytical, quantitative, problem solving and communication skills
Demonstrated leadership ability
Ability to collaborate across teams using a consultative approach
Basic knowledge of any of the following software packages: Python, R or SQL
Good knowledge of MS Office required
Familiarity with relational database concepts
Basic awareness of Big Data technologies & their applications
Strong track record of success as demonstrated by educational background/accomplishments
Join us
At JPMorgan Chase, we're creating positive change for the diverse communities we serve. We do this by championing your innovative ideas through a supportive culture that helps you every step of the way as you build your career. If you're passionate, curious and ready to make an impact, we're looking for you.
What's next?
We will review applications as they are received and extend offers on a rolling basis. We strongly encourage that you apply early since programs will close as positions are filled.

Posted Job Title
Data Analyst (Pathology and Lab Medicine)

Job Profile Title
Data Analyst C

Job Description Summary
This analyst will work in the Center for Biomedical Image Computing and Analytics ( https://www.cbica.upenn.edu , CBICA), under the guidance of investigator Dr. Spyridon Bakas. The work involves interaction with clinical and computational experts, as well as testing, validation, and extension of advanced image analysis and image processing (machine learning) algorithms for medical imaging (incl. digitized tissue sections and magnetic resonance imaging). This position offers the opportunity to gain experience using advanced computational image analysis and processing techniques and to apply these methods in the study of COVID-19 and cancer.

Job Description

The work involves interaction with clinical and computational experts in the department and school, following coordination by Dr Bakas, ensuring appropriate understanding of the problems at hand. The work further involves assessing, testing, validating, and extending advanced image analysis and image processing (machine learning) algorithms, preparing and extending processing pipelines, and applying these pipelines on digitized whole slide images of tissue sections, as well as on magnetic resonance imaging datasets from various studies and anatomical sites. The data analyst will collect and organize final quantitative, qualitative, and imaging results, perform quality control on the results, and communicate with clinical collaborators for the dissemination and discussion of the results. This position offers the opportunity to gain experience using advanced computational image analysis and processing techniques and to apply these methods in the study of COVID-19 and cancer.

Qualifications

A Bachelor's Degree and 2 to 3 years of experience or equivalent combination of education and experience required.

Experience with image analysis and deep learning is required.

Experience with analysis of magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) and digitized tissue sections is strongly preferred.

Strong computer skills (knowledge of Python and/or Matlab, statistical analysis packages, basic shell scripting, experience in Unix platform) will be preferred.

Position contingent upon funding*

Posted Job Title
Data Analyst C/D

Job Profile Title
Data Analyst C

Job Description Summary

Job Description

The data analyst C will be responsible for participating in the development of large cloud-based projects developed within the Institute of Biomedical Informatics. Development efforts will be focused on front end development of the infrastructure. The data analyst C will participate in agile development processes, daily stand-ups, ticket grooming and planning processes as well as assist, and contribute to research projects with software development where needed. The data analyst C will be responsible for developing and leading technical design documents, implementation of services, and test-suites for the developed resources. In addition, the data analyst C will work closely with other members of the team within the IBI at The University of Pennsylvania and with external collaborators through joint projects.

The Data Analyst D will be responsible for everything described in the Data Analyst C in addition to back end software development and Cloud-based Infrastructure management for platforms developed within the Wagenaar Lab and Institute for Biomedical Informatics.

Position is contingent upon continued grant funding.

Retirement: Penn offers generous retirement plans to help you save for your future. Penn's Basic, Matching, and Supplemental retirement plans allow you to save for retirement on a pre-tax or Roth basis. Choose from a wide variety of investment options through TIAA and Vanguard.

Time Away from Work: Penn provides you with a substantial amount of time away from work during the course of the year. This allows you to relax, take vacations, attend to personal affairs, recover from illness or injury, spend time with familywhatever your personal needs may be.

Long-Term Care Insurance: In partnership with Genworth Financial, Penn offers faculty and staff (and your eligible family members) long-term care insurance to help you cover some of the costs of long-term care services received at home, in the community or in a nursing facility. If you apply when you're newly hired, you won't have to provide proof of good health or be subject to underwriting requirements. Eligible family members must always provide proof of good health and are subject to underwriting.

Wellness and Work-life Resources : Penn is committed to supporting our faculty and staff as they balance the competing demands of work and personal life. That's why we offer a wide variety of programs and resources to help you care for your health, your family, and your work-life balance.

Professional and Personal Development: Penn provides an array of resources to help you advance yourself personally and professionally.

University Resources: As a member of the Penn community, you have access to a wide range of University resources as well as cultural and recreational activities. Take advantage of the University's libraries and athletic facilities, or visit our arboretum and art galleries. There's always something going on at Penn, whether it's a new exhibit at the Penn Museum, the latest music or theater presentation at the Annenberg Center, or the Penn Relays at Franklin Field to name just a few examples. As a member of the Penn community, you're right in the middle of the excitementand you and your family can enjoy many of these activities for free.

Discounts and Special Services : From arts and entertainment to transportation and mortgages, you'll find great deals for University faculty and staff. Not only do Penn arts and cultural centers and museums offer free and discounted admission and memberships to faculty and staff. You can also enjoy substantial savings on other goods and services such as new cars from Ford and General Motors, cellular phone service plans, movie tickets, and admission to theme parks.

Flexible Work Hours: Flexible work options offer creative approaches for completing work while promoting balance between work and personal commitments. These approaches involve use of non-traditional work hours, locations, and/or job structures.

Penn Home Ownership Services: Penn offers a forgivable loan for eligible employees interested in buying a home or currently residing in West Philadelphia, which can be used for closing costs or home improvements.

Adoption Assistance: Penn will reimburse eligible employees on qualified expenses in connection with the legal adoption of an eligible child, such as travel or court fees, for up to two adoptions in your household.

To learn more, please visit: https://www.hr.upenn.edu/PennHR/benefits-pay

Wednesday, August 4, 2021
AdvaCare Systems is the largest and most reliable regional provider of Durable Medical Equipment in the Midwest. Our mission is to provide quality end-of-life care for our patients and customers.
General Job Description:
The Data Analyst, or a Digital Data Analyst, collects and analyzes data to identify trends and provide clients or management with valuable information that they can use to improve marketing, operational and businesses practices. Their main duties include identifying, gathering, analyzing data, and making their insights accessible to the company through easy-to-understand graphs, charts, tables, and reports. The duties and responsibilities of a data analyst include more than collecting and analyzing data. They also must make this data accessible to those who need the information to streamline business processes.
Essential Duties:
Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports.
Build time-series forecasting models to predict optimal inventory levels with the ability to back-test assumptions.
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics, and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in various data sets.
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities
Day-To-Day Duties:
Use data mining to extract information from data sets and identify correlations and patterns.
Organize and transform information into comprehensible structures.
Use data to predict trends in the customer base and the consumer population as a whole.
Perform statistical analysis of data, monitor data quality, and remove corrupt data.
Use tools and techniques to visualize data in easy-to-understand formats, such as diagrams and graphs.
Prepare reports to present to management or clients.
Communicating with stakeholders to understand data content and business requirements.
Minimum Experience & Qualifications:
No degree is required if you have proven aptitude in data science.
1 year of data analysis and analytics is required.
Expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining, and segmentation techniques.
The ability to pay attention to detail when working with data to make accurate conclusions and predictions.
Strong verbal and written communication skills to effectively share findings with stakeholders.
A solid understanding of data sources, data organization and storage.
In-depth knowledge of statistical methodologies and data analysis techniques.
Knowledge of relevant relational databases.

About the role:
As a Data Analyst at ActiveVideo, you will play a key technical role in driving our success by providing insights based on data generated from our services, and and by collaborating with stakeholders to satisfy internal and external business reporting needs. . This will include taking ownership of both proactive requirements management and handling reactive technical and business issues, as well as long-term planning and follow-through. Being assertive and a self-starter will be important to the success of this role.
About the team:
You will be joining ActiveVideo’s Data Engineering Team. The majority of the team is based in the San Jose and surrounding Bay Area. This role will be based in of the San Jose office, however ActiveVideo offers the flexibility to combine work from home time as well. The Data Engineering team is part of ActiveVideo Operations organization, who strive to balance working hard and playing hard.

What you will do:
Lead experimentation to determine product enhancements and user engagement optimizations
Own, design, and report metrics related to user engagement and product function
Drive complex, multivariate analyses to identify causality
Independently perform analysis and generate interpretations to aid the business direction
Generate visual reporting dashboards that product owners and executives rely upon to make critical decisions
Identify trends within the AppCloud platform and drive interpretations
Support business and product decisions with empirically rigorous analysis
Communicate analytical insights clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Monitor data quality and drive issues to resolution
What you will bring:
BS degree or equivalent experience in a technical field such as mathematics, finance, statistics, economics, or computer science.
3+ years Data Analyst experience
Excellent SQL coding
Experience in Python and/or R
Knowledge of ML concepts and essential ML libraries like Scikit-learn, Pandas, and NumPy
Experience building dashboards in Tableau, Looker, or similar visual interface
Mastery of frequentist and Bayesian statistical approaches
Experience A|B testing
Ability to clearly and concisely communicate complex phenomena
Self-starter, self-motivated and independent worker
Excellent English verbal and written communications skills
What you will get for this?
You’ll become part of a team consisting of strong, delivery minded technologists. The culture is highly informal and our structure flat. This enables our employees to be flexible and to research their ideas. And of course, we offer a competitive package:
ActiveVideo Networks offers competitive salaries, medical, dental, vision, life, 401(k), and PTO starting at 15 days for the first year of service.

Who to contact:
We are committed to an inclusive and diverse ActiveVideo. We believe that different perspectives lead to better ideas, and better ideas allow us to better understand the needs and interests of our diverse, global ActiveVideo Community. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives and are an equal opportunity employer.
If you are you interested and enjoy working hard and having fun, please send your resume to T.Mai@activevideo.com for the attention of Tam Mai. Please indicate job title in the subject line.

About KLIK:

KLIK is a startup on a mission to change the ad agency world. We create revenue and value for clients through performance marketing, data, technology infrastructure and strategy. Our growing company is based in the Ballston neighborhood of Arlington, Virginia.

About the Position:

KLIK is looking for a Data Analyst to support and build the infrastructure that powers our data-driven work. Candidates should be able to work independently, while synchronously and asynchronously collaborating with a small team of engineers.

This role can be fully remote, but we prefer candidates who are within the DC metro region.

To be successful, this person MUST be very comfortable with a fast-moving environment. We are looking for someone who loves building processes from the ground up.This role is not a good fit for someone looking for explicit daily direction, and a successful candidate must be highly curious. It is an excellent opportunity to learn fast and make an impact.
Primary Responsibilities:
Build and maintain custom data sets using multiple, disparate data streams
Modify, clean, and analyze data to gain insight, and communicate these findings to internal stakeholders
Be a domain expert on both the data products you build, as well as the internal Klik data stack products
Collaborate with media managers to understand client data requirements, support on technical data issues, and identify areas of improvement
Act as a resource for the internal marketing team to help with reporting builds
Work closely with the data engineering team and help identify process improvements with an emphasis on simplification and automation
The Ideal Candidate Possesses:
2-5 years experience working in a data analytics or engineering role
Strong understanding of SQL (Postgres/Snowflake experience a plus) and advanced data manipulation techniques (e.g. grouping, joins, aggregation, etc.)
Proven ability to write clear, concise, efficient, and maintainable code
Experience with version control software (Git, etc.) is a plus
Experience with other languages of data analysis (Python/R) is not required but a huge plus
Experience dealing with moderately large, complex datasets (100K-10M rows) from various sources
Experience with BI reporting & visualization tools like Tableau
Knowledge of marketing and sales metrics, KPI's, and marketing platform functionality a plus
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to communicate technical information to both technical and non-technical audiences
Requirements:
Must be eligible to work indefinitely in the US without employer action

Unlimited PTO
Medical, Dental, & Vision coverage
401K Deferrals

Innovating our proprietary de-identification and data science algorithms
Building a culture that supports rapid iteration and new possibilities

The infrastructure and culture we are building will provide an environment that cultivates innovation. We want to move fast knowing we can fix anything we break along the way. If a new need arises, we want to turn around a solution quickly. We want to solve our challenges in ways that create even more possibilities. We’re creating a platform that lets us discover what else we might do.

We have big plans
We are building a platform that will scale to support an ever-growing array of data providers and innovative products. You must be able to think big while still delivering on near-term requirements.

HealthVerity, based in Center City Philadelphia, is a venture-backed technology company that is transforming the way data-led organizations make critical decisions. Advantaged by highly sophisticated identity resolution and matching capabilities, HealthVerity is on a mission to increase transparency, forge interoperability and activate deeper insights.

HealthVerity is an equal opportunity employer devoted to inclusion in the workplace. At HealthVerity, we’re working towards an innovative and connected future for healthcare data and believe the future is better together. We can only do that if everyone has a seat at the table. Job Description

What you’ll be doing
This is an entry level role is to join a data analysis team supporting data insights and Categorization Services. This position is focused on providing ongoing annotation and hands-on analysis of actual consumer records. Primary responsibility is to executes tasks and functions necessary to support continuous improvement in the generation of quality data categorization and standardization.
Responsibilities:
Annotation of training data sets conformant to defined taxonomy and instructions
Detailed analysis of consumer data and categorization results
Refine requirements for Data pre and post processing
Develop expertise in operation and understanding of categorization System
Execute ad-hoc/daily/weekly Tasks required for operating and training categorization system
Support Taxonomy requirements in partnership with product team
Support development and operation of data standardization processes
Review categorization corrections, updates and optimizations
Support and contribute to documentation and standardization efforts
Support assessment of immediate and long-term value of new data sources, including identification of missing consumer data/information elements
Collaborate with business stakeholders and Artemis Engineering teams

Qualifications

What your background looks like
Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or Statistics
Demonstrated analytic skills, including mining, evaluation, analysis, and visualization
SQL or Excel skills with the ability to learn other analytic tools
Flexible and adaptable to learn and understand new technologies
Familiarity and tenure in the Domestic US marketplace, including recognition of major brands and retail firms
Demonstrate analytical and problem-solving abilities, coupled with an enquiring mind and the ability to learn quickly
Proactively analyze data to answer key questions from stakeholders or out of self-initiated curiosity with an eye for what drives business performance, investigating and communicating areas for improvement in efficiency and productivity
Bonus Points For
Ph.D. in economics, statistics, physics, math, or another quantitative field
Understanding of current trends in machine learning interpretability and transparency
Familiarity with probability, statistical inference, optimization algorithms, linear algebra, and calculus.
Familiarity with available and prevalent Machine Learning algorithms
Ability to write code in Python, as well as proficiency with SQL

Perks
During this pandemic, all Experian employees are working remotely. Once it’s safe to do so, we’ll slowly return to our offices however we are in no rush to do this. The safety of our employees is of utmost importance.
Three weeks of vacation to start, five sick days and two volunteer days (plus eleven paid holidays)
Competitive pay and comprehensive benefits package, with a bonus target of 5%
Flexible work schedule and relaxed dress code

The Data Analyst is responsible for providing accurate, reliable and accessible business metrics as well as contextualizing them in operational performance with research and advanced analysis. The Data Analyst will work closely with Analytics Business Partners and Research Scientists to improve and scale our People Data work. The role will also liaise with various cross-functional partners across People Data teams and Data Engineer stakeholders to effectively organize and distill data, ask appropriate questions to understand hypotheses and requests, and visualize and present complex data in a compelling manner to an Executive audience.We are looking for Data Analysts who share our passion for building new functionality and improving existing systems. The Candidate will be curious and inquisitive, have strong critical thinking and analytical skills, will thrive managing concurrent projects while working with a global team to drive outcomes and will enjoy informing and influencing stakeholders with data and insights. The candidate will also have the ability to build strong partnerships to drive impact across the organization.
Build new analytics and reporting capabilities to support program evaluation and operations.
Handle ad hoc reporting and analytics requests, while addressing Stakeholder long-term needs and driving insights for HR Partners and Executives using existing dashboard, HRIS data, and leveraging our people data ecosystem.
Intake on business needs and apply contextual knowledge in order to scope data requests, synthesize insights, and recommend solutions to key business partners in collaboration with others.
Effectively communicate with cross-functional partners and internal teams to deliver solutions in a timely fashion.
Proactively manage stakeholder expectations, manage escalations and resolve issues in a timely manner.
3+ years of experience working with SQL or relational database
2+ years of experience with data visualization tools
Experience manipulating large data sets through object oriented programming (ex: Python), statistical software (R) or other methods
Experience initiating and driving projects to completion with minimal guidance
Experience having effective conversations with clients about their support needs and requirements, managing the intake process, and asking the right questions to scope and solve the requests
Demonstrate judgment and discretion when dealing with highly sensitive people data and business issues
Comfortable working in a fast-paced and demanding environment
Experience with R or Python
Experience working with HR/organizational people data preferred (e.g., headcount, turnover, recruiting metrics, and other people analytics)
Experience with data management, specifically with building data systems and validating reports from disparate systems

Skilljar is seeking a Data Analyst to help the Product Management team build the most useful customer education platform on the market. There are a lot of amazing SaaS products out there who rely on customer training as the main driver of product adoption. A tool is only useful if you know how to use it! Our ideal data analyst candidate thrives in a collaborative environment, is curious and dives deep into the data to help us identify impactful investments for the future.
We believe that education is the key to unlocking product innovation for individuals, organizations, and society! Our journey started when our founders discovered that companies were developing outstanding products, but users were struggling to tap into the full potential of those products. Product education was the missing link and legacy learning tools were frustrating customer education teams and their students. Our customers rave about us because we are passionate about helping them transform their users into product specialists and advocates with our best-in-class learning platform. This is an exciting opportunity to join a rapidly growing Series B company with Fortune 1000 and mid-market customers!
Responsibilities
Identify data sources to drive product performance metrics
Build operational product dashboards and generate insights and hypotheses
Partner with Product Management on product initiatives
Research customer usage patterns
Help capture the right data to drive adoption and performance metrics
Facilitate feature return on investment analysis
Present findings and communicate actively
Research ways to drive more value from usage and customer data
Partner with Engineering on Product and Infrastructure initiatives, and experimentation
Improve data availability, accuracy and integrity
Gather requirements around warehousing needs for reporting
Define data specs that outline required event tracking and necessary data points to be implemented during feature development
Requirements
Background and education in Finance, Business or Statistics
Demonstrated ability to synthesize complex data into meaningful insights
Proven experience working with product managers
Excellent writing skills to prepare detailed reports
Advanced standard query language (SQL), Python and R is a plus
Must have deep knowledge of Excel and experience with creating Pivot tables
Experience using dashboarding and data visualization tools (Tableau, Mode and the like)
Strong statistical foundations and A/B experiments
Experience working in a high-growth software development organization and passion for a fast-paced, collaborative work environment.
Our Benefits
Comprehensive Medical Coverage: Skilljar pays 100% of our employee premiums for medical, dental, vision, disability, and life insurance. (PTO and family leave)
Flexible Time Off: We believe in a healthy work/life balance and trust our employees to take the time off they need to bring their A-game to work.
Benefits Package: Skilljar employees receive a monthly technology reimbursement for remote work, 401K savings plan, stock options, and access to an Employee Assistance Program.
Inclusive Culture: We are intentional about creating a culture that is fun and inclusive. Join us for Fun Committee events, trivia nights, Bingo, and more!
The Company
Backed by prominent financial institutions, including Mayfield, Shasta Ventures, Trilogy Equity Partners, and Insight Partners, Skilljar is the leading enterprise customer training platform, transforming the way organizations onboard, engage, and retain their customers. Trusted by leading global companies like Slack, Tableau, Liberty Mutual, Cisco, Verizon, and U-Haul, Skilljar provides the essential tools and foundation for successful customer and partner engagement and enablement.
We are a team of bright, dedicated Skillets with startup drive and a passion for education. Headquartered in Seattle, WA, Skilljar is currently operating remotely, with employees based in Washington, Oregon, California, Colorado, Arizona, and Florida.
Skilljar is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, religion, gender, age, veteran status, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status or disability (in compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act) with respect to employment opportunities.
Skilljar does not accept nor are we responsible for any fees associated with unsolicited resumes, LinkedIn bios, or any other candidate introductions.

GREGORY HOUSE PROGRAMS
JOB DESCRIPTION
Position Title: Program Development Analyst Date: October 26, 2020
FLSA Status: Full Time, Non-Exempt Supervised by: Director of Quality Assurance
Primary Responsibilities: Under the supervision of the Director of Quality assurance, the Program
Development Analyst plays integral role in the agency-wide quality improvement program using GHP’s data management program (CaseWorthy) as its main tool, ultimately improving program participants’ health, financial outcomes and quality of life. The Program Development Analyst will also provide training to GHP staff and volunteers on CaseWorthy, document workflows and update the CaseWorthy training manual as needed. The Program Development Analyst will build capacity in GHP’s housing programs by developing and implementing data collection tools that are non-duplicative and will fulfill the needs of multiple funders. By streamlining routine data collection, GHP’s case managers will be able to spend more time with and work more intensively with program participants in our housing and food programs.
Essential Duties:
Develop/improve processes to collect data and documents in CaseWorthy to reduce duplication of effort when fulfilling requirements by GHP’s multiple funding sources.
Communicate with GHP staff at staff meetings to determine how to make improvements, train
GHP staff new processes, and provide refresher training and support, as needed.
Develop and manage an agency-wide quality assurance program to improve data submitted to funders, improve long-term health outcomes and long-term housing and financial stability, in collaboration with the Director of Quality Assurance,
Review data completeness reports, enrollment rosters, performance reports and case notes in
GHP’s CaseWorthy system, the Homeless Management Information System, and e2Hawaii
(Department of Health, Ryan White data collection system), and will compare data to contracted service goals and outcome measures.
Present data to GHP’s Director of Quality Assurance and Program Director to discuss measures that need improvement, if focus needs to be on service deliveries or in data collection and management, and how these quality improvement projects will be implemented and measured.
Quality improvement projects may focus on timely data collection, data completeness, identifying and working more intensively with clients who are not virally suppressed or have identified substance use or mental health challenges, or connecting breaks in stable housing or medical insurance to fluctuations in health status.
Provide all CaseWorthy training at GHP, including training new users on Caseworthy, providing refresher training for GHP staff as needed, updating the CaseWorthy training manual as needed, and providing on-going bi-weekly training at staff meetings on new features or areas that have been identified as in need of improvement.

About the opportunity
Joining our growing People Analytics and Technology team as a people data analyst during a period of rapid growth, you will work both collaboratively and independently to make a real impact scaling our processes, reporting and analysis. Your passion for improvement means that you will have a massive opportunity to have many different roles in projects that will shape our business as we continue to grow. What's more, you get to work with bright people who want to solve technology challenges and innovate. We are a hard-working, international, agile and feedback-oriented bunch that enjoys interacting with one another in a friendly, respectful, and welcoming environment.
In your role as a Senior People Data Analyst, you will be a critical partner to our growing global team and front line managers, developing reporting, dashboards, advanced and predictive analytics. You are fully dedicated to internal clients across the business, their needs and duties, and above all else - removing friction. If you describe yourself as a team player who wants to make an impact shaping the business with fresh, new ideas, we want to hear from you!
What to expect?
Lead people analytical projects and initiatives
Complete analysis using financial, strategic, statistical, and predictive analysis
Synthesize quantitative and qualitative data to create actionable insights and recommendations
Develop and maintain reports, analytics, surveys, and dashboards
Create and own our employee lifecycle survey program
Partner with program and project managers to develop performance indicators
Manage multiple projects and stakeholders concurrently
Effectively explain complex scientific or technical concepts to any audience in the form of clear, polished presentations, responses to questions and challenges
Contribute to data dictionary, standards, training, and ongoing updates
Partner with teams to add people data to SQL data warehouse as needed
What you need to be successful?
Masters, PhD, or equivalent work experience in a quantitative discipline e.g., industrial organizational (I-O) psychology, behavioral science, or related field
Prior experience with surveys and strategy; prefer experience with performance management design or consulting on other talent or assessment initiatives
Advanced excel and SQL (Redshift); SPSS, R and/or Python
Advanced statistical methods, bonus if you have a knowledge of machine learning
Ability to influence leaders to think differently about people using data
Amazing storytelling, with strong presentation, verbal and written communication
Prefer experience with Looker or another BI tool (Tableau, PowerBI, etc.)
What's in it for you?
Join an ambitious tech company reshaping the way people build digital product
Health, vision, dental insurance, an employee wellness program, life and disability insurance, and a retirement savings plan
Commuter benefits to help you get to and from work
A flexible time-off policy and paid holidays
16 weeks paid parental leave (after 6 months of employment)
We set you up for success, equipping you with the latest and greatest hardware
We value our employees health and safety. Our teams are working remotely during the COVID-19 pandemic.
Use your personal education budget to improve your skills and grow in your career, with extra days off
Plus, Contentful socks! Oh yeah!

Your Job
As Data Controls Analyst, your role is to be an expert at understanding Indeed's data. You’ll partner with the Marketing, Sales Support, Business Intelligence, Legal, Investor Relations & International Product Teams to gather requirements and provide guidance on data best practices. You’ll also help uncover key data points that effectively portray Indeed’s products and performance and drive related data approval processes.
This role reports into the Experience Marketing Data & Analytics group, which is responsible for informing the Experience Marketing team’s campaigns through insights, program measurement, and business impact results. You’ll have like-minded, analytically savvy colleagues who support other experience marketing functions along with you. If you have an analytical mindset with the ability to organize projects and meet deadlines, as well as exceptional communication skills, this is a great opportunity for you.
Responsibilities:
Support legally compliant international growth and data best practices by reviewing data, methodologies, and citations in all external Sales and Marketing content
Embody curiosity and passion about data and be willing to question the validity and accuracy of data
Liaise with members of Marketing, Sales Support, Business Intelligence, Legal & International Product Teams to gather requirements and provide guidance on data best practices
Uncover key data points that effectively portray Indeed’s products and performance and drive related data approval processes
Seek efficiency and automation opportunities to improve team performance
Coordinate spot checks on content to ensure data integrity, brand consistency, and legal compliance
Who You Are
Requirements:
Bachelor's degree (Business, Statistics, Data Science, Mathematics or related field preferred)
2+ years work experience in project management, compliance, or data analytics
Exceptionally strong analytical and problem solving skills with a high attention to detail
Experience with Python, SQL or advanced Excel is required
Strong communication and influencing skills
Comfortable making data-driven decisions
Ability to think ahead and anticipate issues before they arise
Team player with great interpersonal skills at all organizational levels
Tenacity to dig into difficult questions, recommend a course of action, and drive those recommendations forward.
Self-directed, has initiative and strong multi-tasking ability
Who we are
Our Marketing team helps job seekers and employers around the world discover Indeed. Whether creating impactful advertising, coding bidding algorithms, or looking for the news stories in Indeed's labor data, Indeed marketers bring diverse skills to help shape and share Indeed’s story.
Our Mission
As the world’s number 1 job site*, our mission is to help people get jobs. We strive to cultivate an inclusive and accessible workplace where all people feel comfortable being themselves. We're looking to grow our teams with more people who share our enthusiasm for innovation and creating the best experience for job seekers.

(*comScore Total Visits, March 2020)

Company Description

Digitas is the Connected Marketing agency, built on the principle that there are better ways for brands to connect with people. We leverage comprehensive data, technology, creative, media and strategy capabilities to deliver Media-Fueled Creativity via connected Solutions that include Connected Campaigns, Social Marketing, Brand Experience, CRM & Loyalty, and Marketing Transformation. A Leader in Gartner’s Magic Quadrant for Global Marketing Agencies for six consecutive years, Digitas serves the world’s leading brands through a global network comprised of more than 4,000 employees across over 30 countries and 50 offices. For more information visit www.digitas.com.

Job Description

Analyst, Data and Analysis
We are the connected marketing agency, a full-service agency with modern creative & media, data, and technology services all under one roof. We are connected in the way we think and the way we work. At the heart of our company are great people that we call Unicorns. Our Unicorns are open, bold, and curious and love to solve complex problems for clients in unique ways
The Data & Analysis team uses data-driven insights to fuel strategic growth for clients. We believe that data should never exist in a vacuum; instead, it should be put to work to bring the best ideas and stories to our clients
To help with this, we’re looking for an outstanding Analyst – someone who has a knack for understanding data and telling the story of why it matters. You’ll learn from the best in the business as you work with the team to bring actionable insights to our clients. Up for it? Read on.
What you’ll do:
As an Analyst, you’ll lay the groundwork and contribute to day-to-day reporting needs for client marketing efforts. You’ll work on brand campaigns, acquisition campaigns, site optimization, and/or online testing strategy.
Day-to-day, your role includes:
Keeping a pulse on day-to-day performance data, including display media, site, search, email, and/or social campaigns
Working in a variety of reporting systems and databases for the creation of recurring reports and dashboards
Identifying nuances in data to optimize our clients’ business
Supporting marketing initiatives across project and campaign lifecycles, including measurement plans, primary and secondary research, and performance reporting
Expanding industry knowledge and relevant skillsets through internal training

Qualifications

We’re looking for strong, impactful work experience, which typically includes:
1-3 years of work experience in a relevant industry
A four-year college degree
Passion for digital marketing, eagerness to learn in a constantly-changing space, and a natural curiosity
Familiarity with Excel and/or other data analysis tools such as SQL or Tableau a plus
Comfortable in a fast-paced and deadline-driven environment
Got what it takes? We’d love to hear from you!

Job Description
The NYC Public Engagement Unit (PEU) identifies and executes proactive strategies to connect more New Yorkers to key City services. Relying heavily on data analytics, new technologies, and large-scale outreach tactics, the unit identifies New Yorkers in need of assistance and helps them navigate and obtain city services.

The Public Engagement Unit consists of teams of Specialists who are trained to effectively engage New Yorkers and connect them with vital resources. The Unit uses data to identify demographics that likely want or need City services; and works with partner agencies, elected officials, community groups, non-profit organizations, and service providers to engage directly with communities and subject matter experts in all five boroughs. The unit is frequently involved in citywide events, special projects in conjunction with multiple City agencies, and targeted days of action.

The Mayor’s Public Engagement Unit (PEU) is leading the development and use of cutting-edge data and technology in government to increase civic engagement and proactively connect New Yorkers to important City services. PEU exists at the intersection of policy, data, technology, outreach and communications. We work on the City’s most impactful progressive policies, including increasing awareness of and participation in elections and the 2020 Census, connecting uninsured New Yorkers to health insurance, and protecting vulnerable tenants. From sourcing and implementing innovative datasets to targeting and analyzing results, the Data & Analytics team is core to PEU’s outreach work. We are seeking a data analyst to support our outreach initiatives.

The NYC Public Engagement Unit (PEU) is seeking one (1) Data Analyst.

The Data Analyst’s responsibilities will include but are not limited to:

¿ Monitoring data workflows and analyzing data from PEU and partner agencies to evaluate impact,
Identify opportunities to improve operational efficiency and drive effective policy development

¿ Generating data visualizations and reports to present to a variety of audiences

¿ Providing expertise in the application of statistics and analysis to data sets collected and utilized
by PEU

¿ Working with PEU Data & Analytics staff to collaborate with other city agencies and organizations to
utilize new technological resources, encourage data sharing and teach best practices for outreach in
a variety of use cases

¿ Developing and maintaining tools to implement and facilitate data-driven operations

¿ Being the key liaison for troubleshooting and overseeing our NGP VAN data visualization system
Minimum Qual Requirements
1. For Assignment Level I (only physical, biological and environmental sciences and public health) A master's degree from an accredited college or university with a specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological or environmental science or in public health.
To be appointed to Assignment Level II and above, candidates must have:
1. A doctorate degree from an accredited college or university with specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological, environmental or social science and one year of full-time experience in a responsible supervisory, administrative or research capacity in the appropriate field of specialization; or
2. A master's degree from an accredited college or university with specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological, environmental or social science and three years of responsible full-time research experience in the appropriate field of specialization; or
3. Education and/or experience which is equivalent to "1" or "2" above. However, all candidates must have at least a master's degree in an appropriate field of specialization and at least two years of experience described in "2" above. Two years as a City Research Scientist Level I can be substituted for the experience required in "1" and "2" above.

NOTE:
Probationary Period
Appointments to this position are subject to a minimum probationary period of one year.
Preferred Skills
¿ 2+ years working with data in government, or in community, issue, labor, or political organizing

¿ Data visualization techniques and programs, such as NGP VAN Tableau, and advanced use of
Excel

¿ Previous experience using one or more of the following data processing tools in an academic or
professional setting: SQL, GIS, Python, and R analytics.

¿ Previous experience using one or more of the following platforms: NGP VAN, Salesforce, Hustle,
Mobilize and Reach

¿ Experience processing, cleaning, manipulating, and analyzing large datasets

¿ Ability to effectively present data in verbal, written and visual formats to technical and
non-technical audiences

¿ A demonstrated interest in public service, civic engagement and improving outcomes for
New Yorkers

¿ Eagerness to learn, ask questions and solve problems in a fast-paced environment

¿ Strong written and oral communication skills in English

POSITION SUMMARY: The Data Analyst is a member of the America?s Essential
Hospitals? research department and participates in the full range of studies and projects
developed by the department. The Data Analyst supports the organization through
the conception, planning, management and implementation of research projects, maintenance of
data management systems, performing quantitative analysis, and leading data collection
activities. The Data Analyst actively participates in developing methodological
approaches to understand key issues impacting members, manages research activities, and
produces briefs, reports, and presentations. The Data Analyst is expected to be
highly organized, results oriented, an excellent writer, and have strong analytical skills.

PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:
Full lifecycle activities of data analytics to include requirements and design, data cleaning, developing analysis and reporting capabilities, linking databases and data sets
Oversee data collection activities, cleaning/standardization, and ongoing maintenance of the organization?s data warehouse
Conceptualize and conduct analyses of healthcare datasets to inform the organization?s research and policy positions
Develop and conduct surveys to collect information from member organizations that is not available from other sources
Serve as the project manager for the annual member Characteristics Survey, including coordinating other project staff
Use a variety of data sources, including the organization?s data warehouse and other national and state databases, to synthesize and interpret trends in healthcare access, affordability, and quality
Lead the creation of briefs and reports for professional and lay audiences, including the development and distribution of white papers, briefs, member performance reports, infographics, maps, etc.
Respond to research data inquiries from staff, members, and the public at-large
Serve as a resource for member data needs, representing the values and character of the association
Conduct literature searches and summarize information in an appropriate format for a particular study
Lead quantitative research tasks in conjunction with funded projects; and
Provide data and research support for grant preparation and development.

MINIMUM EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:
Master’s degree in public policy, public administration, public health, statistics, computer science, or related fields and 4+ years of experience in a similar position
Bachelors degree may be considered with at least 7 years of relevant experience in a similar position
Knowledge and understanding of health policy and services
Familiarity with healthcare policy related data sets such as CMS Hospital Compare, HCRIS, Federal Regulatory Files, etc.
Demonstrated ability to effectively manage research tasks
Experience performing data manipulation and analyses using SAS, STATA, or R (preferred) and/or other statistical analysis software
Familiarity with Structured Querying Language (SQL) and database principles
Excellent analytical, written, and verbal communication skills
Analyze and interpret results of own/group research, making use of standard and new research methods and techniques
High degree of proficiency with Microsoft Excel and Access

ESSENTIAL CHARACTERISTICS FOR THIS POSITION:
Commitment to the organization’s mission and vision and alignment with our values
Able to work independently and collaboratively to perform work; and have a respectful attitude toward coworkers and customers
Personal and professional integrity; an independent and confident thinker; and able to work effectively with ambiguity at times
Commitment to equity, diversity, and inclusion
Superior attention to detail
Good judgment and accountability
Able to synthesize material, focus quickly, and identify opportunities while continuing to see the big picture
Ability to commute to the Washington, DC office
Able to travel once it is safe to do so
Desire to learn and grow

About Us:
Totally Joined For Achieving Collaborative Techniques (TJFACT) is a veteran owned, SDVOSB, 8(a), CVE certified and HUBZone certified performance driven professional services government contracting company that provides abroad spectrum of services and solutions to the U.S government agencies and organizations.
About the position:
TJFACT is seeking a Data Analyst to support the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC)!

The Data Analyst will aid in cleaning, analyzing and visualizing large sets of various data to improve the CDC's ability to effectively respond to the COVID-19 pandemic and provide critical insights to federal, state and local public health stakeholders. This is a unique opportunity to leverage academic and professional experience in research, statistics and data analytics to assist with the federal government's response to the most significant global public health challenge in the last century.

Contract Length: 1 year – Full-Time Hours (M-F)
Start Date: End of April 2021 – official start date TBD
Remote opportunity, but highly preferred if candidates are local to the following areas: Atlanta, GA/Denver, CO/San Francisco, CA/Chicago, IL/New York/Seattle, WA/Kansas City, MO/Dallas, TX/Boston, MA/Washington, D.C.
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Support data collection, integration, storage, access, analysis, and retention requirements based on the surveillance data collected - Organize and analyze data to be used in briefings, speeches, lectures, meetings, or other presentations by CDC Senior Leadership and Public Health Communications team members.
Perform data science work that requires application of data mining techniques, statistical analysis, and assist with building high-quality prediction systems integrated with public health surveillance systems and programs at the local, state and national levels.
Identify relevant data available, including internal and external data sources, leveraging new data collection processes.
Identify the business requirements and the expected outcome.
Suggest data science tools, methods, and statistical learning models of interest.
Collaborate with other data analysts to ensure that the information used follows the compliance, access management, and control policies.
Present and depict rationale findings in layman’s terms.
Present results that affirm and contradict common assertions or beliefs.
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Must be a U.S. Citizen
Master’s degree in any of the following fields/area of focus: biology, laboratory sciences, public health, health administration, medical logistics or any other related field.
Minimum of 3-5 years of data analysis experience, and highly preferable if this experience is primarily within the healthcare/public health field
Demonstrated experience and proficiency with Business Intelligence tools such as PowerBI and Tableau
Proficiency with Microsoft Excel
Exceptional analytical and critical thinking skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to work both independently and in a team environment
Must be a self-starter and comfortable working in a completely remote capacity
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Previous experience working for the CDC
Exposure to statistical analysis software such as SPSS and SAS preferred
Experience leveraging Python and R to aid in statistical analysis also preferred
BENEFITS:
Medical, Vision and Dental Insurance
401-K plus match
Paid Vacation days
Paid holidays
Short Term and Long-Term Disability
Voluntary Term Life

Define the data and identify assets within their own data domains. This ensures there is not a conflict with other data elements. Document and manage business glossary.
Create processes and procedures along with access controls to monitor adherence. This includes establishing internal policies and standards and enforce those policies.

Other duties as needed/assigned.

Job Description

The Cricut Analytics Team is looking to hire an outstanding Data Analyst with strong technical analytical skills to operationalize data intelligence in multiple business units. This includes analyzing input data sources, doing statistical analysis and building data science models to drive data driven decision making. This person will collaborate very closely and cross-functionally with Product Marketing, Ecommerce, Product Management, Operations, Finance, and other teams, as well as the Analytics team, to ensure success.
Data team
We are looking for highly talented team members who are passionate about data, have the rigor needed to solve billion-dollar problems, and possess an innate entrepreneurial spirit to explore the uncharted. This team combines the engineering backbone of a best-in-class big data platform with the analytic expertise of advanced mining and predictive modeling. If you want to work among the very best talent in the industry, working on the most innovative products in the world, Cricut is the place to be.
Responsibilities:
Domain Expert: It is essential that this role has the capability to understand business function and its nuances, and define proper KPIs to measure health & success of the business
Data Owners: The person in this role will be the data champion for a specific business function, and the single point-of-contact for internal & external teams on questions related to their business unit’s datasets
Ad-hoc analysis & reporting: Create analysis/reports to do diagnostic analysis and provide recommendation to stakeholders
Actionable Insights: Develop strategies and provide direction for the application of our BI/Dashboarding tool, and build robust KPI's and drill-down capabilities to enable discovery of actionable insights
Expand Data first approach: Work across different business functions (Customer Care, Product Marketing, Ecommerce, etc) to pilot data products and ensure data insights are central to business decision making
Build Data Science Products: Collaborate with data science, data engineering and business team to build innovative data products

Qualifications

Background:
Bachelor degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Mathematics, Operations Research, Statistics, Business Analytics, Economics)
Graduate degree in Mathematics, Information Systems, Statistics, Business Analytics or related STEM fields preferred
3 or more years of professional experience in customer analytics, marketing analytics, operational analytics or related field in a quantitative role
Direct experience with using customer data in e-commerce, consumer goods, technology would be preferred
Multiple years of experience manipulating and analyzing large data sets, monitoring and predicting trends and identifying opportunities through the interpretation of financial, behavioral, demographic and operational data
Possess excellent interpersonal communication and problem-solving skills, with the ability to collaborate with senior business leaders and provide strategic recommendations
Demonstrated ability working with multiple teams to complete critical achievements under pressure with tight deadlines
Ability to interpret/translate business requests into clear and actionable technical requirements for meaningful analysis
Skills:
Succinct, proactive communication; storytelling using data
Comfortable to work with people from a broad range of backgrounds from highly technical to marketing to sales/business
Very strong analytical skills
Strong in SQL Skills (PostgreSQL, Redshift, MySQL, etc)
Experience building reports & dashboard in BI tools like Domo, Tableau, Looker, Grow, PowerBI, etc
Understanding of machine learning algorithms preferred
Experience modeling with R or Python
Mindset:
Self-starter mentality with the ability to deliver results
Focused on results and their implications (rather than methods/tools/process)
Openness to work with different cultures and working styles

Additional Information

What to Do Next: Please attach your resume and cover letter. If you want to show your super powers in other ways – include that information too. You can be sure that Cricut® is an employer who values individuality, equality and diversity, so tell us what you’re all about. If you are a Maker or a DIY enthusiast, whether you think you are a good one or not, we would love to hear about it when you send us your information!

Company Description

MindPoint Group delivers industry-leading cybersecurity solutions, services, and products. We are the trusted cybersecurity advisors to key government and commercial decision-makers and support security operations for some of the most security-conscious organizations globally. We design and implement innovative security solutions to identify and defend against today’s risks and tomorrow’s attacks.
We believe that helping organizations operate from the best security posture possible requires automation. Empowering our employees to excel and providing them with the means to do so enables us to consistently exceed our clients’ expectations.
Unlike many IT consultancies, we’re not a body shop. Our client engagements are challenging and growth-oriented. Our relationship with you is for the long run because, in this business, your success is our success. That’s why we treat investments in employees as investments in the company itself, which is why we offer fantastic benefits (healthcare, generous PTO, paid maternity and paternity leave, and tuition reimbursement, to name a few).
But you’ll want to work here for reasons that can’t be written into an offer letter—the challenge, growth opportunities, and most important: the culture of a company that cares about you.
We are an established, profitable, and growing company that promises you the following:
A diverse organization.
A safe workplace with zero tolerance for discrimination and harassment of any kind.
A balanced work life. Seriously.
Potential of a flexible schedule, depending on the specific customer.
A leadership team focused on your professional growth and development.

Job Description

Mindpoint Group, LLC has an exciting opportunity to join our Governance, Risk, and Compliance team at one of our largest clients. This position is critical to the continued maturation of the client’s operational capabilities, and you will join an established and experienced group that is motivated to provide excellent services in defending federal infrastructure. We are seeking a Data Analyst to help discover actionable insights from large data sets and make better decisions in support of our client’s mission.

The Data Analyst will:
Lead ongoing research to identify, recommend, and implement new concepts in Governance, Risk, and Compliance (GRC) analytics and organizational performance management
Identify and evaluate data sources to support the GRC data analytics function, and recommend the implementation of new data collection instruments to support the program’s continuous improvement
Implement automated data collection and aggregation from a variety of sources, such as Cyber Security Assessment Management (CSAM), Phishing, and ticketing tools, and other in-house databases
Conduct analysis of GRC activities and value generation using a variety of analytics and statistical methods
Transform raw data and analysis into data visualizations and interactive dashboards using dashboard tools
Derive insights from data analysis, conduct root-cause analysis of operational issues identified by the data, and provide recommendations to remediate operational issues
Support the integration of new data sources and analysis into DOJ’s Security Posture Dashboard Reports (SPDR) system
Deliver presentations and briefings to federal senior executives, management, and team leads
Provide training on the use of interactive, self-service dashboards to senior executives, management, and team leads
Develop documentation on the requirements for analytics work products, data models, and the process for testing and distributing work products
Work as part of a multi-disciplinary team in a fast-paced, solutions-oriented environment focused on client deliverables and analysis

Qualifications

Active Secret Clearance required
4+ years of experience; 1-3 years of relevant experience delivering large projects with significant impact to multiple lines of business, requiring cross-team collaboration
Bachelor's degree or higher in Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science, or Statistics or similar field
Experience working in a Lean-Agile environment
Hands on experience with current Business Intelligence tools, like MS PowerBI or Tableau
Understanding of GRC topics, such as cybersecurity awareness training, phishing training, and risk-based decision-making
Strong analytical skills with ability to analyze data and identify trends
Experience leading or supporting multiple projects simultaneously
Ability to connect business outcomes with operational and technological considerations
Highly organized with critical thinking abilities at both the strategic and tactical levels
Ability to communicate clearly (written and verbal) and navigate at all levels in the organization with the detail appropriate to the forum and audience
Excellent facilitation / presentation skills, experience with briefing senior leadership
Proficient in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio and MS Project)
Desired Skills:
Experience in managing large transformational data-driven projects in cybersecurity space
Previous experience collecting, analyzing, and reporting GRC data for an enterprise cybersecurity office
Experience with CSAM and SPDR are a plus

Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Company Name: Community Foundation of Northwest Indiana, Inc.
Job Description:
This position resides in the Data Analytics and Informatics department of Community Healthcare System and is responsible for the development and maintenance of dashboards, scorecards, and reports in support of the organization’s analytic initiatives. This role works closely with hospital departments and leadership, as well as other areas of the DAI department, including the business intelligence developers, CRM, and clinical integration teams, in the implementation and roll out of analytics projects. This position will lead and perform complex analysis and assist customers in transforming data into information through logical data models that fit the customer’s needs and help the organization to make data-driven decisions. The ideal candidate will have expert level excel skills, previous experience in the development of dashboards, and the ability to bring data to life through storytelling and visual analytics.
Key Functions:
Builds dashboards and reports using Tibco Spotfire that provide insights and actionable information for business leaders
Translate business opportunities and use cases into comprehensive analytic requirements
Develops interactive visualizations using data from various data sources
Summarizes raw data into meaningful, easy-to-understand information
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data
Provides ad-hoc analysis as requested by leadership
Works with customers to build relationships and gain a deeper understanding of business needs
Develops and produce various scorecards, including for both overall service lines and individual provider performance
Collects and studies data to reveal ways to enhance operational efficiencies
Makes recommendations about the methods a company should use to collect, analyze and manage data to improve data quality and the efficiency of data systems
Analyzes and quantifies impact of organizational initiatives
Validation of data accuracy
This position is fully remote must live local, part-time 20 hours a week, non-benefit eligible. Flexible hours.
To qualify you must have:
Bachelor’s Degree required in related field, preferably in Analytics.
Demonstrated data analysis experience including but not limited to data extraction, data manipulation, data querying/reporting, data visualization, etc.
Possesses advanced analytical, detailed oriented, technical, and problem-solving skills.
Experience using a data visualization tool, i.e. Tibco Spotfire, Tableau, or similar preferred.

Excellent organizational and project management skills in order to work independently and multi-task in a fast-paced environment meeting deadlines.

Job Title: Data Support Analyst (Quantitative Services Risk Operations) - Jacksonville, FL
Job Description:
Job Description:
The Quantitative Services Risk Operations (QRSO) Group is responsible for ensuring the quality of Market Risk data. The Policy Adherence and Reporting (PAR) team within the Risk Operations team provides the governance framework to ensure that the controls executed by the Data Stewards within QSRO comply with all relevant enterprise and regulatory requirements. The PAR team leverages enterprise processes (RCSA, PRC, PCS) and enterprise tools (eDIM, ORCIT, ERR, DQC and EDR) to provide evidence for internal and external verifications and attestations (SOX, QA Assessments). This role requires that the data support sr. analyst continually reviews, documents, and enhances control and governance processes to ensure that they comply with Enterprise Data Architecture (EDA) strategy, Enterprise Data Management (EDM), and the Risk Data Aggregation principles of Basel Committee on Banking Supervision (BCBS 239).
Primary Responsibilities:
Lead market risk adherence efforts to regulatory policies, risk data aggregation standards, and enterprise-mandated standards.
Manage the program to automate lineage documentation in support of the EDM standards
Identify opportunities and suggest solutions to improve data quality and business processes.
Communicate with internal and external auditors and enterprise testing teams and coordinate enterprise data testing efforts.
Provide oversight for centralized attestation process, proactively anticipating and thoroughly executing to provide SME supporting documentation to executive attesters (e.g., Critical Use Spreadsheet, FR Y-14, SOX, etc.)
Work directly with senior management from various teams to identify necessary steps to ensure compliance to constantly evolving regulatory requirements in the Risk Data Management and Reporting space.
Assist in the LOB’s annual RCSA (Risk and Control Self-Assessment) processes.
Identify RDA compliance control gaps and drive remediation.
Support Data Quality ticketing process and work with LOB RMs, technology, and support partners to investigate DQ issues, and manage upstream and downstream remediation.
Drive long-term remediation of key issues.
Required Skills:
3-5 years Capital Markets or financial products experience.
Data query, reporting experience (SQL, Tableau).
Strong communication skills.
Strong analytical, and organizational skills; focus on attention to detail
Desired Skills:
Data Management experience (BCBS 239).
Other Qualifications:
Oversight for centralized attestation process, proactively anticipating and thoroughly executing to provide SME supporting documentation to executive attesters (e.g., Model/Critical Use Spreadsheet (CUS), FR Y-14, SOX, etc.)
Strives to bring new thoughts and ideas to teams in order to drive innovation and unique solutions.
Excels in working among diverse viewpoints to determine the best path forward.
Experience in connecting with a diverse set of clients to understand future business needs – is a continuous learner.
Commitment to challenging the status quo and promoting positive change.
Participate in and drive collaborative efforts to advance tools, technology, and ways of working to better serve an evolving client base.
Believes in value of diversity so we can reflect, connect and meet the diverse needs of our clients and employees around the world.

Job Title: Senior Analyst, Data Reporting - Multiple Locations in FL
Job Description:
Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that's improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)
The Data Reporting Senior Analyst will be responsible for the management and manipulation of quality data with a focus on creating business intelligence tools, conducting analysis, and assuring data quality. This position is responsible for managing all aspects of daily, weekly, monthly and annual reporting including the design, development, testing, documentation, maintenance and analysis of database queries and reports. Presents analysis results / recommendations to management in a timely, consistent, and accurate manner. Recommends and implements new or modified reporting methods and procedures to improve report content and completeness of information. In addition, the Business Reporting Senior Analyst serves as the subject matter expertise on all Quality and Practice Support Unit data sources and report content to ensure total system quality assurance is met at all times.
This position can be located in the following Florida cities: Fort Myers, Tampa, Orlando, Jacksonville, Treasure Coast.
Primary Responsibilities:
Design, develops test, document and maintain database queries and reports related but not limited to: Quality (HEDIS / STARS), Member Visit Data, Member Care Gaps, and Risk Adjustment Coding
Develop systematic reporting processes and procedures to ensure timely delivery of daily, weekly, monthly, annual and ad hoc reporting to management
Work with Quality and Practice Support Unit teams to create a prioritized list of needs for each area and documents additional requirements to enrich reporting capabilities
Manage reporting and analysis elements on all business initiatives and projects
Translate large quantities of in-depth data into meaningful, professional and easy to understand formats that display the information’s overall significance to various audiences
Create on-line tools to improve efficiency and effectiveness of staff in their role in servicing our internal and external customers
Recommend and implement new or modified reporting methods and procedures to improve report content and completeness of information
Troubleshoot data integrity issues, analyze data for completeness to meet business needs, and propose documented solution recommendations
Coordinate and works to resolve all issues related to reports supported by the department
Gain feedback for service improvement opportunities that give a comprehensive understanding of internal and external customer behaviors and needs
You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Healthcare Administration, Information Technology or related field required. (4+ years of comparable work experience beyond the required years of experience may be substituted in lieu of a bachelor’s degree)
3+ years of related professional experience in a reporting and analytic role including the design, development, testing, documentation and maintenance of reporting tools and database queries
Experience with health plan or health care administration
Understanding of HEDIS, HEDIS measures, Medicare Star Ratings and Medicare Risk Adjustment
Advanced level skills in MS Excel (including advanced formulas, pivot tables and lists
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, Tableau, SQL, SQL Reporting Services, and other equivalent data capture / reporting tools
Preferred Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Business or Information Technology
5+ years of reporting / analytic experience in the Healthcare Industry
1+ years of experience in a managed care environment
Experience in Medicare Advantage Part D (MAPD) operations
Familiarity with website development

About Benefitfocus:
Benefitfocus, Inc. (NASDAQ: BNFT) is a leading provider of cloud-based benefits software solutions for consumers, employers, insurance carriers and brokers. Benefitfocus has served numerous consumers on its platform that consists of an integrated portfolio of products and services enabling clients to more efficiently shop, enroll, manage and exchange benefits information. With a user-friendly interface and consumer-centric design, the Benefitfocus Platform provides one place for consumers to access all their benefits. Benefitfocus solutions support the administration of all types of benefits including core medical, dental and other voluntary benefits plans as well as wellness programs.
