Job Description :
Do you want the opportunity to leverage your skills to make a direct impact on the world’s leading life sciences, consumer products, and retail companies? Join Clarkston Consulting as a Data Analyst to help deliver innovative business solutions to our market leading clients as a part of an expert team.

We are looking for motivated, self-driven leaders who are energized by team results and interested in joining a firm that values its culture and people as its biggest strengths. Together, we can help find the answers to our clients most challenging business problems.

What You’ll Do as a Data Analyst

As a Data Analyst at Clarkston, you will:

Transform, model, and visualize data to deliver insights and recommend actions to client teams.
Uncover meaning in large amounts of data.
Interpret and articulate results of analysis with clients, often visually.

How You’ll Grow

At Clarkston, we feel that we provide the greatest value to our clients through a combination of our industry expertise, business process knowledge, and consulting excellence.

Beyond your day-to-day responsibilities, throughout your career as a Data Analyst you will:
Have the support and mentorship of your Clarkston colleagues and leaders.
Own your career – you'll be able to take charge of your career journey with diverse opportunities to lead and expand your skill set both at the client site and within the firm.
Have the opportunity to make a real and positive impact not only the clients you work with, but on the firm as well.


What We’re Looking For

An ideal candidate as a Data Analyst would have gained experience in one or more of the following:
Applying strong knowledge of business processes to identify business issues and opportunities - experience in functional areas across supply chain or sales and marketing a plus.
Assisting with working sessions to understand business challenges, create hypotheses, collect relevant data, and analyze the data to prove or disprove those hypotheses.
Using complex expressions to calculate, group, filter, parameterize, optimize, and format data.
Managing and overseeing the design and development of customized reports and outputs, utilizing visualization tools like Power BI and Tableau.
Building statistical and machine learning models for predictive analytics.
Identifying anomalies in data and their business cause and effect.
Monitoring trends and key performance metrics to drive business goals.
Conducting knowledge transfer and training of end-users, including sharing best practices
Communicating with the various audiences for consuming insights and tailoring approach to those groups (executive, analyst, information consumer).
Use of various data sources, including relational databases, data warehouses, and interfaces and APIs.

Travel is an integral part of this role and is estimated to average 50-75% and may vary based upon client and project needs. While travel is a requirement of the role, due to COVID-19 restrictions, all non-essential travel has been limited and any on-site requests are subject to review.

More About Clarkston

Founded in 1991, Clarkston Consulting delivers technology and management solutions to market leaders in the life sciences, consumer products, and retail industries. At Clarkston, we cultivate success - for our clients, for our people, and for our firm. We utilize a team approach leveraging our collective expertise and industry knowledge to solve our clients’ business challenges.



Our benefits include:

Comprehensive Health and Wellness Benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision and more)
401k with company contributions
Paid vacation, personal days, holidays, and sick leave
Paid Parental Leave
Life and Disability Insurance
Company Equity or Stock Options
Training and Professional Development investments

Visit https://clarkstonconsulting.com/careers-at-clarkston/ to learn more about our culture, benefits, and opportunities. We hope you’ll join us!

Clarkston Consulting is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to creating an inclusive and equitable environment for all our stewards. We embrace diversity and thrive on the variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills to serve our clients and our people.

Interested in working in an innovative, collaborative environment with motivated, social people? At Arc Aspicio, you can join a leading consulting firm that specializes in human capital, management, and strategy professional services to deliver compelling solutions. Consultants join our practice focused on mission-critical projects, and quickly learn to contribute to and grow our company across multiple projects. We invest in hiring, mentoring, and training smart, diverse, and self-driven professionals interested in all aspects of the company and our homeland security and government clients. We are looking for people who are willing to share ideas and work as part of an inclusive, innovative team.

The Intelligence and Data Analyst in consulting is a great role for someone who has at least one year of experience with data analysis, wants a career in data analytics and consulting, and is looking for fast growth. Intelligence Analysts work in a fun, collaborative team on challenging projects in multiple mission areas, translating ideas into action. Candidates are entrepreneurial and interested in supporting Federal government clients including homeland security.

Please note that we are only able to hire US Citizens for this role, and a minimum of a Bachelor's degree is required.

The ideal candidate has experience with analytic and visualization tools (Tableau, SQL, or similar tools) and loves using data to develop insights and provide recommendations. The role requires the ability to work across a range of data sets and effectively communicate with stakeholders. Ideal candidates have experience applying analytical techniques and using analytics tools to analyze and visualize data to present findings and recommendations for clients. Our teams apply a human-centered approach when working with clients and are flexible and responsive within dynamic client environments.

Work is currently being performed remotely due to COVID. After our clients return to the workplace, work will be performed at client sites in Huntsville, AL with trips to the DC area.

Responsibilities:
Collaborate with our clients to solve tough problems, delivering outstanding client service and achieving mission results
Apply excellent consulting, business analysis, and data analytics skills to quickly identify problems, analyze challenges, and recommend solutions to our team and our clients
Love to learn complex mission areas in homeland security such as emergency management, flood risk communications, and law enforcement
Develop consulting skills and help grow the company outside of your project by participating in new business and strategic initiatives
Contribute towards our learning culture, where people put team, client, and company interest ahead of their own, by demonstrating interest in supervising and supporting the growth of others
Manage work in multiple workstreams at one time while also contributing to meaningful contributions in project success in parallel with developing a consulting firm
Required Qualifications:
3+ years of data analytics experience (this can include a combination of professional internship and full-time experience) working with analytical techniques, developing data visualizations, and producing report information from multiple data sources
Ability to assess and understand data sources, prepare data for quantitative and qualitative analysis, and to design visualizations and develop interactive dashboards
Experience with intermediate / advanced functions in MS Excel
Skilled at deriving meaningful and actionable recommendations from analytical work products to improve business processes
Ability to communicate findings, insights, and recommendations to executive-level stakeholders through clear, innovative visualizations and infographics and concise language
Proven to be flexible and thrive in a dynamic, ambiguous, and complex work environment and manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously
Outstanding written and oral communication and collaboration skills and strong leadership potential
Technologically savvy, and interested in further developing analytical skills
Desire to join a consulting firm and learn business concepts; loves to collaborate and reach out to get involved in company events, offerings, and special projects
Education: Bachelor’s degree
Clearance: US citizenship only (no dual citizenship)
Critical Skills: Entrepreneurial spirit, strong work ethic, excellent problem-solving skills, resilience, flexibility, learning-oriented, excited to engage
Preferred Qualifications:

Experience in structured and unstructured data analysis, trend analysis, and statistical analysis
Experience supporting activities in data modeling and development of modern methods and best practices to design and/or implement risk assessment methodologies
Experience using analytic and visualization software, such as Tableau, PowerBI, R, SQL, ArcGIS, or similar
Our recruiting process is very competitive. Therefore, we ask that you submit a brief, tailored cover letter to tell us what you are looking for in a company and why you would be a great fit for a consulting firm.

About Arc Aspicio
Arc Aspicio enhances the future of our nation by creating bold ideas and bringing them to life. A consulting and solutions company, Arc Aspicio solves problems by applying our integrated capabilities in strategy, design, data, human capital, behavioral science, and technology. The company passionately pursues our vision to be the hub of creativity where people take action to change the world. Employees collaborate with clients and partners to create solutions using a human-centered approach.
Our goal is to attract people who love to collaborate and work in a team-oriented environment. Our culture empowers our employees to learn, share knowledge, be leaders in everything they do, and develop strong relationships with their clients and colleagues.

Commitment to Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Innovation
Arc Aspicio is committed to creating a diverse, inclusive, equitable, and safe workplace and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As a growing consulting and solutions firm focused on innovation, we welcome applications from candidates with diverse backgrounds. Duties
Summary
This position is in the Compliance Branch of the Division of Market Oversight (DMO or Division) at the Commodity Futures Trading Commission (Commission).

Responsibilities
This position serves as Derivatives Data Analyst, responsible for providing technical assistance with examinations and policy-making requirements under the supervision of the Associate Director/Supervisory Compliance Analyst. The incumbent will also provide technical expertise in accessing and analyzing derivatives (swaps and futures) data using the Commissions' analytical tools, surveillance systems and databases to provide complex data analysis and user applications.
Major Duties includes:
Responsible for reviewing the technical operations of, and proposing and implementing improvements to, the Commission's derivatives databases and surveillance systems as utilized by the Compliance Branch.
Monitors the Commission’s CEA Part 16, 17, 20, 43, 45 and 49 data sources, databases (such as the transitional swaps database and Greenplum (for trade capture report data)), systems incorporating these data sources with aggregated position data (such as the Integrated Surveillance System (ISS)) and applications (such as MicroStrategy and other data analytics and visualization tools) to ensure accuracy and increase efficiency for the Compliance Branch.
Analyzes the Compliance Branch’s workflows and data requirements, make appropriate recommendations and implement enhancements as warranted.
Evaluates the Compliance Branch’s data and data analytical needs by monitoring the impact of derivative industry developments and changes in regulatory requirements.
Plans, conducts, and leads teams on special projects, primarily long-term studies which may involve the development or application of new concepts and may require analysis and consideration of complex derivatives data and the market impact.

Lead and conduct studies of novel concepts and develop applications to analyze complex derivatives data and market impacts.

Interagency Career Transition Assistance Program (ICTAP). The ICTAP provides eligible displaced federal competitive service employees with selection priority over other candidates for competitive service vacancies. A copy of your notice of proposed removal for declining a directed reassignment or transfer of function outside the local commuting area or documentation showing you were separated as a result of RIF or declining a directed reassignment or transfer of function outside the local commuting area.

At Swickard, we’re passionate about vehicles, and committed to providing 100% customer support and satisfaction – that’s where you come in!
Each member of our team is dedicated to providing a superior experience, whether over the phone, face to face, or in a supportive role. Our customers are the reason we’re here. We want to be their favorite place to purchase or lease a vehicle, and we want to be your favorite place to work! If you understand hospitality and are committed to the customer experience we’d like to talk to you! Swickard is changing the way auto dealerships operate, and revolutionizing the world of service after the sale. Our culture is transforming the retail automotive industry – and our team just continues to grow!
We’re already in the Top 100 of companies in automotive retail – come find out why!
As a Data Analyst at Swickard Auto Group, you will work closely with management, finance, and payroll to help shape the future of our organization.
The ideal candidate will have advanced Excel skills, an analytical mindset, great attention to detail, and be comfortable dealing with high amounts of ambiguity. This would be a great position for someone with dealership experience or a passion for the automotive industry who would like exposure to all sides of the business.

Prepares semi-monthly and monthly commission calculations in Excel and Alteryx
Blend data from multiple systems to prepare reports for upper management and dealerships
Assist in automating commission calculations and pay plan management
Publish monthly and ad-hoc reports for management team
Flux analysis of compensation changes over time
Compare operational results across different dealerships within our group and national benchmarks
Work alongside the payroll team to improve the process flow utilizing Paylocity payroll software
Build reports based on SQL and reconcile to source system data
Utilize Power Automate, Power BI, and APIs to improve reporting and streamline processing
Assist in the creation of labor expenses, and commission dashboards for managers
Collaborate with the Finance and Accounting team on potential RPA solutions to reduce the workload involved with reconciling recurring transactions

Must have advanced Excel skill

Paylocity payroll software experience is a plus
Dealership experience preferred, but not required

Job Title: Data Warehouse Analyst-Integ IT - Enterprise Data Mgm
Job Description:
Position Summary
The Data Warehouse Analyst role is the second level of a three-level career path. This position will support the implementation and the continued evolution of data warehouses, data stores, and data marts. The incumbent will work with architecture and technical support to design, test, enhance and maintain these systems. The primary areas of focus include:
Design and develop source to target mappings to support ETL process.
Design data views; help develop reporting data mart; provide support to reporting teams.
Create, coordinate, and implement test plans.
Help verify and reconcile data for accuracy and consistency.
Provide complete and updated documentation; identify training needs.

Required Minimum Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities (KSAs)
Education: Bachelor's degree in Information Technology or equivalent work experience.
License/Certifications: N/A
Experience: Requires knowledge and experience in data warehousing (ETL, ODS, Star Schemas, OLAP, Dimensional modeling etc.); relational database experience/knowledge preferably SQL server as well as SQL knowledge. Demonstrated experience working with users to identify information system needs. Experience in integrating data from multiple source systems. Experience identifying potential solutions, designing, developing, documenting, testing, and maintaining databases/applications required.
Ability to communicate effectively and work collaboratively with disparate clients.
Ability to independently lead or facilitate meetings.
Ability to identify potential solutions and take initiative.
Must be able to work independently and within a team and handle sensitive data professionally.
Must be able to work on multiple projects concurrently and work within deadlines.


Location: MaineHealth · Integ IT - Enterprise Data Mgm
Schedule: Full Time, Day Shift, 40

Company Name: Mintz, Levin, Cohn, Ferris, Glovsky and Popeo, P.C.
Job Description:
Mintz is seeking a Data Analyst to support the Diversity, Equity and Inclusion (DEI) team. The Data Analyst will assist with gathering, validating, synthesizing, reporting, and analyzing data from a variety of sources and systems. The Data Analyst will report findings to explain current and past activity, make recommendations and collaborate with the DEI department to identify trends and opportunities for improvement. The Data Analyst also will provide statistical and programming support for special projects as needed. This position will report to the Director of Diversity, Equity and Inclusion.

This position can be located in Boston or New York.

Responsibilities:

Work directly with the DEI team to collect and analyze various demographic data by office, practice group and section, including data on recruiting, attrition, retention, promotion, staffing, pitching/marketing, workflow and leadership.

Provide insights re global diversity/talent strategy.

Provide statistical and data support for client requests and external surveys re diversity and pro bono.

Maintain data on competitors and competitive trends.

Track and analyze award and survey results and other industry-wide benchmarking data.

Compile and present analyses to a broad audience, including marketing and talent leadership, to shape strategic and operational decisions.

Monitor DEI developments in the marketplace.

Contribute to other DEI efforts on an as-needed basis.

Develop partnerships with other administrative and legal departments to help drive progress on DEI issues across the firm.

Participate in the DEI team’s efforts to support change within the firm and across the industry.

Assume additional responsibilities as requested.

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Business Analytics, Computer Science, Information Management or related discipline highly preferred.

3+ years of experience working in a data analysis role and developing summary reports. Law Firm experience is a plus.

Demonstrated knowledge of MS Office tools including Excel, Access, and PowerPoint and experience with reporting and visualization tools (i.e. Sharepoint, Tableau, Business Objects, etc.), databases and data management, adept in writing database queries (i.e. SQL, MySQL, PL/SQL, T-SQL) using SQL Developer, etc. and programming (VBA, C#, Python, Javascript or ETL frameworks). Ability to quickly get up to speed and master new applications and software is critical.

Strong passion for diversity, equity, and inclusion; prior experience working on DEI initiatives is a plus. Be eager to learn, and demonstrate ongoing efforts to refine skills and pursue new areas of growth.

Prior HR business intelligence experience preferred.

Possess excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Strong organizational and administrative skills.

Excellent attention to detail and ability to execute through to completion.

Creative problem solving skills, reasoning ability, and logical thought process.

Ability to work under pressure, prioritize competing demands, and meet various deadlines.

Demonstrated ability to professionally interact and collaborate with colleagues at all levels.

Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

Outstanding sense of customer service.

Enthusiastic, proactive, and positive attitude.

Ability to handle confidential matters with discretion.

Must be self-motivated to produce quality work.

High level of integrity and honesty.

Demonstrated ability to be analytical and passionate about working with data, driven to dive deep, and eager to make broad business impact.

Flexibility to work overtime when necessary.

This job description is a general description of the types of responsibilities that are required of an individual in this job. It is not intended to be a complete list of the responsibilities, duties and skills that may be required for this job.

Position Summary:
The Data Analyst - Member Insights & Experience is a critical part of the Member Experience team – both in terms of providing insights into current and past performance as well as setting future strategy.
The individual in this role is responsible for digging deep and wide into our various data sources to provide insights regarding member marketing initiatives’ performance, retention/cancellation trends, member likelihood to churn, lifetime value, member engagement, referrals, and more. The individual in this role conducts various analyses and provides findings and recommendations to various leaders throughout the organization to ensure we are optimizing our retention efforts and that we are providing maximum value to our customers. This role could be at our HQ in West Bend, WI or remote for the right candidate.

Duties/Responsibilities:
Compile and analyze a variety of reports and statistics for the MX team to establish past and current performance, as well as forecast KPI performance and establish cause & effect relationships, on a daily, weekly monthly, and special ad-hoc request basis
Examine and analyze return on investment to determine efficacy for various projects, split tests, campaigns and initiatives designed to accomplish the MX team’s goals. In addition, use findings to provide recommendations on the next best steps.
Identify trends regarding the MX team’s KPIs and provide recommendations, based on data, on how to proceed forward based on your findings.
Raising red flags wherever the business process – billing, installation or anything pre or post sales – needs correction to ensure the customer has a seamless experience with the company
Perform analysis of digital customer behavior to identify insights and opportunities for optimization, split testing, user experience enhancements, or personalization
Assist in defining MX KPIs and the best way to report on KPIs based on MX objectives
Potential need to conduct some secondary research, including finding information from industry associations, statistics, and customer experience/marketing experts.

The Health, Science, and Human Services (HS2) Division seeks a ClinicalTrials.gov Data Quality Analyst to support our National Institutes of Health/National Library of Medicine (NIH/NLM) client. The National Institutes of Health, a part of the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services, is the primary Federal agency for conducting and supporting medical research ( http://www.nih.gov/ ). The NLM collects, organizes, and makes available biomedical science information to scientists, health professionals, and the public ( http://www.nlm.nih.gov/ ).
ClinicalTrials.gov Background
ClinicalTrials.gov is a registry and results database of publicly and privately supported clinical research conducted in the United States and around the world. Both registration and results submission are accomplished through the Web-based Protocol Registration and Results System (PRS). Responsible parties commonly register trials and submit results prior to a journal publication. Unlike journal articles that are reviewed by both scientific colleagues and editors, data submitted to ClinicalTrials.gov are not peer-reviewed prior to posting, however specific review criteria must be met.
The successful candidate for this position will be responsible for the quality assurance and control of clinical trial registration submissions in accordance with registration review criteria, clear communication with data providers regarding registration submissions, and support of database management activities.
Information regarding the ClinicalTrials.gov database and reporting requirements can be found at http://clinicaltrials.gov/ct2/manage-recs/fdaaa .
Key Responsibilities
Perform quality assurance/quality control reviews of clinical trial registration submissions for consistency with review criteria
Gain and use a working knowledge of the ClinicalTrials.gov Protocol Data Element Definitions ( http://prsinfo.clinicaltrials.gov/definitions.html ) and ClinicalTrials.gov registration review criteria ( http://prsinfo.clinicaltrials.gov/ProtocolDetailedReviewItems.pdf )
Clearly communicate (via email and record reviews) with “responsible parties” (i.e., clinical trial sponsors, designated principal investigators) regarding consistency of clinical trial record with review criteria
Perform general proofreading
Create new documentation to help responsible parties submit their clinical trial records in accordance with established review criteria
Post records in accordance with established deadlines
Monitor data for trends or patterns of problems (e.g., consistent series of errors from a single data provider) and participate in process improvement
Support database management activities
Serve as a liaison between data providers (e.g., NIH, industry, universities, and other organizations) and ClinicalTrials.gov
Basic Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college in a biomedical science, public health or related discipline with at least 2 years of professional experience
Or a Master’s degree in a comparable field with no professional experience
Preferred Skills/Experience
Ability to identify and communicate data processing errors and content discrepancies or inconsistencies
Ability to identify, analyze, and solve problems creatively and independently
Experience in data management and quality assurance
General knowledge in the conduct and reporting of clinical trials
Professional Skills
Ability to work within a team environment and contribute to consensus-based decision making
Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously and shift priority as directed
Ability to work efficiently with team members in a fast-paced environment
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work with people at every level
General computer skills with a proficiency in MS Word, Outlook, Excel, and PowerPoint

About This Position
Position Description:
PAI seeks a Data Analyst to provide data analysis support to the Table of Allowance (TOA) Requirements Division within the Naval Facilities Engineering Command (NAVFAC) Expeditionary Business Line (ExBL). The TOA Division supports the establishment and maintenance of Navy unit TOAs (listings of authorized equipment) by collaborating with Navy systems commands (SYSCOM) and Type Commands (TYCOM).
The Data Analyst directly supports TOA development by ensuring the technical accuracy and completeness of military equipment listed in the Expeditionary Management Information System (EXMIS). The Data Analyst is tasked with managing TOA Assemblies and stock numbers under the purview of the Navy SYSCOMs. He/she will conduct cost analysis, liaise with SYSCOMs to support the technical refresh and standardization of equipment, coordinate with product end item managers to support stock number revisions, conduct quality control and quality assurance reviews, ensure compliance with data standards, and create data analysis reports. The incumbent also periodically presents data analysis results in formal briefs to the government client.
To fulfill these responsibilities, the Data Analyst will research information from a variety of sources, including Required Operational Capabilities/Projected Operational Environment (ROC/POE) information, concepts of operations (CONOPS), activity manpower documents (AMD), and naval mission essential task lists (NMETLs). Members of PAI’s TOA Division support team also regularly provide on-site training for the client as required.
Required Qualifications:
Minimum DoD SECRET security clearance
At least 4 years overall experience
1+ years’ experience with DoD database management
2+ years’ experience with data analysis
Ability to develop concise and meaningful briefings, presentations, and technical reports
Demonstrated proficiency with MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
Desired Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in economics, finance, statistics, mathematics, computer science, management information systems, engineering, business analytics, or related discipline
DAWIA Level II certification in program management, life-cycle logistics, engineering, or industry equivalent (e.g., PMP)
Demonstrated proficiency with EXMIS (HP Maximo) item management and TOA management modules
Demonstrated proficiency with MS Access
Experience with Structured Query Language (SQL)
Knowledge of the Defense Acquisition System and DoD 5000 series guidance, Navy material identification requirements (NAVSUP P485), or DoD/DLA material identification in lieu of Navy-specific knowledge
Knowledge of DoD/Navy directives & regulations on supply systems and item management

Excellent people skills

Values team dynamics and inputs
Commitment driven

Job Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (Sales & Customer Data) - (USA Remote)
Job Description:
Company Description

TurnitIn offers a market-leading assessment-management solution that supports the entire testing process, including exam creation, administration, delivery, scoring and analysis. The software delivers powerful, actionable data to assess learning outcomes. Turnitin is a growing company that hires smart and talented people who are excited about personal growth, the positive impact they have on education, and enjoy working in a challenging and fun work environment.
Turnitin is seeking a Principal Software Engineer interested in distributed systems, data modeling, and scalability to develop and improve our award-winning educational software. As an engineer on this team, you will be working on 2 co-products that help to provide additional exam integrity to the assessment process. We operate at a high scale across global markets and seek individuals that enjoy solving complex problems.
Do you have the skills—and drive—to join a tech team that’s working to digitally transform the ed-tech industry? From test-driving the latest technologies to creating high performing applications, Turnitin is constantly innovating and creating industry-leading solutions that provide peace of mind for our customers worldwide. Turnitin has an inspiring mission, cutting-edge technologies, and in-house product development.

Job Description

The purpose of this role is to provide day to day support to Sales and Customer Experience leaders, managers and team members in their use of data and BI (Business Intelligence) to support sales and customer related activity. This is achieved by providing reports, data and BI analysis that gives sales insights and visibility of progress against agreed measures and targets.
Additionally, maintains data quality and integrity within Salesforce and key BI tools (Tableau, Sisense, Google Data Studio) to ensure it is fit for purpose to support the sales process and all Sales, Customer Experience, Marketing and Finance reporting. Supports solutions external to Salesforce and BI tools when required (e.g. Sales Pricing Calculator, ARR calculations).
Works with leadership to develop robust, self-serve reporting that ensures visibility of globally consistent reporting against agreed targets and KPI’s. Supports the implementation of key initiatives where sales, customer and marketing data is integral such as Account Based Marketing, Account Health and Usage.
Provides ad-hoc reporting support as requested. Is responsible for regular manual and automated data loads from key platforms into BI tools and visualization solutions. Works with Product and Engineering to bring together key data sources to further enhance available BI.
Our company CRM is Salesforce, it’s our key sales system and holds our key sales and customer data, therefore our Business Intelligence Analyst is experienced in Salesforce and is responsible for extracting, loading and utilising data within Salesforce.
Responsibilities
Ensure sales leaders have access to globally consistent, robust and timely sales data and reporting in an agreed format.
Ensure and maintain the integrity and quality of sales data in Salesforce. Support data deduplication and data matching activity as required.
Fix data issues in Salesforce and other external BI and reporting tools when they are identified, collaborating with the extended Selling Operations team, Engineering, Product and Finance as necessary.
Provide ad-hoc data support and reporting consultancy
Support the data requirements and activity associated with mergers and acquisitions
Support territory realignment and account allocation activity by providing key reports and data and undertaking Salesforce data uploads.
Support external reporting and data management (ARR, Pricing Calculator, Sales Targets (Regional & Team))

Qualifications
Salesforce administration technical knowledge and capability with particular focus on data load, export, maintenance and integrity
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple priorities with the ability to perform under pressure and in adversity
Strong collaboration skills and ability to work with colleagues across Sales, Marketing, Product, Engineering and Finance to achieve shared outcomes
Ability to communicate complex technical information to non-technical colleagues to aid decision making supported by the ability to communicate written and verbally in clear language
Certified Salesforce Administrator
Certified Tableau Desktop Specialist
Experience of key data and Business Intelligence tools Tableau, Alteryx, GoogleSheets, Sisense
Experience of Tableau CRM

Additional Information

Our Mission is to ensure the integrity of global education and meaningfully improve learning outcomes.
Our Values underpin everything we do.
Customer Centric - We realize our mission to ensure integrity and improve learning outcomes by putting educators and learners at the center of everything we do.
Passion for Learning - We seek out teammates that are constantly learning and growing and build a workplace which enables them to do so.
Integrity - We believe integrity is the heartbeat of ExamSoft. It shapes our products, the way we treat each other, and how we work with our customers and vendors.
Action & Ownership - We have a bias toward action and empower teammates to make decisions.
One Team - We strive to break down silos, collaborate effectively, and celebrate each other’s successes.
Global Mindset - We respect local cultures and embrace diversity. We think globally and act locally to maximize our impact on education.
Turnitin, LLC is committed to the policy that all persons have equal access to its programs, facilities and employment. We strongly encourage applications from people of color, persons with disabilities, women, and the LGBTQ+ community, regardless of age, gender, religion, marital or veterans status.

Job Title: AWM Data Quality & Business Analyst, Associate
Job Description:
Overview
A critical priority for Asset & Wealth Management is to ensure that high-quality data is available to run our business and meet our clients' needs. The Asset & Wealth Management Chief Data Office (CDO) was established to define AWM's data strategy and support the consumption and use of data used across AWM. Given the impact of Data Quality to the Firm, establishing a robust environment for preventing, identifying and responding to Data Quality issues is crucial. The AWM Data Quality strategy seeks to evolve our collective focus from being primarily reactive in managing data quality to being proactive and eventually preventative.
Within the CDO, the sub line of business Data Quality team partners with stakeholders from their business, controls, compliance, legal, operations, technology and the central CDO DQ Governance team.
The Data Quality team, under the leadership of the Data Quality Project Manager, will oversee the Data Quality issue management process, governance, metrics, and strategy to ensure alignment to the firm's record management policy and AWM Operations business objectives.
The Data Quality Business Analyst will perform key analytical and data research functions within the Data Quality team including root cause analysis, investigation of remediation options, documentation of proposed solutions , and identification of data owners.
Key Responsibilities:

Research reported data anomalies, identify root causes, and propose solutions
Partner with stakeholders and controls management to assess data quality operational risk
Identify and collaborate with data owners to develop business rules for proactive and preventative data quality
Maintain strong network with key stakeholders including CDO partners, Operations, Tech, and cross LOBs

Qualifications, experience, skills and attributes:
1-3 years of experience in Data Governance, Project Management, or Business Management functions
Financial Industry experience preferred
Knowledge and experience in data management and technology functions preferred
Strong interpersonal, partnership and influencing skills - ability to interact with colleagues at all levels in a peer-like manner
Demonstrates strong analytical and end-to-end problem solving skills.
Takes accountability for completing deliverables, enjoys owning tasks
Excellent verbal and written communication and presentation skills,
Self-starter, drive for results, effective at prioritizing and managing multiple initiatives concurrently.
Very detail oriented and able to abstract detail and impact to a higher level
Independent, organized, self-motivated and a team player.
Ability to prioritize and handle multiple tasks effectively; be proactive in a fast-paced environment.
Possesses excellent judgment, knows when to escalate complex issues to management or functional partners with relevant expertise.
Adaptable to work in an evolving and changeable environment.
Proficient skills with the core MS Office suite (Excel, Word, and PowerPoint); Advanced skills with standard PM tools (e.g. MS Project); Familiarity with process-mapping tools (e.g. MS Visio, etc.) and query tools such as SQL
JPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.
We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.

Job Title: Product Owner, Data & Analytics Senior Analyst
Job Description:
Johnson & Johnson is currently recruiting for a Product Owner, Data & Analytics Senior Analyst. This position is located in Bridgewater, NJ, with consideration to other New Jersey J&J site locations.
Caring for the world, one person at a time has inspired and united the people of Johnson & Johnson for over 125 years. We embrace research and science - bringing innovative ideas, products and services to advance the health and well-being of people.
With $82.1 billion in 2020 sales, Johnson & Johnson is the world's most comprehensive and broadly based manufacturer of health care products, as well as a provider of related services, for the consumer, pharmaceutical, and medical devices markets. Employees of the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies work with partners in health care to touch the lives of over a billion people every day, throughout the world.
If you have the talent and desire to touch the world, Johnson & Johnson has the career opportunities to help make it happen.
Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees and committed to inclusion. Proud to be an equal opportunity employer.
Supply Chain IT Product Line Organizations are responsible for the product line technological direction across segments and serve as a critical point of contact for business and IT. Individuals in the product lines will work with Senior IT and Business Leaders to identify and prioritize solutions for their product line and oversee the consistent implementation of these solutions across the business. They will exhibit strong influence and passion for driving the organization towards consistent technology solutions aligned to an overall IT strategy. Product Line Senior Analysts will need to continuously maximize throughput of the various product line organization and ensure that value is realized by the business through the IT capabilities implemented. Product Line members should have a strong view of external IT capabilities in the market and how they can be applied to drive business value for J&J.
We are looking for an analyst that will be responsible for Quality Analytics, Intelligence, and Digital Services Product Line within Supply Chain Technology – Business Technology organization across all business segments (Pharm, Consumer, MD, CMD). This is a Global, enterprise role with primary focus on Quality, Compliance, and Labs capabilities.
This role is accountable to manage but not limited to the following global products and capabilities across all business segments:
Certified Analytics Solutions
Data Discovery
Control Tower
Intelligent Automation
These products are critical in the overall Supply Chain Quality processes. Product Owner Senior Analyst is a:
Technology strategist: Product Owner will be accountable to manage a product portfolio of Quality D&A systems including enterprise capabilities. This includes working with the QA and Supply Chain business teams to develop business processes, solutions and the respective roadmaps that allow us to deliver our products and services to the end customer in the most efficient way, driving value directly back to the business. The role will also have a strong integration back to other areas of Supply Chain and Regulatory compliance.
Technical scope of knowledge includes: Core Data & Analytics principles, Logical Data modeling, Master Data management, Azure, Teradata, Cloudera, Azure, Informatica/ETL, and RPA/BluePrism
Investment manager: In partnership with Product Line Owner and Senior Product Owner, defines priorities for business and associated technology investments,
Business-Product Strategist: Maintains a deep knowledge of business strategy and business processes. Drives business partners towards standard solutions aligning to a business strategy.
Program and Service Manager: Tracks progress of development in the context of the larger program. Reports back to the business on status on the delivery of features, functionality, and applications; has a combination of global and regional accountability.
Scrum Team member: Maintain and order product backlog and ultimately, prioritizes functionality for release. Participates in Sprint Planning by elaborating on stories. During sprint Review: Approves new stories and adds regular feedback and includes business/stakeholders in product reviews to gain direct feedback. Understands and collaborates on scope for MVP and acceptance criteria. PO participates in retrospectives, monitors sprint metrics, release metrics, and usability test results.
Talent Leader: Passionately owns and role models diversity & inclusion.
Innovative Thinker: Continuously thinking of the product and better ways to ensures adoption. Ensures that the next iteration is what the users need.
Customer Centric: PO is expected to monitor usage determines next steps based on triggers. Conducts surveys and feedback sessions to remain close to users
Product Owner will ensure that the full business value is realized by the business through the IT capabilities implemented. This individual will utilize a strong business acumen, strong teamwork, and excellent communication/information sharing to manage multiple priorities in a complex, high-profile, and rapidly changing environment.
The ideal candidate will have experience in correcting and implementing new processes and driving innovation in a large healthcare company. The role will have to manage contracted resources via a third-party and through other organizations. Experience in a matrixed environment and leading support teams is required.

Qualifications

Required
Minimum BS/BA in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology or equivalent required
3+ years of relevant IT program experience
Experience working as part of an agile Scrum team
Ability to influence, negotiate and communicate with both external customers and internal stakeholders
Excellent English verbal and written communication skills, including formal presentation skills
Ability to successfully manage multiple activities simultaneously
Experience in working with multiple competing stakeholders and priorities
Strong Business Acumen & Communication skill.
Deep knowledge of business strategy and processes, experience working across multiple levels of an organization, leadership skills, creating context around key business drivers and strategic plan.
Demonstrated ability to work with business partners to understand business requirements and define a data and analytics strategy and the associated capabilities.
Experience in effectively collaborating and managing stakeholders.
Technical knowledge of platforms and software technology.
Project Management experience in deployment of major IT capabilities (quality) across multiple sites and multiple regions.
Experience working in a Shared Services IT Operating model where development and support services are provided by shared services organizations that support multiple functional and organizational units.
Leadership experience in building teams with the above capabilities.
Preferred
Healthcare industry experience
Knowledge of the Quality Technology industry; IT CSV and GxP
Experience with Data and Analytics technologies including Azure Data Lake Services, Databricks, Informatica, Teradata, Tableau, Qliksense, Spotfire and others
Large program delivery of Supply Chain and/or Quality programs
Experience with rRDM for development of user stories
Track record of driving business value through information technology
Ability to pick up technical and business concepts quickly.
Supply chain process knowledge
Knowledge of Tech Based Innovation
Excellent understanding of product planning and management
Product Owner certification
Experience managing large, global, multi-location teams
Lean requirements gathering and story mapping experience.
Proactively creates and communicates deep industry and business insights
Ability to motivate in a team-oriented, collaborative environment, exceptional service orientation, strong negotiating skills
Able to create context around key business drivers and strategic plan, able to present ideas in business-friendly language

Why Mayo Clinic
Mayo Clinic is the nation's best hospital (U.S. News & World Report, 2020-2021) and ranked #1 in more specialties than any other care provider. We have a vast array of opportunities ranging from Nursing, Clinical, to Finance, IT, Administrative, Research and Support Services to name a few. Across all locations, you'll find career opportunities that support diversity, equity and inclusion. At Mayo Clinic, we invest in you with opportunities for growth and development and our benefits and compensation package are highly competitive. We invite you to be a part of our team where you'll discover a culture of teamwork, professionalism, mutual respect, and most importantly, a life-changing career!
Mayo Clinic offers a variety of employee benefits. For additional information please visit Mayo Clinic Benefits . Eligibility may vary.
Position description
Data Scientists at Mayo Clinic perform detailed analysis of large bodies of heterogeneous data in order to discover new patterns and insights having an impact upon patient health and augmenting human capabilities. Candidate has expertise in AI, machine learning, deep learning, statistical data processing, regression techniques, neural networks, decision trees, clustering, pattern recognition, probability theory and data science methods used to analyze data.
May work with knowledge architects, informaticians and clinicians at Mayo, and partner outside companies to develop and deploy applications to bring AI and analytic solutions to nontechnical users, often at the point of care. Applies and modifies existing scripts or software applications to support data management, data extraction, data analysis, and AI as required May develop predictive models on datasets to address various business problems by leveraging statistical modeling, operations research, machine learning, or data mining techniques. May provide Consultative Services to departments/divisions and/or support scientific projects under the guidance of a designated senior level data scientist.
Other responsibilities:
Provides data insights for business problems that can be approached with analytics techniques to collect, explore, and extract insights from structured and unstructured data.
Has expertise in the data science methods used to analyze data, and knowledge of data types, topics, and scientific challenges and approaches.
Executes analytical procedures in the framework of a specific project work request.
Creates or modifies scripts or software applications to support data management, data extraction and data analysis as required.
Contributes to the interpretation of data analysis and to writing reports.
Helps customers understand the data set and provide training and suggestions for improvement on the data request.
Leverages communication and interpersonal skills and works with subject matter experts
Presents findings in easy to understand terms for the business or clinical practice.
Qualifications
A Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as engineering, mathematics, computer science, health science, or other analytical/quantitative and a minimum of three years of professional or research experience in data science will be considered.
The preferred candidate will possess a Master's degree in a relevant field such as engineering, mathematics, computer science, health science, or other analytical/quantitative field and a minimum of one year of professional or research experience in data
Additional qualifications
Demonstrated ability to develop predictive models to address various business problems through leveraging advanced statistical modeling, machine learning, or data mining techniques. May provide consultative services to departments/divisions and committees. Demonstrated application of several problem-solving methodologies, planning techniques, continuous improvement methods, and analytical tools and methodologies (e.g. machine learning, statistical packages, modeling, etc.) required. Incumbent must have ability to manage a varied workload of projects with multiple priorities and stay current on healthcare trends and enterprise changes. Interpersonal skills and time management skills are required. Requires strong analytical skills and the ability to identify and recommend solutions, advanced computer application skills and a commitment to customer service. Experience with data modeling and date exploration tools.

Job Title: Experienced Financial Analyst- Information Technology & Data Analytics
Job Description:
At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. From the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity and inclusion are shared values. We’re committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that’s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.

Extracts data and compiles routine performance reports and assists with preparing variance analyses

Job Description:
The Data Operations Analyst is responsible for managing and monitoring Tinuiti's data supply chain, data quality assurance and cooperation with various internal and external stakeholders to deliver the best customer experience. This role will work cross functionally with Tinuiti's enterprise clients, internal teams, and partners to drive data solutions that power advanced analytics use cases.

Experience building and maintaining strong relationships with external partners
Organized and time conscious

Description:
About Lebermuth:
The Lebermuth Company is currently looking for a Regulatory Compliance Data Analyst to join our team. Lebermuth is a family owned, ingredient manufacturer, specializing in essential oils and custom-developed fragrance and flavor blends. We serve the personal care, home fragrance and fragrance/flavor reseller markets. Lebermuth’s culture is rich in family values, a trademark of our 100+ year history.
Lebermuth Benefits and Perks:
Elective Benefits:
Medical, Dental, Vision, Long-term Disability, Voluntary Life Insurance
(employee, spouse, dependent)
Company Paid Benefits:
401(k), Life Insurance, Short-term Disability, Employee Assistance Program (EAP),10 paid Holidays each year, Paid Time Off (PTO) after 30 days, Holiday Bonus, Annual Performance Bonus
Additional:
Competitive wages, gym reimbursement, Retention Bonus up to $1,000, Referral Bonus up to $750, Employee Recognition Programs, virtual yoga classes, free coffee, employee swag giveaways, Employee Engagement Committee, Company paid community volunteering opportunities, etc.
As Regulatory Compliance Data Analyst, you will be responsible for maintaining legal and regulatory compliance by researching, analyzing, collecting, and communicating regulatory requirements to provide the appropriate approvals to ensure Lebermuth can continually produce exceptional products for our customers and to safeguard product integrity and regulatory compliance.
. Requirements:
Essential Duties & Responsibilities:
Coordinates the collection and storage of ingredient supplier regulatory data for compliance
Interpretation of legislation for ingredients
Maintenance of Regulatory data/composition
Retains all supplier documents according to defined nomenclature rules
Interfaces with regulatory team members to ensure data collection &compliance for customer requests as needed
Participation in ongoing Regulatory team projects (i.e., new systems implementations)
Evaluate/Approve/Reject new and alternate suppliers of ingredients purchased by Lebermuth to ensure product integrity and regulatory compliance
Generates reports as needed to support internal/external customers
Coordinates, prepares and submits regulatory documents to customers and other external parties in a timely manner when/as needed.
Keeps up to date with existing and emerging regulations, standards, and guidance documents (IFRA, Cosmetic Regulation, Kosher, Organic, Fair Trade, etc.) to ensure Lebermuth can continually produce exceptional products for our customers.
Promotes a safe food culture by maintaining a clean and organized workspace, assisting with cleaning and sanitation throughout the production areas, and accurately completing Lebermuth required paperwork (i.e., equipment logs, regulatory documentation) to ensure the safe production and shipment of quality food products.
The job criteria may include other duties, responsibilities and activities, which may change or be assigned at any time with or without notice.
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Qualifications:
Education: Bachelor’s degree in science-related discipline is required. Master’s degree in a science-related discipline is preferred.
Experience: 2 + years direct regulatory experience in fragrance/flavor/cosmetic industry is required. Project Management experience required. Knowledge of Organic Chemistry is a plus. Flavor, Fragrance, and/or Chemical industry experience preferred. Knowledge of SQF, cGMP, and HACCP programs a plus.
Certifications: N/A
Functional Skills: Ability to apply mathematical concepts such as fractions, percentages, dosages, proportions and volume. Ability to solve complex problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists. Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram or schedule form. Integrates complex or diverse information; uses intuition and experience to complement data; designs workflows and procedures; prioritizes and plans work activities; uses time efficiently; sets goals and objectives; demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness; looks for ways to improve and promote quality; applies feedback to improve performance.
Technology Aptitude/Skills: Strong working knowledge and experience with MRP/ERP systems and familiarity with regulatory-related programs is a plus. Proficiency with Microsoft Office products, particularly Excel and Word are necessary.
Language Skills: Solid verbal communication skills. Ability to read, analyze and interpret professional journals, technical procedures, governmental regulations, and chemical hazard information and safety procedures. Ability to write correspondence that is professional in both content and tone. Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions.
Leadership/Behaviors Skills: Displays original thinking and creativity; meets challenges with resourcefulness; generates suggestions for improving work; develops project plans; communicates changes and progress; completes projects on time and on budget; balances team and individual responsibilities; exhibits objectivity and openness to others' views; able to build morale and group commitment to goals and objectives; Treats others with respect and consideration, regardless of their status or position; reacts well under pressure; accepts responsibility for own actions; follows through on commitments; observes quality, safety and security procedures; determines appropriate action beyond guidelines; reports potentially unsafe conditions.
Culture Match Behaviors: Enjoys and thrives in a fast-paced, high-growth environment, with a huge drive to create an impact while also being an effective listener, respectful problem-solver and a collaborative continuous learning team member.

Physical and Sensory Demands / Environmental Conditions / Equipment Used:
This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, electronic devices, photocopiers, filing systems/cabinets and fax machines.
This role frequently uses basic hand tools and other equipment to operate and/or perform maintenance and/or repairs on equipment.

Ability to listen to others, problem-solve, and respond frequently.
Ability to stand, sit, walk, climb, bend, stoop, kneel, crouch, reach, squat, twist, push, pull, and carry items frequently.
Ability to use hands and fingers to operate hand tools/equipment, reach, grip, grasp, twist as well as the ability to kneel, stoop, bend and crouch frequently.
Ability to use of vision abilities on a daily/frequent basis for close, distant, peripheral, depth and color recognition, with the ability to adjust focus.
Ability to handle raw materials, including essential oils, flavor/fragrance components and chemicals daily.
Ability to work in a manufacturing environment with fluctuating temperatures and noise levels.

Job Title: Marketing Data Analyst - Website Test & Learn
Job Description:
Company Description

Hi there! We’re Razorfish. We’ve been leading the marketing industry with our digital expertise since the start of the internet. But in 2020, we did a full reboot. What’s different? It all starts with people. Weird, wonderful, complex people - with diverse backgrounds in strategy, creative and technology. But no matter how different we are, we all have one thing in common. We believe our differences are our strength. So we push for inclusion, challenge convention and bring in new perspectives, to inspire new ideas. Because when we connect by understanding what makes people different, we can create unforgettable experiences that enrich lives. Join us at razorfish.com.

Job Description

This person will serve as a key day-to-day point for website testing as well as provide site analysis on a highly collaborative CX team within one of Publicis Groupe’s Power of One accounts.
Primary Responsibilities: Website Test & Learn
The majority of this role will be focused on developing tests to optimize on-site marketing experiences and path to purchase, across multiple lines of business on the account.
Work with multiple stakeholders to identify testing opportunities in line with business priorities
Develop test plans including bulletproof methodology
o time to stat sig., revenue valuation, audience size/business impact etc.
Monitor test launch; set up alerts to flag unexpected performance & work with internal & client team to trouble-shoot
Analyze results and make recommendations for optimizations or further tests
Present results live to internal and external stakeholders and answer questions in real-time
Incorporate additional data sources (e.g. registrations, campaign data) into analysis to augment findings
Collaborate with teams building/optimizing/reporting on existing pages to utilize test findings

Additional responsibilities include serving as the lead contact for analysis and reporting from Adobe Analytics for one line of business, including regularly-cadenced reports and occasional UX-focused analysis.

Primary Experience:
3-5 years of analytics experience, with significant knowledge of Adobe Analytics
2+ years experience with A/B and multivariate site testing
o Experience with A/B testing tools such as Adobe Target, Optimizely, VWO; Adobe preferred
Experience compiling test plans, justifications, results, and recommendations into presentations and presenting live to diverse audiences
Experience obtaining buy-in from multiple stakeholders with varying needs and skillsets
Experience & comfort working in a highly collaborative, fast-paced environment where priorities often shift
Solid understanding of foundational statistical methods including:
o Correlation scoring
o Weighted averages
o Testing statistics
o Variance scoring
o Estimating time to stat sig.
Additional Skills & Experience:
Advanced Statistics:
o Modeling foundations & applications a plus
Experience working with Adobe stack in other platforms and in conjunction with other marketing data
o Knowledge of BigQuery SQL a plus

Additional Information

Job Title: Data Solutions Analyst Insight & Analytics, KIPP Foundation
Job Description:
Company Description

KIPP
Great education transforms lives. KIPP, the Knowledge is Power Program, is a non-profit network of 255 college-preparatory, public charter schools educating over 100,000 early childhood, elementary, middle, and high school students. KIPP schools are tuition-free, public charter schools open to all students. KIPP schools, KIPP regions, and the KIPP Foundation are united by a common mission: Together with families and communities, we create joyful, academically excellent schools that prepare students with the skills and confidence to pursue the paths they choose —college, career, and beyond—so they can lead fulfilling lives and build a more just world.
The non-profit KIPP Foundation trains and develops outstanding educators to lead KIPP schools; provides tools, resources, and training for excellent teaching and learning; promotes innovation; and facilitates the exchange of insights and ideas within the KIPP network and with partners, including other charter management organizations, school districts, colleges and universities, and non-profit organizations across the country.

Why work at KIPP?
By working for the KIPP Foundation, you will work to advance equity and help students across the country receive the high-quality education they deserve. If you believe all children deserve great schools and programs where they can gain the knowledge, skills, and confidence necessary to achieve their dreams while making the world a better place, join us!

Job Description

Position Overview
The Data Solutions Analyst works to ensure KIPP regions have access to high-quality tools, resources, training, and professional development opportunities that build individual, team, and regional capacity to drive improved student outcomes through effective data use practices. The Data Solutions Analyst will work closely with regional teams to develop data infrastructure plans and implement technical solutions that support putting actionable data in the hands of KIPP leaders and teachers to support progress monitoring and decision-making.
The Data Solutions Analyst will report to the Senior, Data Solutions Architect and work collaboratively with teammates within I&A, IT, and across the organization.
Key Responsibilities and Duties
Partner with regional data leads to implement data systems, products, and solutions that support the collection, reporting, and analysis of quantitative and qualitative data (60%)
Develop scalable reporting tools and data trackers for progress monitoring that can be locally implemented and maintained within a region's existing data ecosystem
Craft technical solutions and outline specific infrastructure investments that should be prioritized to support greater access to critical KPIs tied to student outcomes and operational efficiencies
Research, identify, and potentially support regional implementation of solutions from third party vendors or consultants
Collaborate with KIPP Foundation and regional business owners and subject matter experts to ensure technical solutions and KPIs are aligned to regional policy and programmatic goals
Lead network training and resource development to improve the fidelity of data system, product, and solution implementation (20%)
Become an expert user in K12 products and systems commonly used in the KIPP network (e.g. PowerSchool, Illuminate, Schoolzilla)
Provide training to regions and schools as plans and needs dictate to ensure effective use of commonly used K12 products and system
Develop reference tools and other resources to support ongoing training and professional development
Support national data collection efforts (10%)

Work with regional contacts to triage data quality issues and implement process improvements
Support the creation of materials and webinars to train network users in high quality data submission methods
Provide policy input and business requirements to ensure high quality data submission and efficiency of collection efforts
Support day-to-day team activities, including but not limited to (10%)
Fulfilment of data requests, including grant submissions, secondary research, and ad-hoc data sharing
Documentation of projects and workflows
Quality assurance, data verification, and copy-editing activities
Planning activities, retreats, and cross-team work
Key Competencies
Achievement Orientation
Effective Communication
Critical Thinking and Problem Solving
Impact and Influence
Relationship Building and Stakeholder Management
Experience and Qualifications
Required Skills and Qualifications
A minimum of 3 years of experience designing, implementing, or recommending data architecture and/or systems processes
Interest and/or background in technology and management consulting
Customer-service orientation, with deep value placed on the end-user experience
Highly organized, with an ability to manage multiple short-and long-term projects simultaneously
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Comfort with ambiguity in a fast-moving environment
Knowledge of or interest in the education field.
Passion for KIPP’s mission and values
Other Preferred Experience
Bachelor’s degree
Knowledge of educational technology systems (e.g. SIS, assessment, and reporting platforms)
Experience with scripting languages (e.g. Python, R)
Experience using Excel and SQL for data management
Experience with data visualization and dashboarding tools (e.g. Tableau, Microsoft Power BI).
Experience with adult learning/training

Additional Information

Location
Flexible. May require up to 30% travel.
Compensation and Benefits
KIPP offers competitive salary commensurate with experience. A comprehensive benefits package, generous vacation and PTO, 401k retirement plan with both pre- and post-tax options, as well as gym reimbursement, flexible spending account (FSA), and cell phone reimbursement are also offered by KIPP.
KIPP Foundation is an equal opportunity employer and an organization that values diversity. People from all diverse backgrounds are strongly encouraged to apply.
*Please Apply Directly With On-Ramps*

On-Ramps is deeply committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion. We believe social change happens when people with a wide range of backgrounds, experiences, and identities come together with a common purpose. We're partnering with the team at the KIPP Foundation to build a diverse team that supports the advancement of their mission. We encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply.
CLICK HERE TO APPLY

Apply Now

Company Description

OUR COMPANY
Abercrombie & Fitch Co. is a portfolio of lifestyle brands including Abercrombie & Fitch, abercrombie kids, Hollister, and Gilly Hicks. Reaching customers across 120+ countries, we strive to create customer-centric, omni-channel experiences for our global customer base.
OUR VALUES
How do we do it? Every day, our associates show up and empower one another to stay curious and think big. As a team of relentless innovators, we aren’t afraid to dream boldly. We are accountable and aim to the highest caliber to understand, push boundaries and embrace change. We coach, mentor, care, and bring our best selves every day because we are in this together. Whether you lead yourself, a team, or the company, everyone is a leader at A&F.

Job Description

The E-Commerce team at Abercrombie & Fitch is the driving force behind all our innovative digital and omni-channel operations. This team is focused on developing, designing, testing, and implementing new and improved ways for our customers to experience the brands both in stores and online.

A critical element of our E-Commerce team is being able to identify and reduce fraudulent activity against A&F while preserving a class leading experience for our good customers.
The Fraud Data Analyst will focus on the analysis of customer purchase behavior and order data to identify fraudulent transactions. The ideal candidate will excel at:
Data analytics: have an established background of looking at large amounts of data to identify trends and troubleshoot problems
Root Cause Analysis: be able to interpret current state and offer direction to address root causes of issues as they occur
Being proactive: it’s important that we find fraud trends before they grow into larger more serious issues
Thinking broadly: the ability to understand broader business functions and make sure the decisions we make in the fraud space do not impact our good customer’s experience
Communication: by being closest to our data will mean that you will have insights before anyone else, and being able to organize and share reporting and insights daily is critical
Challenging processes: the desire to take initiative and challenge current processes to continue to move the needle
What will you be doing?
Analyze data to identify fraudulent transactions utilizing company fraud management system Accertify and supporting enterprise tools.
Troubleshoot issues with data driven decision making.
Developing and improving reporting to help focus attention where it matters most.
Real time monitoring of incoming orders to identify anomalies.
Work closely with internal and external business partners to share relevant findings and observations.
Recognize and implement process improvements.
Support the operational team by assisting with queues and special cases as they arise.
Assume additional responsibilities as requested.

Additional Information

ABERCROMBIE & FITCH CO. IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

Job Title: Senior Finance Analyst - Data Analytics and Reporting
Job Description:
HENKEL IS FOR THOSE WHO STEP UP. DO YOU?
At Henkel, you can make a difference and craft your career. That’s why you own your projects and take full responsibility from an early stage. Our unique brands in markets around the world open up countless opportunities to follow your convictions and explore new paths. If you have an entrepreneurial mindset that allows you to always think out of the box - take the chance and shape the digital future together with us.
YOUR ROLE
Beauty Consumer continues to develop our centralized Business Intelligence Analytics platform which is responsible for delivering insights, recommendations and supporting the day-to-day analytic needs and decision support to cross-functional departments and stakeholders.
We are looking for someone who wants to leverage financial data to solve and support complex business problems.
The Sr. Analyst will be reporting to the Head of Finance Director and work closely within the Finance team and cross-functionally with Sales, Marketing, Supply Chain and collaborate with stakeholders to achieve business objectives.
You will uncover surprising insights to engage customers and tell our story to current and prospective business partners.
If you're a 'get-things-done' individual who thrives in a fast-paced environment and wants to help build a best-in-class data analytics platform, then this is the role for you.
The Financial Analyst in Reporting & Analytics works broadly across all North America Beauty Care Consumer to provide automated and standardized reporting and analytics Management & ownership of financial reporting for the North American Beauty Care Consumer business through the NA Reporting & Analytics Power BI site Interface with all finance teams (Marketing, Sales, Supply Chain, Structural Costs and Canada) to provide best in class service of business intelligence.
Update month end reporting on all KPI's for the NA Beauty Care Consumer business units.
Support daily volume, customer level forecasts and sales and profitability reporting with the sales controlling and sales leadership team.
Deliver insights and recommendations to help stakeholders better understand business performance, customer behavior and support strategic and tactical decisions to improve outcomes.
Deliver and automate daily, weekly, and monthly financial reporting; design and build visually engaging and informative dashboards.
Present analyses and findings to stakeholders; 'telling the story' and identifying drivers and opportunities of business performance.
Conduct insightful, ad hoc analyses to investigate ongoing or one-time issues.
Actively participate in implementation and measurement of recommendations to monitor performance and impact.
YOUR SKILLS
Bachelor's degree, preferably in Finance, Accounting, Computer Science, Analytics, Math, or Statistics.
2+ years' experience in a business intelligence or analytics role with a strong focus on delivering insights and recommendations, creating engaging data visualizations, and building analytics capabilities to support business needs.
Proven experience building compelling and engaging data visualization and presentation.
Proven experience creating and automating reports and dashboards and working with enterprise data visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI preferred) Strong Excel skills, Power Point, Microsoft Outlook.
Power BI experience preferred.
Exceptional verbal, written and communication skills.
Familiarity on Agile and Continuous Improvement methodology will be a plus.
Collaborative and exceptional problem solving and critical thinking skills.
Entrepreneurial and results oriented.
Highly motivated, team-oriented person with distinct 'Can-Do' attitude.

Everyone wins if government works better. We provide innovative solutions and services to complex problems and processes. We apply our creative skill set and expertise to empower government. Job Description

Infina is looking for a passionate Data Analyst to turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions. The Data Analyst will conduct full lifecycle activities to include requirements analysis and design, develop analysis and reporting capabilities, and continuously monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements.
Duties & Responsibilities
Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
Develop and implement data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Filter and “clean” data, and review computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems
Work closely with management to prioritize business and information needs
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities

Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics
At least three (3) years of professional work experience with data analytics
Proficiency with data visualization tools; Tableau, Python, R, Looker
Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
Knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc.), databases (SQL etc), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks)
Skilled in using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS, etc.)
Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings
Use of analytic techniques such as classification, regression, similarity matching, clustering, co-occurrence grouping, profiling, link prediction, data reduction, and causal modelling, as well as experience developing and deploying automated processes
Ability to obtain a Public Trust security clearance
