Job Title: Operations Research Analyst (Data Scientist) / Computer Scientist (Data Scientist)
Job Description:
Duties

You will serve as a Operations Research Analyst (Data Scientist) / Computer Scientist (Data Scientist) in the FST LOGISTICS DIV of FLTREADCEN SOUTHEAST.

Responsibilities
You will provide and update business metrics, participate and offer inputs to established NAVAIR-sponsored analytical processes, develop innovative and effective approaches to solve unstructured complex analytical problems.
You will serve as a data analyst within assigned FST, plans and accomplishes assignments of considerable difficulty and complexity.
You will Identify data available and relevant, including internal and external data sources, leveraging new data collection processes.

25% or less - You may be expected to travel for this position.

No

13

Requirements
Requirements
Conditions of Employment
Must be a US Citizen.
Must be determined suitable for federal employment.
Must participate in the direct deposit pay program.
New employees to the Department of the Navy will be required to successfully pass the E-Verify employment verification check. To learn more about E-Verify, including your rights and responsibilities, visit e-verify.gov
Generally, current federal employees applying for GS jobs must serve at least one year at the next lower grade level. This requirement is called time-in-grade. Time-in-grade requirements must be met by the closing date of this announcement.
Within the Department of Defense (DoD), the appointment of retired military members within 180 days immediately following retirement date to a civilian position is subject to the provisions of 5 United States Code 3326.
Males born after 12-31-59 must be registered for Selective Service.
You will be required to obtain and maintain an interim and/or final security clearance prior to entrance on duty. Failure to obtain and maintain the required level of clearance may result in the withdrawal of a job offer or removal.
This position is covered under the Defense Acquisition Workforce Improvement Act (DAWIA). You must be certified as a Career Field Life Cycle Logistics Level I. Certification is required within 24 months of appointment.
Qualifications
GS-12: In addition to the Basic Requirements for this position, your resume must also demonstrate at least one year of specialized experience at or equivalent to the GS-11 grade level or pay band in the Federal service or equivalent experience in the private or public sector as a professional Operations Research Analyst (Data Scientist) / Computer Scientist (Data Scientist)performing some or all of the following duties: Skills in data collection, integration and retention requirements incorporating business requirements, and knowledge of best practices in order to develop predictive and prescriptive data analytics. Ability to use advanced operations research and computer sciences techniques (including statistical analysis, parametric and non-parametric techniques, decision theory, and optimization techniques), systems analysis, modeling and simulation, and other advanced analytics techniques such as feature engineering and extraction, classification, clustering, natural language processing, and various unsupervised data analysis techniques. Mastery of advanced programming techniques using the latest version of advanced data science software, with a focus on open-source language (such as Python, R, or Java); mastery of SQL and NoSQL, with a focus on distributed data storage and processing, using open source statistical packages as well as commercial analytic tools (e.g. Tableau, Qlik, Matlab, Power BI, Excel, etc.); and to apply data visualization techniques for presenting data and analytical results using various elements (graphs, charts, scorecards, dashboards, and presentations).Extensive knowledge of data-mining techniques and an ability to apply these techniques in practical real-world business issues to consider data, identify patterns, issues, or data analysis needs.

GS-13: In addition to the Basic Requirements for this position, your resume must also demonstrate at least one year of specialized experience at or equivalent to the GS-12 grade level or pay band in the Federal service or equivalent experience in the private or public sector as a professional Operations Research Analyst (Data Scientist) / Computer Scientist (Data Scientist) performing some or all of the following duties: Mastery of and skill in integrating multiple systems and data sets. The ability to link and mash up distinctive data sets to discover new insights. This often requires connecting different types of data sets in different forms as well as being able to work with potentially incomplete data sources and cleaning data sets to be able to use them. Mastery of advanced programming techniques using the latest version of advanced data science software, with a focus on open-source language (such as Python, R, or Java); mastery of SQL and NoSQL, with a focus on distributed data storage and processing. Mastery of and skill in applying broad areas of operations research, computer sciences, statistics, mathematics, modeling, data science, machine learning, and optimization sufficient to serve as an authority in a particular specialty and serve as a consultant and technical advisor to senior leadership. Mastery of and skill in applying data science and data analytics techniques to extract relevant information from historical datasets; apply innovative models for predictive learning and trend analysis; automate and optimize business operations; and visually present the results of analyses in graphs, charts, scorecards, dashboards, and presentations.

Applicants must meet the following positive education qualifications requirements of the Office of Personnel Management (OPM) Qualifications Standards Manual: Applicants must possess:
1550: Bachelor's degree in computer science or bachelor's degree with 30 semester hours in a combination of mathematics, statistics, and computer science. At least 15 of the 30 semester hours must have included any combination of statistics and mathematics that included differential and integral calculus. All academic degrees and course work must be from accredited or pre-accredited institutions.

1515: Degree: in operations research; or at least 24 semester hours in a combination of operations research, mathematics, probability, statistics, mathematical logic, science, or subject-matter courses requiring substantial competence in college-level mathematics or statistics. At least 3 of the 24 semester hours must have been in calculus.

Required Documents
You are required to provide documentation that supports the eligibility and qualification claims made in your resume and assessment questionnaire. You must submit the applicable documents listed here and those listed with the eligibilities you select in the announcement questionnaire with your application package. Applicants who do not provide supporting documentation that fully support their claims will not be referred to the hiring manager. Cover letter is optional.

A complete resume is required. Your resume must show relevant experience, job title, duties and accomplishments. Your resume must show complete information for each job entry to support minimum qualifications. The following information should be provided in your resume, but it is acceptable to provide elsewhere in your application package: employer's name, starting and end dates (Mo/Yr), hours per week, and pay plan, series and grade level (e.g. GS-0201-09) for relevant federal experience.TIP: A good way to ensure you include all essential information is to use the Resume Builder in USAJOBS to create your resume.

Are you applying for a promotion? If you are a current GS employee applying for a higher grade than the grade that you currently hold you must provide an SF-50 that shows that you have held the next lower grade for at least one year. Some SF-50s effective within the last 52 weeks will not demonstrate you have held the next lower grade for at least one year (e.g. General Adjustment SF-50 from this year). In many cases, we need to see two (2) SF-50s to determine time-in-grade and eligibility for promotion. If you are a DoD employee, you can obtain a copy of your SF- 50(s) from MyBiz.

Are you claiming membership in any professional organizations, or possession of a license, certificate or credentials? Check the Conditions of Employment section above to see if any are required. If you claim membership, license, certification, or credentials, you must submit a copy of said document in your application package.

Are you using education as a substitute for some or all of the experience requirement? Is there a basic education requirement for this position? Check the Education section above to see what is allowed and what is required. Any claims you make in your resume or assessment questionnaire regarding education or degrees MUST be supported by submitting with your application official or unofficial transcripts or a list of courses, grades earned, completion dates, and quarter and semester hours earned issued from your school. While unofficial transcripts are acceptable for initial application, an official transcript will ultimately be required if you are selected for the position. You may submit a copy your degree(s) if specific coursework does not have to be verified.

Are you a veteran claiming 5-point veterans' preference or claiming sole survivorship preference? You must submit a copy of your latest DD-214 Certificate of Release or Discharge from Active Duty (any copy that shows all dates of service, as well as character of service [Honorable, General, etc.] is acceptable) OR a VA letter that shows dates of service or service connected disability AND character of service. If you have more than one DD-214 for multiple periods of active duty service, submit a copy for each period of service. If you were issued a DD-215 to amend aforementioned information on the DD-214 you must submit that too. If you are not sure of your preference eligibility, visit the Department of Labor's website: Veterans' Preference Advisor

Are you a disabled veteran or claiming 10-point veterans' preference?
If you are eligible to claim 10 point veterans preference you must submit a DD-214 Certificate of Release or Discharge from Active Duty as described above for 5-point preference.

You must also provide the applicable supporting documentation of your disability (e.g. disability letter from the VA) as described on Standard Form-15 (SF-15). http://www.opm.gov/forms/pdf_fill/SF15.pdf.

Are you an active duty service member? Active Duty Service Members are required to submit a statement of service printed on command letterhead and signed by the command. The statement of service must provide the branch of service, rate/rank, all dates of service, the expected date of discharge and anticipated character of service (Honorable, General, etc.).

Documents submitted as part of the application package, to include supplemental documents, may be shared beyond the Human Resources Office. Some supplemental documents contain personal information such as SSN and DOB and some documents such as military orders and marriage certificates may contain personal information for someone other than you. You may sanitize these documents to remove said personal information before you submit your application. You must provide an un-sanitized version of the documents if you are selected.
If you are relying on your education to meet qualification requirements:
Education must be accredited by an accrediting institution recognized by the U.S. Department of Education in order for it to be credited towards qualifications. Therefore, provide only the attendance and/or degrees from schools accredited by accrediting institutions recognized by the U.S. Department of Education.
Failure to provide all of the required information as stated in this vacancy announcement may result in an ineligible rating or may affect the overall rating.
Benefits
Benefits
A career with the U.S. Government provides employees with a comprehensive benefits package. As a federal employee, you and your family will have access to a range of benefits that are designed to make your federal career very rewarding. Opens in a new windowLearn more about federal benefits.
Review our benefits
Eligibility for benefits depends on the type of position you hold and whether your position is full-time, part-time, or intermittent. Contact the hiring agency for more information on the specific benefits offered.

Help
This job is open to
Federal employees - Competitive service
Current or former competitive service federal employees.
Land & base management
Certain current or former term or temporary federal employees of a land or base management agency.
Special authorities
Individuals eligible under a special authority not listed above, but defined in the federal hiring regulations.
Clarification from the agency
Current permanent employees of DoD, Current or former time-limited employees that occupied a position located at a Defense Industrial Base Facility (DIBF) or Major Range and Test Facilities Base (MRTFB), DoD Military Spouse Preference (MSP) eligibles, and VEOA eligibles.

Farmer's Fridge is on a mission to make it simple for everyone to eat well. We serve healthy, handcrafted meals and snacks from our growing network of 400+ Smart Fridges (software-enabled vending machines). We are striving to change the food system from the ground up â€“ one Fridge or delivery at a time.
We are a team that cares -â€“ about the business, the impact our product makes, and each other. We are data-driven, innovative, and quick to move on a good idea. We are looking for people who want to collaborate in an entrepreneurial, inclusive culture and have a passion to succeed.
Farmer's Fridge is entering a period of rapid growth, and we are looking for a a motivated Business Data Analyst with strong technical skills and business acumen to help turn millions of potential data points into actionable insights that can drive product improvements, make our customer acquisition more efficient, improve our customer retention rates, and drive operating efficiencies on our production and logistics teams.
In a typical week, you will:
Collaborate with teams from the Marketing, Product, Engineering, Sales, Menu, and Finance departments to set internal benchmarks, develop critical metrics for new initiatives, and recommend continuous improvement strategies using data-driven insights.
Design, develop, test, automate, and launch new dashboards and reporting solutions across the company.
Maintain and support existing metrics, KPIs, reports and dashboards.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets and report findings and make recommendations to company leadership.
Work with the Business Intelligence and Engineering teams to understand existing internal tools and data warehouses and to identify data quality and reliability improvements and to establish best practices.
Support demand/inventory planning, sales and location forecasts, production planning, and predictive modeling efforts.
What are we looking for in a Business Data Analyst?
You love extracting, wrangling, organizing, and analyzing complex data sets to find a story that will enable better, faster, and more informed decision making across the company.
You believe learning should be fun and seek to empower each employee at Farmer's Fridge with the information, benchmarks, metrics, and insights that they need to be independently successful in their roles.
You strive for optimization, automation, and continuous improvement, knowing that what is currently being done can always be improved.
You are creative, flexible, and supremely detail-oriented but never lose sight of the big picture. It would never occur to you to say, "that's not my job".
You are comfortable in an environment of high-growth and ambiguity.
What background are we seeking for a Business Analyst?
Bachelor's degree
Experience in programming languages, preferably R or Python
Experience in SQL experience for data extraction, manipulation and analyses; including complex joins.
Experience in data visualization
Intermediate to excellent Excel capabilities (pivot, vlookup, VBA, etc.)
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing data
Strong prioritization and communication skills
High level of analytical and problem-solving skills with strong attention to details
Benefits at Farmer's Fridge:
Happier Weekdays - Walking into the office should fill you with joy, not dread. We're a fun and passionate group, and we don't take ourselves too seriously. Bring your unique self to work, dress comfortably, and always feel free to share your thoughts and opinions. We encourage curiosity and inquiry; there's no hierarchy here when we're all swapping ideas around the cold brew tap.
Never run on empty - Daily Farmer's Fridge meal, Monday bagels, draft cold brew, office snacks, and Friday happy hours are just some of the offerings to make sure you aren't distracted by a growling stomach.
Take a break - Check out what new products Chef is testing in the R&D kitchen, challenge a coworker to a game of Fridgeopoly, rally a spontaneous happy hour at Goose Island down the street, start a heated debate on the best M&M flavor with a poll in Slack, or jump in on a team kickball game!
Innovate & Elevate - We're all teachers and learners. You'll grow, and help grow the company through cross-functional collaboration, open access to leadership, and regular business updates. You have a direct impact on the bottom line. Own it. Literally - with company equity you have the opportunity to share directly in our success. You can also participate in our 401(k) plan that includes a company match with immediate vesting.
Farmer's Fridge is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity in all employment practices, including hiring, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, disability status, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.
View our disclosures related to External Agencies and Applicants below: https://www.farmersfridge.com/careerdisclosures

Company Name: The Maryland-National Capital Park & Planning Commission
Job Description:
JOB
The Maryland-National Capital Park and Planning Commission, Prince George's County, Parks and Recreation, Management Services Division, Data & Relationship Management Unit, is seeking to fill a Data Analyst position. This position will report to the Assistant Division Chief to integrate information from the vast amount of data collected in various systems, using advanced level database design and development.Behind the vast and diverse Prince George’s Parks & Recreation system that provides quality recreation programs, facilities, and services for residents and visitors there is a robust data infrastructure. The ideal candidate should be highly skilled in all aspects of data analytics, including mining, generation, and visualization using multiple data sources. Additionally, the ideal candidate should be committed to transforming data into readable, action-driven reports to support various department goals that align with the programs, facilities, and services we provide to the residents and visitors of Prince George’s County.

EXAMPLE OF DUTIES
Work closely with managers to understand their analytical needs, including identifying critical metrics and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and translating them to system needs and requirements.Proactively analyze data to answer key questions from stakeholders and communicate areas for improvement in efficiency and productivity.Work directly with management and staff to gather requirements, provide status updates, and build relationships.Lead the development and implementation of data warehouses to provide access to archive systems data and reports. Create strategies for data management and distribution; ensures data workflows are automated between disparate systems.Develop, implement, and maintain leading-edge analytic systems, taking complicated problems and building simple frameworks.Identify trends and opportunities for growth through analysis of complex data sets.Evaluate current workflows and provide source-to-target mappings and information-model specification documents for data sets.Create best-practice reports based on data mining, analysis, and visualization.Build and maintain rich, interactive visualizations through data interpretation and analysis integrating various reporting components from multiple data sources.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s Degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Geographic Information Systems or any related field.Four (4) years of experience in applications support and development.An equivalent combination of education and experience may be substituted, which together total eight (8) years.Depending upon area of assignment, a valid driver’s license in accordance with both State and Commission rules and regulations. Driver’s license must be unencumbered by restrictions, revocations, suspensions, or points that could limit the employee’s ability to drive Commission vehicles or perform driving duties required by the position of assignment.

SUPPLEMENTAL INFORMATION
Preferred Knowledge, Skills & Abilities: Proven analytic skills, including mining, evaluation, analysis, and visualization.Practical experience in statistical analysis through the use of statistical packages including COGNOS Analytics, and SPSS.Experience with various database and data types; testing and implementing various database versions Strong SQL or Excel skills with the ability to learn other analytic tools.Prior experience with Enterprise Asset Management (EAM), GIS, or other database.Strong understanding of PowerBI and other digital visualization software.Technical writing experience in relevant areas, including queries, reports, and presentations.Proven success in a collaborative, team-oriented environment.Specification: Information Systems Specialist III #1326

Job Title: New Business Development Associate- Data Analyst
Job Description:
The New Business Development Associate supports Customer Relations and Sales Management with daily sales operations and new business opportunities. Supports new customer qualification process including, but not limited to, Request for Information (RFI) and Request for Quotes (RFQ), project management and contract execution, contract compliance and updates as applicable. In this role, the New Business Development Associate will also support the organization to ensure customer communications in regards to product changes are managed in according to Oscor’s PCN process and in alignment with customer agreement.

The position requires interacting with existing, new and potential customers. The New Business Development Associate is one of the key liaison between customer and Oscor’s cross-functional teams to ensure customer experience, team interaction and project deliverables are in compliance with Oscor’s expectations while maintaining enthusiastic attitude and professional manner in a fast-paced working environment for successful project delivery, departmental financial performance metrics and be responsible for client interaction and requests as needed.
Duties & Responsibilities:
Customer Relations, Interactions and Deliverables
New Business Development Duties:
Coordinate the new customer qualification process including the research, creation, review and edit client-facing deliverables reports and engage in other written communications as applicable to relationship.
Support sales management with the customer management including assessment of customer classification, engage in customer presentation and able to actively participate in communication with clients.
Work with the executive and sales team on internal and external data collection to support the quoting process for new and existing customers.
Support departmental process enhancement which can impact the customers and department efficiencies.
Participate and support the negotiation and execution of the commercial, regulatory and quality agreements.
Effectively communicate (verbally and in writing) with customers and internal/external business units and stakeholders.
Review and understand internal requirements from other departments to support customer communications in reference to Oscor quality system, services and project deliverables.
Partake in new and existing business conversations and participate in various key customer meetings (MOR, PCN, QP, NBD and others as required).
Assist the Sales and Account Management Team on special customer assignments to support key project deliverables, support coordination between departments to ensure customer communication are in accordance to contracted scope and desired margins.
Provide support in monitoring operations and financial performance for adherence to customer contracts, quotes and operation plans.
Participate in the generation of trending of top customer key indicators (revenue, RGA, PCN, CAPA, cSCARS, MOR, Supply Chain Issues etc.)
Monitor customer performance for contracted obligations (forecasting, orders and revenue performance).
Supports the sales and marketing team with internal and external customer related campaigns, customer surveys, social medial product and service awareness and other marketing related activities as required.
Support and perform monthly department data analysis and monthly reports.
Participate in the design of the reporting environment including but not limited to Business units performance against annual goals and Customer performance against contracts
Process confidential data and information following guidelines.
Create reports from single or multiple data sets.
Research and collect data to special projects.
Participate data quantitative and qualitative analysis.
Support in the development and preparation of data reports, training materials, business presentations, and publications.
Participate in special projects as required.
Support Monthly Reports and Data Management Duties:
Provide management with sales performance reports and identify any analysis or data issues.
Perform proper quantitative and qualitative data analysis.
Generate Customer Performance against contractual obligations
Support in the development and preparation of data reports, training materials, business presentations, and publications.
Support PCN Duties:
Provide management with PCN and project status reports and identifies any delays or issues.
Coordinates proper execution of product change notifications to customers triggered by industry changes, suppliers, operational efficiencies or as required by management.
Supports all impacted stake holders with customer interactions resulting from PCN communications.
Support Audit Duties:
When required, serve as part of the Oscor audit team, supporting internal and external audits to ensure compliance with established quality systems, customer projects and contracts.
Customer Relations, Interactions and Deliverables

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college/university in a scientific discipline preferred.
o Work experience and/or a combination of work and education can be considered in lieu of a Bachelor’s degree.
 An Associate’s degree in a scientific discipline with 2 years of applicable experience is acceptable
 The equivalent of (4) four years related experience in lieu of degree is acceptable
3-5 years related customer relations
3-5 years data analysis quantitative and qualitative.
Excellent and effective communicator (verbally and in writing)
Experience in performing routine internal and external audits
Ability to clearly summarize and communicate data issues to the stakeholders.
Advanced proficiency in MS Word and Excel
Experience working in and implementation of EQMS systems strongly preferred.
Bilingual a plus

GoHealth is looking for a Data Analyst to join its Marketing Analytics team. You will use a combination of business and analytics knowledge to provide executive leadership with applicable insights to promote strategic decisions and maximize company-wide value. You will respond to the live needs of the business, and help create solutions and responses to questions as they arise. Because of the dynamic nature of the Marketing Analytics team, and this role in particular, we are looking for ingenious candidates with raw analytical horsepower, the ability to obtain logical insights from a variety of business contexts, and the ability to creatively develop solutions. You will be integral in supporting the Chief Marketing Officer.

Frequently cited statistics show that women and underrepresented groups apply to jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications. GoHealth encourages you to break that statistic and to apply. No one ever meets 100% of the qualifications. We look forward to your application.

Responsibilities:
Understand GoHealth's business processes, including the role each department plays in supporting the company's ultimate goals
Work with leaders to understand important value drivers and challenges within their departments and determine the important metrics and insights that can help improve performance as a result
Provide new insights to business leaders through a combination of descriptive and diagnostic analytics
Test hypotheses across data sets using measurable, statistical methods to evaluate best performing strategies
Build interactive dashboards and reports that provide insights that can be easily interpreted and applied by business leaders to help improve their performance
Collect and evaluate data to track project performance and important developments
Summarize raw data into digestible and applicable information
Think of new ways that data-based insights can help support GoHealth
Skills & Experience:
BS or BA degree in business, economics, finance, accounting, marketing analytics, MIS, computer science, engineering, or equivalent work experience
Less than 2 years of related experience in an internship or full-time role guiding strategic decisions using data and analytics
Ability to digest ambiguous asks and translate them into an actionable plan
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel (can perform complex functions)
Experience conveying complex concepts to colleagues with varying degrees of analytical knowledgeDesire to expand analytical and data visualization skills.
SQL, Python, and Tableau skills
Google Analytics, Tag Manager, and Optimize experience

Benefits & Perks:
Open vacation policy because we hire adults and treat them as such
401k program with company match
Employee Stock Purchase Program
Medical, dental, vision, and life insurance benefits
Paid maternity and paternity leave
Professional growth opportunities
Generous employee referral bonuses
Employee Resource Groups
Work from Home Stipend
GoHealth is an Equal Opportunity Employer
Due to the unprecedented situation of COVID-19, GoHealth has decided to protect our current and future employees by managing our business remotely. This is inclusive of interviewing, onboarding and each role day-to-day. Please consider that our roles will not be remote long-term and will return to an office setting once we're safe to do so following the guidance of local health authorities and the CDC
#LI-SR1

Emergency room visits and hospital stays can be uncomfortable and stressful times for families and their loved ones. DispatchHealth allows people to receive high quality and cost-effective medical care in the comfort of their homes. A rapidly scaling startup, DispatchHealth provides an integrated, convenient, high-touch care-delivery solution that extends the capabilities of the patient's care team and ensures that we provide personalized, quality care in the home or at the patient's location of need.
Technology and data drive all aspects of our business and allow for better care delivery from patient onboarding, patient care, and post care follow-up. We're looking to create a best-in-class technology platform that helps our patients stay in the comfort of their homes – and we're looking for people like you to help shape and build the technology that changes the way people receive healthcare.

Our Mission
Provide patient-centered care through the power of technology, convenience, and service.
Our Vision
Transforming healthcare by building a system of care in the home.
DispatchHealth is revolutionizing the healthcare experience by applying a unique approach focused on the "Quadruple Aim": better patient experience, better provider experience, lower costs, and better health outcomes.

Within DispatchHealth, the Data Analytics org combines a deep understanding of the business with analytical and technical capabilities to deliver insights and power data-driven decision making. This team is expected to identify the right areas to focus on and quickly enhance the quality of decision making in those areas.
The Data Analyst role is held by structured thinkers with the technical skills to decipher data and the communication skills to deliver insights effectively to leaders throughout the business. They are curious self-starters that understand the business and leverage SQL, Python, etc. to execute data analyses that drive the business forward. The role has high-impact and high-visibility potential, and performance is based on delivered impact. If you are energized by meaningful, challenging problems and the type that uses data first in decision making, we want to work with you!
Responsibilities
Own analytics for a portion of the business and / or product and advance performance by designing and developing metrics / reports / analyses / dashboards and driving action through effective communication and cross-functional partnership
Identify areas of opportunity and conduct deep-dive data analyses that result in high-quality insights and recommendations
Partner with others to strengthen – both in terms of approach and execution – decision making as it relates to high-priority focus areas
Collaborate with Data Engineers to inform data infrastructure and unlock data needed to power reports, analyses,etc.
Qualifications
Innate curiosity and business sense
Adaptiveness to excel in a fast-paced and often ambiguous environment
Collaboration skills to effectively partner with teams throughout the business
Strong communication skills and the ability to distill - both in writing and verbally - complex data sets into simple and digestible takeaways for both technical and non-technical stakeholders
4+ years of experience in roles where Analytics is the core skill
3+ years of experience BI tools such as Looker, Tableau or Power BI (experience with Looker is a plus)
3+ years of experience writing and debugging complex SQL queries
3+ years of experience working with relational databases

The pay range for this position in Colorado is $80,000 - $130,000/yr; however, base pay offered may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.
DispatchHealth is committed to creating and supporting a diverse and inclusive team and serving all communities. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment regardless of race, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, disability, age or veteran status. DispatchHealth offers a comprehensive benefit package, including medical, dental and vision insurance, 401k, paid time off, family and short-term disability leave.

Get to know us! Follow us on Facebook, Twitter and YouTube to learn more.

Product Data Analyst
Route is a one-click premium shopping experience for online ordering, and the only way to view all of your online orders, from any merchant, in one place. Online shoppers can insure and visually track everything they order online in one centralized app. E-commerce merchants from boutique brands to household names can add Route to their website empowering one-click solutions for their customers for shipping insurance, visual package tracking, and one-click claim handling. With offices in both Silicon Slopes, Utah (HQ) and Santa Monica, California, Route embodies a creative lifestyle partnered with innovative tech to build a one of a kind global brand.
About the Role
As a Data Analyst on Route's Product team, you will place quantitative frameworks around the products we create, our users, and our business. In this critical position, you will leverage studies and suggest data-driven solutions to enable your key partners to draw relevant conclusions across the product verticals. This role requires excellent attention to detail, the ability to work cross-functionally and to communicate effectively. You will be one of the closest thought partners to our Product Management leaders and be embedded in the product team to develop strategy, set and monitor goals, evaluate experiments, generate insights, and problem-solve using your data skills.
The ideal candidate for the role is passionate and ready to work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment at the intersection of e-commerce and technology.
What You'll Do
Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and data presentation to see beyond the numbers and understand how users interact with both our consumer and business products.
Identify the opportunities most important for our users and business to remove barriers for product adoption, retention, engagement, and monetization
Understand funnels, ecosystems, user behaviors, and long-term trends in adapting our products to identify opportunities for step-changes and angle changes in growth.
Implement event tracking across product verticals and define and analyze metrics that inform the success of these features
Design experiments to drive product direction with iterative innovation and measurement
Own data collection and product instrumentation implementation and quality assurance
Work with business, product, engineering, and design to influence and inform teammates' decisions throughout the initiative lifecycle
What You'll Need
Bachelor's degree in Business, Engineering, Statistics or a related field
4+ years of analytics experience in a consumer internet business or a high-velocity, high-growth product or business unit
Proven experience in behavior analytics tools like Amplitude, Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, etc.
Proficient working knowledge of data mining using SQL, data warehouses as well as Excel
Experience building dashboards, reports, or tools through technologies such as Metabase, Tableau, Looker, etc.
Experience in statistics (e.g., hypothesis testing, product experimentation, regressions).
Experience working with large data sets
Excellent writing and critical analytic thinking
Proven problem-solving skills concerning unstructured, uncertain problems
Ability to dive deep and demonstrate attention to detail
Bonus
Technical background and programming experience–especially R or Python.
Experience with product design or product wire-framing tools.
Experience with software development/coding and working closely with software engineers.
Benefits
Route offers an array of benefits including generous salaries, stock options, 100% healthcare coverage, and an unlimited PTO policy.
Route is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We embrace diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

Willis Towers Watson is looking to fill a position on our Data Management Team. The position will work with various teams within Willis Towers Watson to perform updates, testing, troubleshooting, and reporting on carrier data feeds. The position will utilize Microsoft Excel, SQL and internal systems to update carrier data in accordance with data received from carrier partners, specifically carrier partner applications and delivery of carrier partner enrollment files. In addition, the Data Management Analyst provides general knowledge to Carrier Data teams on system functionality and processes. The Data Management Analyst will work closely with internal teams to ensure that recurring issues are resolved through updating file exchange formats and processes. This position is responsible for being the technical experts regarding Enrollment Files, Enrollment Status files and Premium Files. The Data Management Analyst will vet work requests and ensure that all requirements have been provided in order to help resolve any concerns/discrepancies. Data Management Analysts track progress of tickets and projects from start to finish within established deadlines. The Data Management Analyst position is a carrier facing role where clear and concise communication is a must. The Data Management Analyst will also work with individual carrier account managers to escalate any issues that need attention from a Carrier partner. If you like working in a fast paced environment that has a flexible work at home schedule with a company that has great benefits and growth opportunity, then we might be what you are looking for. Apply today!
The Responsibilities
Accurately maintain a tracking log of active and unresolved issues for individual carriers
Work efficiently with multiple internal departments to assure smooth internal operations
Create and maintain technical specification documents by carrier
Maintain historical log of carrier requirements
Resolve escalated issues in a timely manner to promote customer satisfaction
Complete regular reconciliation process to ensure data integrity
Responsible for managing assigned queue and completing requests in a timely manner
Concurrently and effectively manage project work and service desk queue
Work with internal departments (call center, development, product, and client) to assure smooth internal operations
Help facilitate ingestion, manipulation, loading, maintenance, and delivery of data for new product and new carrier partners
Maintain data with the highest level of accuracy
Ad-Hoc reporting using SQL Server and Power BI
Have the ability to complete self-led learning
Maintain proactive communication throughout projects and daily tasks
Apply problem solving skills both technically and generally
Teach skills and processes throughout own team and internal departments
Project manage/lead for the Data Management Team
The Requirements
Medicare and Individual Family Plan knowledge
Self-motivated, highly analytical, organized and uncompromisingly detail-oriented
Advanced time-management skills and the ability to meet or exceed deadlines
Introductory knowledge of delimited file conventions, other industry standard data formats, data transmission methodologies, and Microsoft Excel
Proven ability to develop and improve processes to drive efficiency
5+ years of experience with Microsoft Excel
2+ years of experience with SQL (SQL Server or other) and use of ETL tools
Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to relate well to others and understand their concerns
Positive, proactive attitude
Technical documentation writing
Negotiation and conflict resolution skills
Data trend identification and resolution
Ability to work well with a team as well as on individually assigned projects
Proven ability to develop and improve processes to drive efficiency
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Consistent in meeting deadlines and following through on commitments
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
Note that visa employment-based non-immigrant visa sponsorship and/or assistance is not offered for this specific job opportunity.
Equal Opportunity Employer/Vet/Disability

The HubSpot marketing team uses data from a wide variety of sources to identify opportunities to improve our prospect and customer experiences. The Marketing Analytics, Reporting, & Strategy team is responsible for providing the marketing team with the data infrastructure and analytical expertise to drive the business with data driven insights.
As a Data Analyst you will be using data to make strategic recommendations to our leadership team about how to optimize website, SEO, and acquisition performance. You will be responsible for being an expert translator between raw data insights and business strategy and management. This role will offer you the opportunity to learn about a broad swath of HubSpot's business and become an expert in how to use data and statistics to improve the business.
In this role, you'll get to:
Utilize your analytical skill-set to evaluate business data and drive key business decisions
Conduct quantitative research and build forecasting models to develop insights and recommendations on business strategy to executive leadership
Vet and manage internal and external tools for SEO and website analytics and ensure consistency and accuracy across all data sources.
Support the CROs on experiment measurement and analysis using both our testing tool (Convert) and our internal data and visualization tools (Looker, Snowflake, etc.).
Collaborate with senior leadership to support strategic planning for the Marketing & Sales organizations

Hi, we're Oscar. We're hiring a Data Analyst to join our Insurance Operations team.
Oscar is a technology-driven, consumer-focused health insurance startup founded in 2012 and headquartered in New York City. Our goal is to make health insurance simple, transparent, and human. We need your help to do so.
About the role:
The Regulatory Reporting team at Oscar works in partnership with multiple teams (within operations and external to operations) to produce, document and extract data used by regulators to affirm that we always treat our members and provider partners fairly. We provide an additional layer of oversight over regulatory data deliverables and ensure continuity as our business grows. Our goal is to ensure that any evidence/data we submit to external regulators (1) meets specifications, (2) is subjected to QA processes, (3) is well documented, and (4) is reproducible for future data validation audits and objection handling. Our challenge is to ensure Oscar meets our growing regulatory obligations by designing, building, scaling, and improving on our data operations.
You will design and manage processes with a focus on de-risking our core operations, compliance and improving quality for core operational tasks. You will identify, scope, and implement development of foundational processes, scaling our regulatory operations, providing analytical support and summarizing the complexity of our data and operations into clear explanations to meet our regulatory obligations.
You will report to the Associate Director of Insurance Operations. This is a remote role, you will work remotely in one of the following states: AZ, CT, FL, GA, IL, MD, MA, MI, NJ, NY, NC, OH, PA, TN, VA. Note, this list of states is subject to change.
Responsibilities:
Lead development and implementation of clear, scalable and dynamic operational processes which support regulatory and audit requirements.
Develop, and prioritize operations roadmaps working cross functionally to implementation.
Lead and cross collaborate on iterative problem definition and technical scoping to build solutions to improve the efficacy and efficiency of existing operational processes or unlock new capabilities
Distill the requirements of new product and market expansions and design automated workflows to reduce manual work requirements
Support the Operations teams to resolve escalations through issue investigation, training, and technical tooling
Understanding of the operations ecosystem, technology and data models and its current strengths, weaknesses, and gaps.
Maintain relationships with relevant team members as a representative of Insurance Operations
Requirements:
A bachelor's degree or 3 years commensurate experience
3+ years of operations experience (process improvement, project managing, and lean operations)
3+ years of work experience in an Insurance/Financial Services environment
3+ years of experience using data software such as Excel, VGA, Macros, SQL or Python
Experience in knowledge management processes
Bonus points:
Experience translating regulatory requirements into business requirement
Background in policy or governance
Experience automating or designing data pipelines

We are seeking a customer service-oriented Data Analyst. A successful candidate will be an organized support specialist with experience implementing a new software application. What We Do

At Goldman Sachs, our Engineers don’t just make things – we make things possible. Change the world by connecting people and capital with ideas. We are at an early stage of modernizing our application stacks around cloud native principles, and migrating business workloads to the cloud. Company DescriptionSquare builds common business tools in unconventional ways so more people can start, run, and grow their businesses. When Square started, it was difficult and expensive (or just plain impossible) for some businesses to take credit cards. Square made credit card payments possible for all by turning a mobile phone into a credit card reader. Since then Square has been building an entire business toolkit of both hardware and software products including Square Capital, Square Terminal, Square Payroll, and more. We’re working to find new and better ways to help businesses succeed on their own terms—and we’re looking for people like you to help shape tomorrow at Square.
Job Description

The Reconciliation Team oversees all money movement at Square, ensuring that our merchants, and external financial institutions, correctly settle with Square on every transaction. We empower Accounting, Finance, Product, Analytics, and Payments teams by delivering accurate data that is crucial to Square's financials and provides early warning indicators for many product systems at Square.
As a technical analyst on the Reconciliation team, you will work with our users and engineering to design and test reconciliation pipelines; build Looker dashboards that support Accounting, Treasury, and product teams; and develop data pipelines to support early detection and alerting of anomalies.
You will:
Work with non-technical partners and product teams to understand their needs and come up with an automated end-to-end solution.
Translate requirements into applicable data requirements.
Design, curate, and document ETL pipelines to ensure accurate and reliable financial reporting.
Bridge the gap between requirements and ETL logic by troubleshooting data discrepancies and implementing scalable solutions.
Become an expert on Square's reporting platforms for development and visualization.
Maintain security and data access models within Square's reporting platforms.
Identify ways to improve existing reports and processes.
Teach and encourage others to self-serve while building reports that make it simpler and faster for them to do so.

Qualifications

You have:
Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field, or equivalent work experience.
4+ years of experience building reporting infrastructure and dashboards.
Understand complex business systems.
Create solutions with the willingness to fail fast and iterate quickly
Understand non-technical business customers' needs and translate them into automated reporting
Have attention to detail and a dedication to quality.
Strong technical accomplishments in SQL and data analysis skills.
Experience developing ETL pipelines.
Familiarity with schema design, query optimization, and data pipeline maintenance.
Snowflake, BigQuery, MySQL or similar data handling experience.
Bonus points:
Data Visualization experience, e.g. Looker, Tableau
Airflow experience
Experience with financial data, accounting, or auditing
Experience with Python or Java (automation/scripting)
Experience with Linux/OSX command line and git

Additional Information

At Square, our purpose is to empower – within and outside of our walls. In order to build the best tools for the businesses and customers we support all over the world, we have to start at home with a workforce as diverse and empowered as our sellers. To this end, we take great care to evaluate all employees and job applicants equally, based on merit, competence, and qualifications. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply and always consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records, in accordance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. Applicants in need of special assistance or accommodation during the interview process or in accessing our website may contact us by sending an email to assistance(at)squareup.com. Job Title: Cyber Data Analyst, Cortex Xpanse - West Coast
Job Description:
Company Description

Our Mission
At Palo Alto Networks® everything starts and ends with our mission:
Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life.
We have the vision of a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. These aren’t easy goals to accomplish – but we’re not here for easy. We’re here for better. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we’re looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity as we are.
As part of the Cortex organization, Expanse protects the world’s most important organizations by discovering risks on the Internet no one else can find. Expanse helps the world’s largest enterprises discover their attack surface and mitigate cyber risks. Our transformative technology is redefining the way that Fortune 500s view, measure, and invest in Internet safety.
We’re changing the nature of work. Palo Alto Networks is evolving to meet the needs of our employees now and in the future through FLEXWORK, our approach to how we work. From benefits to learning, location to leadership, we’ve rethought and recreated every aspect of the employee experience at Palo Alto Networks. And because it FLEXes around each individual employee based on their individual choices, employees are empowered to push boundaries and help us all evolve, together.

Job Description

Your Career
As a Data Analyst on the Attack Surface Analysis team at Expanse, you will use internal engineering tools to analyze data and deliver technical assessments of organizational cyber security for external clients and sales support. You will be a passionate and skilled ‘data diver’ who uses multiple tools and information sources to find unknown vulnerabilities across the global internet.
This position is located in San Francisco, CA; Santa Clara, CA; or other remote locations in the PST region.
Your Impact
Support pre and post sales by mapping out new networks
Partner with existing client engagements by answering technical questions and using internal engineering tools
Drive data analysis by rapidly prototyping new tools
Use internal engineering software to support pitch deck creation
Support sales team with technical assessments of network security for target customers
Write scripts to explore new use cases and satisfy customer requests

Qualifications

Your Experience
Must be fluent with speaking/reading/writing/understanding English
Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Math, Engineering, Computer Science, or other technical disciplines
3+ years of working experience
Experience with data analysis, statistics, and data visualization
Exposure to a scripting language (Python and SQL preferred)
Conceptual understanding of technical topics (e.g. mathematical concepts)
Results-driven and successful in a fast-paced environment
Bonus: experience in cybersecurity or related industry

Additional Information

Our Commitment
We’re trailblazers that dream big, take risks, and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It’s simple: we can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together.
We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with a disability. If you require assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need, please contact us at accommodations@paloaltonetworks.com.
Palo Alto Networks is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity in our workplace, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or other legally protected characteristics.
Salary disclosure required by sb19-085 for positions located in the state of Colorado: If hired in Colorado, this position starts at a salary of $74,500/yr. Sales roles are also eligible for incentive pay targeted at up to 100% of the offered base salary. Restricted stock units and bonus pay may also be offered as part of this compensation package, as well as benefits that include: flexible paid time off, employee stock purchase program, medical, dental, vision, 401K, life, and disability insurance. Job Description
Under general supervision, performs Computer Assisted Mass Appraisal (CAMA) system analysis for property valuation, performs mass appraisal updates to both land and improved properties, works with CAMA software support team to update cost tables and annual updates to system, performs system troubleshooting; generates reports and proposed steps to implement valuation techniques and methods to appraisers, supervisors and the Assessor; generates the Notice of Value files, certification reports and tax rolls; assists management in obtaining appropriate and accurate data for reports and analysis; trains staff in data entry processes within the CAMA system, provides assistance to the office with regards to statutory regulations and implements methodology for office procedures; heads up special projects as assigned; works with implementation teams on any conversion of software, and may be called upon to testify at hearings. Creates excel and report pulls and develops workflow processes: resolves technical issues and assures compliance with program goals and County policies. Responsible for Quality Control of work products related to the countywide reappraisal, new construction and sales data and performs other duties as assigned. Essential Job Functions and Responsibilities
~ Performs Computer Assisted Mass Appraisal (CAMA) system and data analysis for property valuations; assists management in obtaining appropriate and accurate data for reports and analysis; and generates a variety of required and/or requested data reports.
~ Performs mass appraisal updates to both land and improved properties.
~ Works with CAMA software support team to update cost tables and annual updates to the system.
~ Works with implementation teams on any conversion of software.
~ Develops training process and procedures for the CAMA system, trains staff in data entry processes and workflow within the CAMA system.
~ Work with appraisal staff to develop land codes and market adjustments to the improvements cost module.
~ Analyze land markets and set values for land.
~ Performs system troubleshooting; identifies problems within the system and takes corrective measures to obtain correct and accurate data.

~ Schedules, maintains, and updates upcoming protest meetings.

~ Generates the Notice of Value files and tax rolls; certification reports to the state, provides assistance to the office with regards to statutory regulations and implements methodology for office procedures; coordinates special projects as assigned or directed.

~ Meets regularly with staff to discuss and resolve workload issues, establish priorities, clarify tax code interpretation and documentation standards, and resolve technical issues.

~ Develops logistical plans for reappraisal program functions, including work cycles, geographic areas, document review and preparation, and technical training for staff.

~ Establishes quality controls, including technical procedures, performance guidelines, accuracy standards, field review, and CAMA (Computer Assisted Mass Appraisal) system data management.

~ Works with property owners to coordinate access issues and resolve problems; performs public relations functions to promote reappraisal process and report on progress of special projects.

~ Monitor operations in order to anticipate technical and management problems, and recommend changes to improve reappraisal program planning and functions.

~ Review and analyze property valuations; establish quality control procedures and statistical measures to assure property values are based on appropriate market analysis.

~ Assure maintenance of all property assessment records in accordance with New Mexico statutes for the retention of public records.

~ Stay abreast of current and proposed statutory regulations and requirements, technologies, valuation methods and market conditions.

~ Perform other related duties as assigned. Minimum Qualifications
~ A High School Diploma/GED Certificate
~ One year of experience in the area of assignment, which includes direct work experience with Computer Assisted Mass Appraisal (CAMA) or related software programs for the valuation of various property classifications, knowledge and experience working with various report databases and ability to understand how databases work., experience with appraisal techniques, practices and procedures involved in the valuation of various property, and knowledge of the state statutes related to property taxes; OR an equivalent combination of education, training and experience
~ Valid New Mexico Driver"s License.

~ International Association of Assessing Officers (IAAO) training and certifications I, II, III and IV OR equivalent education experience in appraisal or real estate.

~ IAAO I, II, III & IV certifications required within four years of hire if no IAAO certifications have previously been obtained (contingent upon availability of training). Functional Analysis
Physical Functions - ~ Work is performed in a standard office environment and in the field to train and evaluate properties.

~ Operates a County vehicle to perform property inspections; drives to meetings and training as required.
~ Occasional exposure to inclement weather, varied terrain and animals while working in the field. Knowledge and Skills
~ Operational characteristics, services, and activities of the Office including business and industry principles and practices related to work assigned.

~ Appraisal principles and procedures, techniques, and market analysis in area of assignment.

~ State laws, rules, and regulations governing the valuation and assessment of real and personal property for tax purposes.

~ Various software systems and report databases including SQL, Computer systems and specialized software applications, including Computer Assisted Mass Appraisal (CAMA), Geographic Information System (GIS), and other proprietary systems, Word, Excel, and other related computer databases.

~ The local area of Torrance County Advanced arithmetical computations adequate to correctly value property.

~ Guidelines and statutes effecting property assessment including familiarity with Marshall and Swift Valuation Manual.

~ Principles and practices of land planning, surveying, and mapping.

~ Principles of record keeping and records management.

~ Techniques for compiling and preparing spreadsheets, word processing and statistical databases.

~ Federal, state, and local laws applicable to area of assignment.

~ Effective communication principles and practices including oral and written communication to include public relations and public speaking.

~ Modern office procedures, methods, and equipment including computers, computer applications such as word processing, spreadsheets, and statistical databases

~ English usage, spelling, grammar, and punctuation.

~ Principles of business letter writing. Disclaimer
The duties listed above are intended only as illustrations of the various types of work that may be performed. The omission of specific statements of duties does not exclude them from the position if the work is similar, related, or logical assignment to the position. Application Special Instructions
Attach a copy of your diploma, degree or appropriate transcripts to each application

Details
POSTING TITLE: Analyst – Data Transformation
Kemper is one of the nation’s leading specialized insurers. Our success is a direct reflection of the talented and diverse people who make a positive difference in the lives of our customers every day. We believe a high-performing culture, valuable opportunities for personal development and professional challenge, and a healthy work-life balance can be highly motivating and productive. Kemper’s products and services are making a real difference to our customers, who have unique and evolving needs. By joining our team, you are helping to provide an experience to our stakeholders that delivers on our promises.
POSITION SUMMARY:
Working closely with business and technical partners, this analyst will prepare data for development of complex dashboards and reports that provide key business insights for the Claims organization to drive results and support strategic initiatives. You will have the opportunity to showcase and develop your development and presentation skills to tell a story with a wide variety of data that will be used to measure results and shape the behaviors for the organization. As a key member of a fast-paced team in a growing company, you will work on multiple projects and workflows that leverage and expand your knowledge of data transformation along with your query, relational database and analysis skills. Growth opportunities in this role will focus on increasing technical development skills, incorporating cloud-based tools and building operational acumen (i.e. learning claims processes, financials and key performance indicators.) This role will also learn to provide coaching and development assistance to other members of the team. Over time a successful candidate will learn how to navigate the organization independently both inside and outside of Claims. As a result, a candidate can expect to learn about Claims, Actuarial and Product Management processes and roles.
PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Prepare data for analysis, reports, and dashboards – providing solutions that utilize data to provide business intelligence to key business partners across the organization.
Transform and curate data from multiple sources which will vary in size and structure to present internal and external data using consistently formatted views allowing users to easily find and understand results specific to their business function.
Build and maintain extracts to populate underlying data-marts using tools like Informatica and Python. Maintain relationship with database teams to adapt to changes and enhancements to underlying data schemas.
Create technical specifications and complex solutions based on business requirements. Provide guidance on options for summary and detail presentation views that can be best utilized to answer specific business questions.
Responsible for team coordination of the change-management process on existing dashboards.
Schedule and monitor multiple refresh schedules. Build error handling notifications and processes.
Assist with the maintenance and support of existing report processes across multiple distribution channels and schedules.
Document code and workflows to facilitate transparency and operational continuity.
Works independently with limited direction from supervisor

MINIMUM JOB REQUIREMENTS
Bachelors degree in business analytics, computer science or a related field, or the equivalent in related work experience.
3+ years of experience in developing data structures and ETL processes to support reporting solutions.
Demonstrated experience with data source creation and scheduling for reporting tools.
Demonstrated experience in database modeling and data warehouse architectures such as Kimball or Inmon approaches
Demonstrated knowledge of data processing tools like Informatica or SSIS and design principles related to ensuring data quality and performance.
Experience combining and presenting large and complex data sets; able to write queries and create calculated fields.
Experience with data query languages and tools. Functional knowledge of relational databases and combing disparate data sets.
Understanding of the functional areas of insurance, especially claims terminology and concepts, is preferred.
Experience with cloud-based data warehousing with tools such as Snowflake and AWS.
REQUIRED JOB SKILLS:
Expert level data transformation skills using SSIS, Informatica, or other tools
Experience with Python coding
Experience with AWS or another cloud-based platform
Advanced skills in designing data structures such as data marts for reporting.
Advanced computer skills in Excel including pivot tables, lookups, macros and array processing. Experience with VBA a plus.
Advanced ability to extract data using SQL, Informatica, Python, R, Informatica or similar tools.
Demonstrated understanding of the collection of data and the concepts behind relational databases.
Clear, concise and effective oral and written communication skills.
Ability to present results within and outside of team to users of various technical knowledge.
Consistently demonstrate constructive critical thinking and problem solving.
Demonstrated ability to handle multiple competing priorities effectively.
Experience documenting development processes and codebase, both for ease of support and inclusion in a re-usable knowledge base.
The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel so classified. The incumbent must have the abilities or aptitudes to perform each essential function proficiently with or without reasonable accommodation. Our organization has a dynamic work environment where positions evolve and change. Therefore, the Company reserves the right to modify, delete, or add job duties, responsibilities and skills that are stated in this job description at any time.
Kemper is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, disability status or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. We are committed to supporting diversity and equality across our organization and we work diligently to maintain a workplace free from discrimination.

Job Title: Benefits Data Analyst & Advisor
General Definition: This role will provide data driven recommendations to senior leadership of the Department of Interior Services as it pertains to human capital, employee benefit plans, policy changes, FY budgeting and other financial initiatives.
Supervision Received: Director, Financial Performance & Defined Contribution Plans, Human Resources/Benefits
Supervision Exercised: None
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Training and Experience:
· Three to five years of experience in analyzing/reviewing medical and pharmacy claims data strongly preferred.
· Four plus years of experience in budgeting, financial reporting, and/or forecasting strongly preferred.
· Four plus years of progressive utilization or relevant technologies such as: IBM Cognos, TM1, Great Plains, etc., is strongly preferred.
Education:
· Master’s Degree in Business, Finance, Accounting, or related field strongly preferred.
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
· Advanced knowledge in Financial Performance Management (FPM) and budgeting process.
· Advanced understanding of FPM technology and business.
· Advanced knowledge of business analysis, accounting and finance fundamentals, policies, controls, best practices, budgeting, forecasting, database management, management reporting and analysis tools/systems.
· Advanced knowledge of all Microsoft Office software (Project, Access, Excel, Word, Power Point, Outlook, etc.).
· Advanced knowledge in Cognos Business Analytics planning solutions.
· Must have the ability to lead and assist a wide range of customers from the Executive level to client facing employees, in meeting their business objectives.
· Demonstrate exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
· Ability to calculate figures and amounts such as financial ratios, allocations, and other metrics.
· Ability to find practical solutions while analyzing complex data and managing complex projects.
· Ability to read/interpret medical and pharmacy claims data and make suggestions based on this information.
· Highly organized with exceptional prioritization skills.
· Demonstrate exceptional business skills including excellent analytical skills, decision-making/problem-solving skills, and forecasting skills.
· Recommend employee benefit programs by examining, evaluating, and optimizing employee understanding, acceptance, and interests, costs, regulatory requirements, and competitive advantage.
· Must be able to work various hours as needed, including weekends and holidays (daily as well as extended travel is inherent to this job function).
Licenses/Certifications/Other:
· CMA, CFA, or CPA certification preferred.
· Must be able to pass background check and receive a gaming license from the Chickasaw Nation office of the Gaming Commission as required to work in gaming operations.
· Must possess a valid driver’s license.
· Must be able to complete pre-employment drug test with a negative result.
Essential Job Functions:
· Design implement and manage the fiscal year budgeting process for the Division of Benefits. Such duties will entail:
· Maintain employee confidence by keeping benefit information confidential.
· Provides management planning and control information by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing employee benefit data and trends.
· Develop expenditure forecasts in order to prepare the appropriation budget for the fiscal year.
· Continuously monitor/engage with departments concerning budget to actual analysis and reporting during the fiscal year.
· Utilize financial, accounting, and human resources software/data (e.g. IBM Cognos, TM1 Perspectives, Great Plains, and EAN/EVN Workflow, Kronos).
· Apply complex financial ratios to data in order to develop descriptive as well as predictive models.
· Prioritize the budgetary proposals of leadership and allocate restricted funds in accordance with the objectives the Department of Interior Services.
· Prepare narrative and graphical reports to ensure senior management has a complete view of the budget/forecast variances including historical, current and future projections.
· Lead in efforts to produce or validate business cases for an array of projects such as RFP’s, process changes, benefit plan design changes, etc.
· Perform financial analysis, statistical analysis, variance analysis, trend analysis, feasibility analysis, and scenario analysis.
· Conduct internal as well as external research with the intent of becoming a subject matter expert.
· Coordinate partners throughout and at all levels of the organization.
· Ensure proper assessment is made of positive/negative financial implications of business proposals and identify positive/negative externalities.
· Responsibility to oversee the process as well as decide the best course of action regarding capital investment and allocation. Specific obligations include:
· Analyze and protect sensitive data/information (e.g. payroll information, contracts, and tentative long term / short term plans of leadership).
· Collaborate with other entities that are integral to the decision making process (e.g. human resources, compensation, Commerce, payroll, and accounting).
· Create new opportunities and support existing initiatives relating to employee benefits and human resource initiatives.
· Understand and synthesize data from an array of sources (e.g. Kronos, Stream-It/eRequester, Cognos, Insurance providers, benefits vendors, etc.) then extrapolate metrics to derive decisions.
· Explore the perceived issues of departments and present innovative solutions. Solutions could involve the acquisition of technology, capital assets, process engineering, or reorganization/realignment.
· Deliver strategic long-term financial planning for health benefits, 401(k), and human resources
· Construct complex economic business models to forecast financial impact and sustainability of proposed changes in healthcare benefits, 401(k), and other changes within HR/Benefits.
· Perform all other duties as assigned.

Understand data visualization techniques and libraries and their applicability to business problems.

The Team

Analytics & Cognitive

In this age of disruption, organizations need to navigate the future with confidence, embracing decision making with clear, data-driven choices that deliver enterprise value in a dynamic business environment.
