Description:
How have you impacted someone's life today? At Hackensack Meridian Health our teams are focused on changing the lives of our patients by providing the highest level of care each and every day. From our hospitals, rehab centers and occupational health teams to our long-term care centers and at-home care capabilities, our complete spectrum of services will allow you to apply your skills in multiple settings while building your career, all within New Jersey's premier healthcare system.

Assist in resolving coding and billing edits that are holding patient claims from final billing. Maintain the integrity of Charge Description Masters (CDM) and Revenue Integrity Systems Programs. Maintain the integrity of all Ancillary Department systems related to billing and revenue. Position will serve as liaison between Administration, and Ancillary Department Directors regarding revenue and compliance issues. Position will coordinate all retrospective, concurrent, internal billing audits. Provide monthly audit results. Develop and coordinate educational in-services to the Business Office staff and Ancillary staff related to charging and billing issues. Review denial trends for documentation or charging issue opportunities. Review high charge stays/procedures for charging accuracy. Ensures web tool (unbilled) items are addressed properly and timely.

Responsibilties:
A day in the life of a Clinical Data Analyst at Hackensack Meridian Health includes:
Serves as charge master liaison assistant to include regular reviews of CPT codes, Revenue Codes, review of monthly standard CDM error report, and communicates with Ancillary Departments to resolve issues.
Applies quarterly Medicare updates as applicable to JFK line of business.
Works with the Revenue Integrity Specialist to incorporate the mandated changes with the effected departments.
Updates the CDM to reflect changes in a timely manner.
Demonstrate a working knowledge of mandated billing, coding and regulatory rules by reading and attending web based education session, reading transmittals and applicable CMS educational materials.
Validates precert/referral number and all its requirements prior to scheduled procedure. (72 hours prior) Work with test performing department and the credit team to ensure accuracy of all related elements.
Maintains and distributes the daily compilation of precert issues to the team.
Participates in the monthly issue reconciliation related to this process.
Compiles and scans all associated documents to ensure the ability to retrieve for future needs including audit compliance.
Analyzes and resolves patient claims being held by Billing edits, Medical necessity, Corrects Coding Initiative, Outpatient Code Editor(OCE), Inpatient Code Editor, Self Administered and other claims requiring technical coding and billing expertise.
Interacts with ancillary departments to obtain additional information needed to properly bill accounts.
Recommends systemic enhancements to mitigate future edits.
Identifies charging, coding, or clinical documentation issues and works with ancillary departments to resolve issues and notifies appropriate leadership.
Performs assigned Revenue Cycle related audits by researching clinical documentation, analyzing data, and developing recommendations to improve reimbursement and cash flow.
Completes as needed specialized and ad hoc reports including data analysis.
Other duties and/or projects as assigned.
Adheres to HMH Organizational competencies and standards of behavior.

Qualifications:
Education, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required:
High School Diploma or Equivalency.
PC Literate.
Education, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Preferred:
Healthcare experience and Clinical experience.
If you feel that the above description speaks directly to your strengths and capabilities, then please apply today!

Deloitte Transactions and Business Analytics LLP advises clients on managing business controversy and conflict, executing deals, and maintaining regulatory compliance. We provide services to companies throughout their lifecycle from purchasing a company to investigating potential fraud.

The Team

In 2008, Deloitte Transactions and Business Analytics LLP (DTBA) opened a new facility in Nashville, TN for e-discovery and computer forensics work. DTBA's E-Discovery Solutions Center ("EDSC") continues to increase the capacity, quality, and efficiency of DTBA' s e-file processing by utilizing state-of-the-art technology in a dedicated environment. We are looking for dedicated individuals to join DTBA's Discovery & Data Management practice and help drive the success of the EDSC.

The EDSC is a 24x7, 365 days a year operation. The position is located in Hermitage, Tennessee.

The hours for this role will start off as regular weekday hours (Monday - Friday) from 8:00 - 5:00 pm CST or 10:00 - 7:00 pm CST. Flexibility to help cover the 2 nd shift and weekends as needed is required. 2nd shift is 12:00 am - 9:00 pm CST (Monday - Friday) and the Weekend Shift is Saturday and Sunday is 8:00 AM - 6:00 PM.

Work you'll do:
Learn Data Intake procedures pertaining to forensic applications and concepts
Track and record project workflow and milestones as required
Maintain chain of custody during transfer of physical evidence
Perform data transfers preserving original metadata of native files
Prepare client data deliverables
Perform quality control of work product
Provide regular project status and issues updates to Data Intake management team
Attend team meetings and assist with meeting preparation
Assist Data Intake management with various administrative tasks (e.g. scheduling)
Assist in the coordination with other EDSC teams to appropriately plan engagements to meet client deliverables/timelines, resolve specific issues, and improve overall quality and efficiency

Qualifications:

Required
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Availability to work under tight deadlines in fast-paced data production environments
Ability to complete required documentation: Chain of Custody, Digital Evidence Collection reports, etc.
Ability to perform troubleshooting and learn customized proprietary software along with other emerging technologies
Ability to read and interpret safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals
Ability to update, edit or create documentation on Data Intake processes and workflows
Some college or equivalent work experience
Travel up to 5% (While 5% of travel is a requirement of the role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice)
Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future

Preferred
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Working knowledge of basic PC functions and Windows environment
Knowledge of networking, systems concepts, and FTP
Knowledge of the accepted standards for digital evidence handling
An understanding of principles of forensic integrity in information acquisition, analysis, and reporting
Experience with forensic hardware (e.g. hardware write blockers)

In this age of disruption, organizations need to navigate the future with confidence by tapping into the power of data analytics, robotics, and cognitive technologies such as Artificial Intelligence (AI). The team

Our team supports all phases of analytic work product development, from the identification of key business questions through data collection and ETL, and from performing analyses and using a wide range of statistical, machine learning, and applied mathematical techniques to delivery insights to decision-makers. Our practitioners give special attention to the interplay between data and the business processes that produce it and the decision-makers that consume insights.

2+ years of experience with programming languages such as Python, R, SPSS, SAS, SQL
2+ years of experience with data visualization tools, such as Tableau, Qlik, PowerBI, or equivalent

Prior professional services or federal consulting experience

E xperience with ETL, NoSQL Apache Hadoop, and cloud computing technology, especially Microsoft Azure

Reporting to the Senior Director of Payer Solutions, the Business / Data Analyst will be responsible for the facilitation and logistics of project communications. They are also responsible for tracking issues and risks within the project, as well as working in design sessions to capture and clarify program requirements.
What you will be doing:
This position will work closely with the program s Director of Implementation to manage timely and accurate project communications.
A key ability for this role is to gather and clarify business needs from customer meetings and design sessions, then work with project stakeholders to refine those into actionable requirements.
The successful candidate will coordinate the logistics for project status meetings, design sessions, and ensure the consistency of the project s requirements and documentation.
Will work closely with the project team to maintain and deliver high quality project documentation that aligns to project requirements as well as to company strategy, commitments, and goals.
Will work closely with the customer, presenting documentation and requirements to the project owner and key stakeholders in a clear and timely manner.
Supports the Implementation Director by facilitating and scheduling program meetings, both internal and with the customer.
Captures critical information from meetings and design sessions, and communicates these out to the project teams.
Owns meeting agendas and meeting notes, and is responsible for maintaining the issue log and risk register for the implementation phase of the program.
Listens to customer needs and internal project team limitations, and works within the project team to document these into formal business requirements.
Supports the Implementation Director in maintaining the program scope, goals, and deliverables as tracked in the project management artifacts (project schedule, management plan, RTM, etc.).
Works closely with internal workstream leads to disseminate customer requirements, and clarify them based on workstream feedback.
Develops expertise as the maintainer of knowledge regarding program deliverables, and business and technical design.
Supports the Implementation Director in monitoring and reporting on the progress of the program to all stakeholders, and facilitates escalation of issues and risks promptly.
Helps to ensure timely sign-off on all requirements and deliverables for the program.
Ensures program documents are complete, current, and stored appropriately.
What you bring:
Experience in coordinating project activities, and gathering business requirements.
Experience in managing formal documentation reviews with multiple stakeholder groups.
Strong analytical, organizational, and collaboration skills.
Strong critical thinking and problem solving skills, with significant attention to detail.
The ability to effectively communicate including strong written, verbal and presentation skills to a wide range of audiences.
Ability to explain technical terms in everyday language.
The ability and willingness to complete several concurrent tasks with attention to time constraints, quality and sufficient detail.
Proficiency in project management software (Microsoft Project), issue management systems (Atlassian Jira, or equivalent), collaboration software (Microsoft SharePoint, Atlassian Confluence, or similar), and office document software (Microsoft Excel, Word, Visio, etc.).
Two to five years of project management experience and/or client implementation experience, preferably in the healthcare industry.
Two to five years of experience gathering formal business requirements from customers.
One to two years of experience using document management systems and collaboration software platforms.
One to two years of experience working in JAD sessions to understand customer needs and capture requirements for refinement, review, and approval.
Bachelor's degree in Business, Information Systems, Healthcare, or related fields.
Technology background a plus.
Ability to travel up to 25% of time.

Are you an experienced, passionate pioneer in training, transformation and technology? A solutions builder who wants to work in a collaborative environment with a strong company culture, without the extensive demands of travel? If so, consider an opportunity with our innovative and forward-thinking US Delivery Center (USDC).

At Deloitte's US Delivery Center (USDC) we help clients achieve a higher level of service in operational efficiency and business value. The USDC leverages scale, talent, and a center delivery model to provide high quality, cost-effective service with standardized processes and procedures. Our US Delivery Centers have been growing since 2014 with significant, continued growth on the horizon. Our delivery centers are based in Mechanicsburg, PA, Lake Mary, FL and Gilbert, AZ.

Work you'll do/Responsibilities

As a Tier 1 member of the ChangeScout CoE, you will play a critical role in helping clients derive the most value from using ChangeScout for their OCM efforts. In this role you will drive core, mission-critical client work while continuously increasing your knowledge of ChangeScout and Deloitte's change method through exposure to dozens of projects across multiple industries.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:


Client Delivery: Provide ongoing, on-demand support for clients using ChangeScout, including:

o User management

o Data setup and configuration

o Reporting and dashboard generation

o Data advisory and training

o Use case alignment


Application Upgrades: Facilitate regular upgrades of ChangeScout / Salesforce through the following activities:

o Upskill on new features and functionalities in beta

o Perform end-to-end system integration testing

o Build, in collaboration with an implementation manager, the training approach and content for new features

o Deploy upgrades to all client production orgs (including pre- and post-installation readiness activities)

o Perform ongoing change management for clients to inform them of potential impacts to their current use of the tool; conduct training on new functionality; and identify new use case opportunities (aligned to new features) to drive greater client value


CoE Continuous Improvement: Identify, plan, and execute ongoing continuous improvement activities to improve the client experience and drive higher value with lower cost/effort. Examples include:

o Release documentation

o Knowledge management strategy

o myTrailhead (ChangeScout Learning Platform) design and administration

o ChangeScout Service Cloud design and administration

Solution Specialist must have the following:

Strong oral and written communication skills

Proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint

Ability to work independently and manage multiple assignments

Demonstrated ability to manage ambiguity and apply problem-solving skills

Demonstrated ability to employ research and analytical thinking

The Team

From our centers, we work with Deloitte consultants to design, develop and build solutions to help clients reimagine, reshape and rewire the competitive fabric of entire industries. Our centers house a multitude of specialists, ranging from systems designers, architects and integrators, to creative digital experts, to Cyber Risk and Human Capital professionals. All work together on diverse projects from advanced preconfigured solutions and methodologies, to brand-building and campaign management. We are a unique blend of skills and experiences, yet we underline the value of each individual, providing customized career paths, fostering innovation and knowledge development with a focus on quality. The US Delivery Center supports a collaborative team culture where we work and live close to home with limited travel.

Qualifications

Required:

Bachelor's degree; or equivalent work experience

Minimum two (2) years of experience in a client delivery or customer success role

Minimum one (1) year of experience working with data analytics

Travel up to 10% annually (While 10% of travel is a requirement of the role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice.)

Limited immigration sponsorship may be available.

Must be willing to live in or within a commutable distance to the Gilbert, AZ, Mechanicsburg, PA, or Lake Mary, FL delivery center(s)

Preferred:

Salesforce Administrator Certification or equivalent Salesforce experience

Product Support Operations (PSO) plays a critical role in the product lifecycle at Facebook, from ideation, to development, launch, growth, help, and support. The team partners closely with product, engineering, data science and global ops teams to improve the user experience and ensure that every product experience is safe, reliable, and supported at scale. Facebook is seeking an experienced Data Analyst to join the team, who will focus on leading analytics efforts with cross-functional teams to improve the product experience by providing scalable data solutions, business intelligence, and analytics to PSO. Key responsibilities include developing metrics reporting, surfacing actionable insights from our data, scoping the quantitative impact of potential opportunities, and identifying opportunities to improve product quality and product data operations workforce on our platform. Strong communication and experiences required to work with cross-functional teams (e.g. Product, Eng., PM, etc.).
Develop and manage end-to-end analytics solutions from requirements gathering, establish key metrics, build data pipeline, dashboard, and analyze data to drive the performance of our operations
Apply quantitative expertise to mine massive amounts of data and extract impactful insights that influence the strategy for Product Support Operations
Cultivate relationships and collaborate with cross-functional partners to shape, support, and execute product goals. Identify and share insights and learnings to develop scalable solutions
Manage complex cross-functional data and metrics projects and programs in a matrix organization covering a range of areas
Influence what to build in the next roadmap, understand ecosystems, and long-term trends, identify new levers to move key metrics
BA/BS degree in Math, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or other quantitative field with experience in Analytics
5+ years experience in quantitative analysis
5+ years experience in SQL or other querying language
5+ years experience in data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau)
Experience communicating to a variety of audiences and stakeholders
Experience operating strategic projects with cross-functional partners
Experience initiating and driving projects to completion with minimal guidance
Experience with a scripting language (Python, R, PHP, Perl, etc.)
Experience using languages and packages such as R, Pandas, MATLAB, SPSS, SAS, Stata, etc.
Knowledge of statistics (e.g., hypothesis testing, regressions)
Experience with large data sets and distributed computing (Hive/Hadoop)
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Customer Strategy Data Analyst

Are you a professional that loves to be on the cutting edge, thinking about ways organizations and governments can become more citizen-centric in accomplishing their missions? Do you have experience supporting organizations through customer transformation initiatives by combining data, technology and strategy? If so, Deloitte is the place for you! Help bring the power of Customer Strategy and Applied Design to our Government and Public Service clients and transform how they engage with their users. A career within our growing practice will offer you unique exposure to consulting capabilities, industry expertise and trusted methodologies, as well as cutting-edge creative prowess.

Work you'll do

As a Consultant focused on CX Measurement in our practice you will:


Work with senior team members to carry out the design, build, and management of CX feedback tools
Closely support client relationships in the acquisition of business requirements to meet program objectives
Support Data Analytics team lead in analyzing and synthesizing CX insights from survey data
Developing client-ready materials with clear visualizations and narratives that can be communicated to a non-technical audience
Analyzing, forecasting, and/or reporting CX and survey data for ad hoc asks.


The team

Customer Strategy & Applied Design, Government and Public Service practice

Our Customer Strategy & Applied Design team focuses on helping clients discover, design, and prototype customer engagement strategies and innovation portfolios to create and drive change in a digital world. We bring knowledge and offerings to uncover the behaviors, motivations and preferences of our clients' customers and develop new experiences for them. Our team of professionals has deep capabilities in Customer Experience Transformation, Customer Experience Measurement, Voice of the Customer Analytics, Voice of the Customer Technology Implementation within the Government and Public Service market. Our Customer Experience Measurement team delivers a set of customer focused work:

Customer Experience Transformation Design | Help clients build capabilities to better understand customer and citizen value drivers and make choices about how to best serve the markets and segments through digital, social, and mobile channels; optimize program and service decisions and shape the most strategic issues on the customer and citizen engagement agenda

Customer Experience Measurement | Help clients improve the quality, nature and power of measurement tools that capture sentiment of customer, citizen and the organization at each and every touch point. Inform survey architecture and questionnaire design

Voice of Customer Analytics | Help clients create analysis and analytical programs to help uncover root causes of customer pain points and strengths that are driving positive experiences. Help create sustainable and repeatable approaches to delivering insights on an ongoing basis

Voice of Customer Technology Implementation | Help clients understand, envision and articulate VOC/EFM Technology as a critical tool set aligned with their organization's mission and agenda - and then craft a plan to embed everything they do with the latest technology solutions and business models to comp ete in the marketplace for customers and talent; implement EFM tools and help clients drive the best results from their tools

Qualifications

Required:
Bachelor's degree and at least 2+ years in a technical or functional consulting role or other relevant industry experience
1+ years of Data Analyst or reporting experience
1+ years of Survey Design experience
Must be able to obtain and maintain required clearance if needed
Ability to travel up to 50% (while travel is required for this role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice.


Preferred:

Experience presenting to clients or other decision makers to present and sell ideas to various audiences (technical and non-technical)
Experience with advanced analytics approaches such as regression analysis and predictive analytics
Experience with Medallia and Qualtrics
VOC SaaS Certifications (Medallia, MaritzCX, Qualtrics, Salesforce, etc.)
Prior professional experience supporting federal clients

Company Name: Superior Court of California, County of Santa Barbara
Job Description:
JOB
If you forget your password, have application login problems, or get an error message during the application process, please call the NeoGov helpline at 1-855-524-5627 for assistance.ADDITIONAL MONETARY/BENEFIT VALUE: In addition to the base wage listed, employees in this classification receive: - Biweekly Court contribution of up to $389.58 towards the cost of medical premium.- Biweekly Court contribution of $13.02 towards the cost of dental premium.- Biweekly Court contribution of approximately 34.22% of gross wages towards employee's mandatory retirement account.Additionally, employees from current public employers (federal, state and/or local government) may qualify for: - Retirement reciprocity.- Time and service credit towards vacation accrual rate.DEFINITION: Under general supervision, designs or modifies, and monitors computer application systems; assists system users with the resolution of computer application problems; and performs related duties as required.DISTINGUISHING CHARACTERISTICS: Performs applications analysis work of existing or new systems including programming, testing, maintenance, and implementation. This position differs from the Departmental Data Processing Specialist series in that the Analyst focuses on the technical design, writing and testing of complex computer programs. Incumbents may specialize in computerized applications used in a particular type of service/program; e.g., criminal records, inventory, financial, or personnel systems. Level I is an entry level systems and programming analyst series, occupied by employees who require close supervision while acquiring great technical knowledge and ability to work with Court staff and vendors in needs and feasibility applications analysis.

EXAMPLE OF DUTIES
Designs and participates in the development, testing, and implementation of computer application systems; consults with current and proposed systems users on the feasibility of proposed systems and changes; analyzes ongoing computerization needs; identifies design alternatives; estimates cost and timing of systems modifications and new systems development; proposes computer-based solutions. Monitors and corrects problems with production runs identified by users and computer operations personnel; develops and implements solutions to the problems. Writes technical specifications for system and program design; writes user operating procedures for new and revised computer applications; and confers with departmental staff, vendors, and technical support personnel regarding changes in operating procedures and systems design to ensure applications meet user needs. Modifies, enhances, or adds modules to existing applications; adapts purchased software to hardware used by department and to departmental requirements; provides project and technical supervision of staff assisting in application development and maintenance tasks. Designs procedures for testing new and revised software; conducts tests to evaluate conformance to specifications and to identify and correct problems. Conducts formal and on-the-job training for system users in the capabilities and use of computer applications. Communicates with stakeholders to understand data content and business requirements.Uses data mining to extract information from data sets and identify correlations and patterns; Uses data to predict trends in court caseloads; Performs statistical analysis of data.Organizes and transforms information into comprehensible structures; Preparing reports and presenting these to management or stakeholders; Uses tools and techniques to visualize data in easy-to-understand formats, such as diagrams and graphs.Monitors data quality and removes corrupt data.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
EDP Systems and Programming Analyst I: 1) Completion of 24 quarter/l8 semester units of college level courses in the principles and methods of systems analysis, systems design, computer program design, computer programming using a language utilized by the hiring department, and information system technology; experience with relational databases and designing datasets to meet requirements, working with large sets of data, extracting and summarizing large amounts of data; monitoring performance and influencing priorities; and, two years of experience writing business application programs; or, 2) equivalent combination of education, training, and experience that would provide the required knowledge and abilities. Knowledge of: principles and methods used in analysis and development of data processing applications; principles of systems and procedures analysis; uses and limitations of data processing applications; principles of information entry, storage, and retrieval; programming languages applicable to systems in use; current developments in data processing; operating capabilities of common hardware configurations; principles and techniques of computer programming; basic math to develop simple equations in programming applications and to estimate costs of systems; and basic principles of electronic data communication.Ability to: define problems, collect and analyze data, validate conclusions, and make recommendations; modify and write programs for efficient applications; write instructions and procedures; write systems and programming documentation; make requested data accessible to those who need the information to streamline business processes;prepare clear and concise memos and written reports; identify and take corrective actions to solve problems in programs and production systems; communicate on technical issues with individuals with varying degrees of computer familiarity; apply advanced programming languages and programming tools; establish and maintain effective working relationships with users and others contacted in the course of work; read and interpret technical instructions used for such tasks as coding and operating systems; organize work and set priorities to meet deadlines; work within prescribed time constraints. Desirable Qualifications: I LEVEL Knowledge of: basic principles of electronic records management to design or modify programs, bookkeeping to design or modify programs, and budgeting to design or modify programs; principles of project management; principles of database design; Power BI or other data visualization tools, Odyssey case management system, web design and/or creation; and, basic principles of supervision.

About WideOrbit:
Say hello to a Wider World. WideOrbit helps media companies do more business by making it easier to complete more sales. We build the one platform that ties everything together – from TV, radio, and digital ad sales, to reporting, invoicing, and payments. Chances are if there's an ad on your local TV or radio station, or on your favorite streaming service or podcast, we helped put it there. Our customers include NBCUniversal, AMC Networks, ViacomCBS, A+E Networks, Hearst Media, and many more industry leaders around the world.

At WideOrbit, we make preserving our inclusive environment an ongoing priority, empowering team members to contribute at every level, in every function. We hire high-energy innovators who value diversity, unafraid to wield their passion and expertise to advocate for our customers and each other. At WideOrbit, you'll make a difference and see your impact every day, while learning, growing, and enjoying what you do!

Job Description:
As a Data Analyst on the Internal Applications Team, you'll assist with development of reporting solutions and data management of our internal systems. In this role, you will use SQL, PowerBI and other reporting tools to help provide WideOrbit departments the ability to create and manage reports themselves. You will also help maintain and ensure the quality of data in various systems to include Microsoft Dynamics 365 CE (D365CE) and Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations (D365F&O).
This is a great opportunity for a detail-oriented, data quality motivated individual to make a big impact across WideOrbit departments by helping provide data they can trust and use. In this role, you will need to understand business processes to understand the data, and over time you will gain a deep understanding of the WideOrbit business which ultimately will help shape your career development and goals.

Here is what success will look like:
Manage the data export process of various system to SQL; to include D365CE and D365F&O
Create and maintain SQL databases with summary views
Create and maintain PowerBI datasets for end-users to use for reports and dashboards
Create data dictionaries for end-users
Create and maintain high-level dashboards for departments, executives, etc.
Work with users to delivery impactful & widely adopted reports and dashboards
Occasionally train users on PowerBI and other reporting tools/techniques
Maintain quality of data by using advanced tools to do data creation and updates
Help maintain system data such as products, licensed products, etc. in D365CE
Create ad hoc reports as needed

To thrive in this role, we're looking for:
BS or MS in related field OR equivalent combination of education, training, and experience
3+ years' experience using SQL and SQL Server
3+ years' experience using PowerBI, Tableau or other BI tools
Experience creating and maintaining corporate reporting systems
Familiarity with CRM data sets. Microsoft Dynamics 365 is a plus
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Proven ability to be data motivated with a strong attention to detail
Proven ability to work successfully independently and with a team in a fast-paced environment
Self-motivated with a passion for learning new tools

Please note:
WideOrbit mandates Covid vaccination, with accommodation for religious or medical reasons in accordance with law.
We are unable to provide visa sponsorship.

Location:
This position can be based in any of our WideOrbit offices or Telecommute/Remote locations will also be considered.
Compensation, Benefits and Perks:
Besides a great work environment with smart and friendly coworkers, access to leadership and knowledge about how your work impacts company success, here are some of our benefits and perks:

A competitive salary, health insurance, sabbatical leaves, great vacation package, work/life balance, life event benefits, casual work attire, stocked café, 401(k) match, and plenty of opportunities to grow!

We are committed to treating all applicants fairly, WideOrbit is an equal opportunity employer that prohibits unlawful discrimination based on race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, marital status, military or veteran status, gender identity and expression, genetic information, or any other factor protected by law. Additionally, we consider qualified applicants whose histories are impacted by our justice system, consistent with applicable federal, state, and local law.

U.S. News & World Report is a multifaceted digital media company dedicated to helping citizens, consumers, business leaders and policy officials make important decisions in their lives. We publish independent reporting, rankings, data journalism and advice that has earned the trust of our readers and users for nearly 90 years. Our platforms on usnews.com include Education, Health, Money, Travel, Cars, News and 360 Reviews.
We reach more than 40 million people monthly during moments when they are most in need of expert advice and motivated to act on that advice directly on our platforms. Our signature franchises include our “Best” series of consumer guides on colleges, graduate schools, hospitals, diets, cars, financial services and more. These guides provide an easy-to-digest list for consumers to better understand and compare when making their decisions. We continue to publish annual guides of the authoritative Best Colleges and Best Hospitals rankings on our website and in print. And our U.S. News Live flagship conferences highlight important national conversations including Healthcare of Tomorrow and Healthiest Communities.
Your role in helping us shape the future:
As a member of the U.S. News Money team, you will be involved in supporting the Money product team to help drive the future of our business; you will be a key member of a fast-growing organization that is goal-oriented and re-shaping our future.
The primary responsibilities of the Data Analyst will be to ensure rankings data quality in a timely manner.
Are you up to the challenge?
Collect and analyze data for Money rankings, including fielding surveys
Develop expertise in ranking methodologies and data sources
Develop quality assurance procedures for data collected internally and from third party sources; ensuring accuracy of rankings computations and information displayed on usnews.com
Coordinate closely with U.S. News technical team on the development efforts related to rankings launches; providing detailed written specs, assisting in troubleshooting bugs, and testing the accuracy of data loads
Analysis tasks may include computing scores on ranking factors, modeling impact of potential methodology changes, performing multiple regression analyses, testing for statistical outliers and producing data visualizations
Meet specific project deadlines and timelines set by the product management and tech teams
Provide editorial and PR team with data used in articles, short lists, and slideshows as well as assist in the review process prior to publication
Recommend new methodologies and product features based upon data analysis
On-going data and product QA, with detailed-oriented eye for errors / bugs
Provide performance analysis support as requested
You should definitely have:
Bachelor’s degree in data science or a related field or equivalent experience
3+ years relevant work experience
High level proficiency working in MS Office Suite, specifically in Excel
Knowledge of database structures and experience writing SQL select statements to query databases
Strong oral and written communication skills
Excelled in college-level quantitative coursework (economics, math, statistics or computer science)
Attention to detail, excellent organizational skills and strong time management skills
It would be nice if you had:
Experience in JIRA
Up-to-date knowledge on Internet publishing and metrics, with an acute understanding of SEO, is a plus
What it’s like to work with us:
Talent is our best asset!
We invest in people with passion and potential who understand U.S. News’ dedication to our consumers.
Entrepreneurial, mission-driven culture with core values of quality and integrity
Focus on fostering personal and professional growth
Competitive benefits including paid vacation time, medical, tuition reimbursement, and training
Collaborative Work Environment ~ Fun, diverse, inclusive and ambitious co-workers

To Power Smart Mobility for Every Driver and Vehicle, Everywhere
For decades, parking was a hassle. Then in 2008, ParkMobile launched with a simple goal: make parking easier. Today, our team is committed to creating tech-based solutions that power smart mobility and make parking hassles of the past obsolete. We do this by creating innovative solutions that connect parking and mobility ecosystems, eliminating friction while maximizing convenience and efficiency. At ParkMobile we offer agile frameworks and incentives for innovators and problem solvers, all at the perfect spot for work and play at the heart of midtown Atlanta.
We're experiencing exciting growth. We're looking for more people to join our team and help shape a product used by more than 26 million people.
What You'll Do
ParkMobile, the leader in smart parking and mobility solutions in the US and one of the AJC's Top Workplaces, is looking for a Data Analyst. This person will be using reporting and analytics to support Marketing, Product, Sales, Account Management, Finance, Executives, and other internal and external stakeholders. You will be building tools for non-IT reporting and analytics. You will decide what is needed to drive business decisions, and use this to, create, evolve, and maintain a portfolio of reports and systems used by all internal users. You will look for ways to monetize data. You will partner with Product/IT in an Agile framework.
Work with the business to understand needs, decide out how to meet those needs, and create the systems and reports to drive data-based decision making.
Grow our understanding of consumer behavior to guide business strategies, drive consumer growth and retention.
Create single source of truth for companywide KPIs.
Build models and/or use machine learning to uncover statistical relationships and insights.
Answer ad hoc questions, maintain regular reporting, develop and evolve dashboards.
Investigate new technologies, prototype new systems.
Further the automation and distribution of reporting products.
Innovate ways to monetize ParkMobile data.
Partner as needed with Agile teams.
Who You Are
A proven track record of creating systems to support analytics professionals and business users.
The ideal candidate is data-driven, a creative problem solver, comfortable juggling multiple priorities and passionate about driving practical business impact.
Bachelor's Degree in Mathematics, Data Science, Business Analytics or similar, or related work experience.
Proficiency in SQL, competency with Python.
A broad background in data, reporting, and analytic tools.
Demonstrated productivity, initiative, professionalism, and attention to detail in a rapidly changing environment.
Nice to Have:
Looker, Tableau, or similar data visualization tools
SAS, R, or similar statistical/data manipulation tools.
Proficiency in Excel, PowerPoint
Google suite (Google Analytics, Firebase, Tag Manager), or other Product Analytics tools (MixPanel, Amplitude)
Experience with user research and/or surveying.
Experience in a business domain such as Marketing, Product, Finance, Sales, Account management
We know there's no such thing as a "perfect" candidate. We're all a work in progress and are working on new skills and capabilities all the time. The technology stack that you'll be working in includes AWS, Kubernetes, Go, as well as CI/CD, API monitoring, and cloud native solutions. ParkMobile welcomes those who are passionate about learning and evolving, if this looks like a role where you could do work that excites you, we hope you'll apply.
What you'll enjoy about joining our Team
We believe in work/life balance. Seriously. Our team members well-being is just as important to us as their work. We are humans first, employees second. We offer a ton of competitive perks, including:
Unlimited PTO
Regularly work from home
Medical, dental and vision coverage
401K Matching
Casual Dress
Paid Parental Leave
Flexible Work Hours
Learning and Development Opportunities
Company Social Events - happy hours, outings, and more
Pet Insurance
Company Community Service Events
About ParkMobile
At ParkMobile, we aim to build an inclusive culture where differences are used to inform better creative, strategic, and business decisions. We actively seek diversity of backgrounds, education, beliefs, and ways of thinking. We look to create a culture where everyone can belong because we believe that people do their best work when they can show up every day as their authentic selves. ParkMobile is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location for this position from the following: New York, NY, USA; Mountain View, CA, USA
Minimum qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, Finance, or equivalent practical experience
4 years of experience with quantitative data analysis
Experience in SQL or similar data analytic tools to extract and manipulate data, delivered through dashboards

Preferred qualifications:
Advanced SQL knowledge and good coding practices
Operate with minimal supervision and able to make informed, well-reasoned decisions independently
Ability to work well cross-functionally
Ability to independently make sound judgment calls in ambiguous situations
Impeccable problem solving, analytical thinking, teamwork skills
About the job
The Ads Finance team partners with Ads Leadership across Product, Engineering, and Sales (GBO) to drive ads decisions with financial stewardship. We are strategic partners, driving impact through analysis grounded in hard data. We bring an independent point of view and bias to action on a collaborative approach, all while focusing on the development of our people.
In this role, you will have a chance to be in the middle of the action. You will work closely with the Legal, Economics, Regulatory Affairs Finance, and Product Finance teams to determine the optimal approach to execute complex finance data pulls and analyses. Building upon your strong technical and analytical skills, you will develop expertise in Ads Finance data sets, enabling you to execute on a number of mission critical data and analytics projects. As your expertise grows, you will get involved in ever more complex and varied work.
The name Google came from "googol," a mathematical term for the number 1 followed by 100 zeros. And nobody at Google loves big numbers like the Finance team when providing in depth analysis on all manner of strategic decisions across Google products. From developing forward-thinking analysis to generating management reports to scaling our automated financial processes, the Finance organization is an important partner and advisor to the business.
Responsibilities
Effectively run complex finance projects in critical high-visibility areas such as regulatory inquiries, external publications (e.g. blog posts, congressional testimonies), strategic planning, and other strategic projects; use learnings from these efforts to design scalable future processes
Leverage script language proficiency to conduct complex analytical projects
Coordinate across a virtual team of finance managers and directors to identify and mobilize domain and data experts, and to drive insight and alignment on how best to conduct analyses
Communicate business critical information to senior stakeholders in Finance, Product, and Legal teams; tee up potential solutions for business problems. Create and maintain strong working relationships with key stakeholders
Partner with the Finance Data & Analytics team to evolve our Finance datasets to better serve business and regulatory response needs
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

Description:

S&H Systems is a single-source, full-service systems integration company delivering dependable material handling systems, software, and post-sale support since 2002. The strategic planning department is charged with setting company priorities, focusing energy and resources to strengthen operations, ensuring employees and other stakeholders are working toward common goals, establishing agreement around intended outcomes/results, and assess and adjust the organization’s direction in response to a changing environment.
We seek qualified candidates to effectively interpret data and turn the information into evidence that can offer ways to improve a business and guide business decisions. Successful candidates will have a background in gathering information from various sources and interpreting patterns and trends. The Data Analyst will report back what has been found in a comprehensive study to the wider business/relevant colleagues.
This position will often make recommendations about the methods and ways in which a company obtains and analyses data to improve the quality and the efficiency of data systems. Other responsibilities include, but not be limited to:
Collecting and interpreting data and analyzing results
Reporting the results back to the relevant team members
Identifying patterns and trends in data sets
Working alongside coworkers within the business/management team to establish business needs
Defining new data collection and analysis processes
Develop, report, and maintain high-quality tracking tools for decision analysis to include time-series tracking, cluster analysis, and data validation
. Requirements:

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s degree in either Mathematics, Computer Science, Statistics, and/or Economics
Experience in data models and reporting packages
Knowledge of data collection/cleaning techniques
Ability to analyze large datasets and write comprehensive reports
Strong verbal and written communication skills
An analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving as well as attention to detail
PREFERED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience in data collection and data visualization
Ability to analyze large datasets
Coding skills in languages/tools such as SQL, Python, R

Description:
IT DATA ANALYST

Smart, Innovative, and Hard-working? Perfect! We are growing and need the right people with the right mindset. Join our family and find a home where you will enjoy working with your peers, be challenged to work hard, and have some fun in the midst of it all. Overview
The Data Analyst provides support of the company data and reporting applications. Works directly with internal customers in order to understand the business needs. Generates or modifies existing standard or custom reports summarizing business, financial, or economic data for review by executives, managers, and other stakeholders.

Duties and Responsibilities
Knowledge of logical and physical data modeling concepts.
Excellent priority and time management skills required to be able to effectively implement multiple projects.
Ability to define and solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables, occasionally in situations where only limited standardization exists. Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form.
Strong interpersonal skills required in order to establish and maintain effective business relationships.
Demonstrate the ability to communicate in situations requiring tact and poise as well as possess the ability to work with confidentiality and discretion.
Must possess exceptional communication skills to present facts and recommendations effectively in oral and written form, to include accurate grammar and business correspondence knowledge.
Neat and professional appearance required.
Possess a good sense of humor and belief in working as a professional cohesive team member.
. Requirements:
Be a minimum of 18 years of age.
Have a minimum of 3 years of experience with Microsoft SQL Server T-SQL language.
Have a minimum of 3 years of experience with at least one of the following: Crystal Reports, SSRS, Access, Excel, Power BI or other reporting tool.

https://chadwellsupply.com

Description:

The Data Analyst is responsible for working with a large team for a critical aviation system. Upcoming efforts include receiving data in real time, leading to high availability database infrastructure with failover capability. The Data Analyst will be responsible for maintaining data integrity and implementing data analysis best practices to identify issues quickly and provide recommendations for resolution. This position will be responsible for reviewing data loads for several hours over one weekend per month, with an offsetting amount of time off to be taken during normal working hours. The successful candidate will have both passion for data analytics and practical experience with relevant technical applications such as Tableau, Python, Business Objects, R, advanced Excel and SQL. This position will function within a highly motivated, dynamic team. A passion for best practices and a desire to develop new bold ideas are key for success.
. Requirements:

Responsibilities
Ensure the accuracy and completeness of data by reviewing reports and performance indicators to identify and correct data processing issues.
Create repeatable methodologies to analyze large data sets and ensure data accuracy and integrity.
Analyze data and data structures for loading into data warehouses, databases and other tools.
Aggregate and analyze data across multiple systems.
Work with DBAs on the team to review data.
Write SQL queries either in Oracle or Postgres.
Work in R systems to obtain data from database systems and develop analyses.
Assist in the development and implementation of databases, data collection systems/tools, data analytics, and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality (including identifying process improvements to better satisfy business needs).
Build and customize dynamic reports and dashboards using Tableau.
Maintain knowledge of best data analytic practices.
Work with others to identify areas of improvement, establish best practices and implement changes within the group.
Additional duties and responsibilities as assigned.
Required Background
Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, Information Technology, or additional relevant field.
Minimum of five (5) years of relevant experience, including two (2) years focused in data analysis.
US citizenship or permanent resident status.
Ability to obtain a Public Trust clearance (or higher) from a federal agency.

Required Abilities, Knowledge & Skills
Availability and willingness to work after hours and weekends on a rotation schedule.
Ability to analyze, model, and interpret data.
Advanced Excel skills including charting, pivot tables, and functions such as lookups.
Ability to write batch files, shell scripts, and SQL queries.
Ability to develop test cases.
Proficient written and verbal communication in English, including technical writing skills.
Ability to effectively communicate complex and abstract processes with non-technical audiences.
Organized, detailed, and a team player.
Preferred

Active Public Trust clearance (or higher) from a federal agency.
Familiarity with FAA air traffic facilities and operations.
Knowledge of one or more programming languages.
Past participation on Agile team specifically Kanban.
Experience using JIRA and Confluence.

WHO WE ARE
The GivePower Foundation (“GivePower”) is a growing team of passionate problem-solvers creating innovative ways in which to use and develop clean energy systems around the world, for developing regions that need it most. GivePower’s primary programs include solar electrification for medical, educational and economic needs in developing regions; deploying scalable solar-powered desalination solutions for clean water access in remote communities, promoting global female empowerment, and sponsoring “voluntourism” treks for donors and partners that want to experience the impact firsthand. Born from the Silicon Valley clean tech industry, we are visionaries with a drive to help solve the world’s biggest water and energy crises. Come join the charge!
YOUR ROLE
At GivePower, you will support the reporting for the entire organization, which includes a combination of financial, operational, and production data. To ensure the financial sustainability of the systems that GivePower deploys around the globe, this role will help build for scale and design reporting that can be integrated with larger sets of stored data. Finding creative ways to solve big picture challenges is a daily process at GivePower, and the analyst will use data to help us do this in the most efficient ways possible.
Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities:
Work with stakeholders as GivePower builds, refines, and deploys new financial reporting, operational metrics, KPIs, and forecasting solutions
Partner with business development, business operations, finance, and accounting for regular review and to ensure proper reporting channels are developed with accurate information
Focus on the details while finding creative ways to solve big picture challenges and analyze data in the most efficient way
Using best practices, work to ensure growth of systems is planned, with data storage, retention, and organization being well-structured, documented, and designed for rapid growth
The creation and maintenance of standard and ad-hoc reports, tools, and dashboards.
Increase departmental productivity by developing automated reporting/forecasting tools
Provide analytical, forecasting, reporting, and project support to senior leadership
Required Skills, Knowledge and Abilities:
4 years of relevant work experience in management and strategy consulting, financial planning & analysis, corporate finance, or sales operations
Ability to take initiative and work independently in an unstructured, fast-changing environment. Ability to comfortably handle ambiguity and make decisions
Effective problem solving and analysis skills, combined with superb business acumen and strategic thinking
Advanced knowledge of Excel
Experience working on multiple projects simultaneously
Expert-level analytical and financial modeling skills
Deep understanding of accounting, its presentation, and how it relates to reporting
Able to work independently and handle multiple projects simultaneously
Time spent working in developing markets and businesses
Excellent presentation skills and the ability to comfortably interact with senior management
Familiarity with data query/data management tools is extremely helpful (Access, SQL)
Experience working with Tableau or similar is a plus
Additional Information Regarding Job Duties and Job Descriptions:
Job duties include additional responsibilities as assigned by one's supervisor or other managers related to the position/department. This job description is meant to describe the general nature and level of work being performed; it is not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and other skills required for the position. The Company reserves the right at any time with or without notice to alter or change job responsibilities, reassign or transfer job position or assign additional job responsibilities, subject to applicable law. The Company shall provide reasonable accommodations of known disabilities to enable a qualified applicant or employee to apply for employment, perform the essential functions of the job, or enjoy the benefits and privileges of employment as required by the law.

If you are an extraordinary professional who thrives in a collaborative work culture and values a rewarding career, then we want to work with you! Apply today!

Benefits include medical, dental, and vision, a 401(k)-retirement plan, and flexible paid time off.

GivePower is an equal opportunity employer, We strongly encourage people of every color, orientation, age, gender, origin, and ability to apply.

GivePower is the proud winner of Fast Company's 2021 World Changing Ideas Award as well as a finalist in the Best World Changing Idea North America and Developing World Technology categories. We are also the winner of the 2020 Mohammad bin Rashad Al Maktoum Global Water Award for USA Innovative Projects.

Description:
About Us
AE Strategies is a Mclean, VA based consulting firm, founded in 2003, providing people and project management solutions to federal customers. We are a proven small business with an established reputation and a track record of sustained success, having delivered on over 100 contracts across the federal government. Employees will work on challenging and impactful federal initiatives in a positive and collaborative work environment with competitive compensation and excellent benefits, including paid healthcare and 401k matching. Find out more at www.aestrategies.com.
Overview
The position will directly implement Technology Business Management (TBM) solutions for a federal client and thereby support the effective planning, design, and management of major strategy and operational initiatives within an IT department. Working closely with IT and supporting finance teams, design and configure solutions that address business needs and builds greater understanding of IT costs. With a focus on information resource planning help IT leadership support strategic missions. Support and augment capital planning and investment control process which link to budget formulation and execution across operations and maintenance (O&M) and development, modernization, and enhancement (DME) initiatives.
Responsibilities
Assist the agency management team in understanding the applicability and value of TBM practices to improve the value and efficiency of IT spending.
Assist in adopting and adapting TBM standards and practices to achieve a balance with practical organizational situations without sacrificing the core benefits of TBM.
Enhance and maintain the existing Apptio-based TBM system; implement continuous improvements in data displays, data integration, scaling, cost and resource modeling, and analytics.
Support security staff in ensuring the Apptio solution adheres to System Security Plan; develop required supporting documentation as needed.
Coordinate with Enterprise Architecture to maintain a standard taxonomy, model and management system for IT costs, resources, and services so that IT leaders and other stakeholders use the same language and methodology to define new investments and evaluate the cost and performance of existing systems, services and products.
Define and maintain standard set of TBM metrics for evaluating and managing cost-effectiveness and for benchmarking IT costs and performance on an annual basis.
Work with stakeholders to determine cost allocation models, create the models in the system, and maintain and document the underlying relationships, allocations, and assumptions.
Configure dashboards, reports, and underlying data models to meet functional design and specifications.
Work with enterprise IT governance and Capital Planning processes to provide needed supporting information.
Operational management of the ServiceNow ITBM and ITFM implementations, i.e. loading new data, reviewing and validating dashboard/report outputs. Take responsibility to collect, collate, quality assurance, transform, upload, validate and remediate monthly data uploads.
Ensure that TBM data outputs conform to the data contained in agency authoritative systems of record.
. Requirements:
US citizen, with no obstacle to obtaining an elevated clearance.
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, MIS, Finance, or equivalent experience.
2 years of experience, including data analysis.
Strong communication and presentation skills, able to communicate technical ideas to a generalist audience effectively.
Skilled at working with large data sets in Excel (or similar), detecting and resolving data-related issues and streamlining the underlying processes.
Experience with data analytic tools, preferably Power BI.
Strong to expert skills in data analysis/manipulation.
Knowledge and application of relational database concepts.
Skilled at working with large data sets in Excel (or similar), detecting and resolving data-related issues and streamlining the underlying processes.
Possess an agile mindset and continuously seek improvement and innovation to streamline processes.
Strong process analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to drive the problem analysis and resolution process from start to finish.
Desired Qualifications
Demonstrated hands-on experience in TBM implementations and support using Apptio in actual customer environments.
Specific knowledge and application of federal financial management practices, including budgeting, fund allocations, appropriations and obligations, cost allocations, capital and operating expense handling, and portfolio management using the CPIC framework.
Working knowledge of IT services and IT infrastructure domains including data centers, network / communications, server utilization, virtual environments, storage, and application development and maintenance.
General understanding of federal IT systems security processes.
AE Strategies is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.

ABOUT THE NORDEX GROUP
The manufacture of wind energy plants in the on-shore segment has been our core competence and passion for around 35 years. With more than 29 GW installed capacity worldwide, our turbines supply sustainable energy to more than 80% of the global energy market and we are one of the largest companies in the wind industry. National subsidiaries in more than 25 markets and production facilities in Germany, Spain, Brazil, the USA, Mexico and India offer our more than 8,460 employees the opportunity for international and intercultural cooperation.


We are growing and together driving forward the expansion of alternative energies worldwide - if you wish, from now on with you. Join the #TeamNordex
Data Analyst Intern (m/f/d)
REQUISITION ID: 1754
LOCATION:West Branch, IA, US
DEPARTMENT: Engineering
Do you want to be part of an agile team where colleagueship truly matters?
As a global company, we interact with a variety of people and cultures. Integrity, Respect, Colleagueship and Ownership are the unifying force for all departments and regions around the world. It’s the individual that defines the team. And it’s the team that makes the difference. Join the #TEAMNORDEX and shape the future of energy with us.

As an intern in the Reliability Engineering area of Nordex USA, you will work with various forms of data from diverse sources and receive hands-on experience in addressing real-world operational objectives. The Data Analyst Intern will provide a high level of support to internal customers by analyzing large amounts of raw and processed information to find patterns, identify impactful opportunities for improvement and develop effective action planning recommendations that will help improve company performance. In this role, you should be highly analytical with a knack for analysis, mathematics, and statistics. Critical thinking and problem-solving skills are essential for interpreting data and developing insights. Data analyst responsibilities include: executing change impact analysis, conducting analysis of service backlog and fleet performance KPIs, building reports dashboards and action plans using a variety of tools, and collaborating with internal teams. The successful candidate will turn data into information, information into insight, and insight into business decisions.

Responsibilities:
Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
Perform analysis of maintenance service, retrofit, and test campaigns to assess the impact on business performance
Leverage existing data sources and collection systems to establish management-level reporting summaries using data visualization tools and techniques, such as MS Power BI
Work with management to prioritize business and information needs
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities
Identify valuable data sources and automate collection and creation process steps
Undertakes the preprocessing of structured and unstructured data
Develop models and analysis templates to optimize recurring analysis cycles
Propose solutions and strategies to business challenges
Collaborates with Engineering and Operations teams

Requirements:
Currently pursuing or recently completed a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration, Data Science/Business Analytics or Engineering
Technical experience regarding data models, data mining, and segmentation techniques
Knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (SAP Business Objects, MS Power BI, etc.), databases (SQL, etc.), programming and analysis (R, Python, SAS, MS Excel)
Knowledge of business analytics and statistics with experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Excellent project management, organization, and follow-up skills
Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills
Must be a team player and able to work in virtual/in-person teams and independently
Experience using business intelligence tools
Analytical mind and business acumen
Problem-solving aptitude
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Experience in data mining and understanding of machine-learning and operations research a plus

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. We will consider applicants for this position without regard to any category protected by applicable federal, state or local law, including but not limited to: race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information, veteran status or uniformed service member status.

Handles routine to moderately complicated data requests. Makes recommendations to requestor for additional data that may be beneficial to the analysis. The incumbent may assist in educating new users to the related reporting systems. At Facebook Reality Labs (FRL), our goal is to explore, innovate and design novel interfaces and hardware subsystems for the next generation of virtual, augmented, and mixed reality experiences. We are looking for a skilled and motivated Data Analyst to join our team, whose mission is to connect and build reporting for our data systems. We are specifically looking for a candidate with experience in defining and building data aggregation and reporting systems for manufacturing facilities and who can work with a team of engineers and technicians who are developing new manufacturing processes. More broadly, the chosen candidate will work with a diverse and highly interdisciplinary team of researchers and engineers and will have access to cutting edge technology, resources, and manufacturing facilities.
Develop roadmap based on current state survey of data forms and generation environments
Own the aggregation and reporting of manufacturing systems data, including – MES data, Shop floor trend data, metrology raw data, metrology production data, research data, and external contract data
Maintain and design data systems to receive or process data from various levels of the manufacturing process including text files, system logs, external databases, external company extracts
Maintain and design data dashboard/reporting systems to process and present data to provide greater insight into the MFG process and broader production processes in general
Establish standards around data formatting and requirements
Develop new data flows with Engineering personnel input
4+ years of experience with data reporting and analysis in a variety of environments. MFG Systems experience, but other environments may also provide valuable experience
2+ years of experience with SQL, Tableau, or other reporting software experience with design of reporting development
Experience with Root Cause analysis and development of large systems via requirements gathering
Experience in an environment focused on Data Integrity
Experience integrating data sources across broad spectrum of systems (eg: ERP, MES, Shop Floor Automation, OSI Pi, etc.)
Experience with statistical analysis/data science
Bachelors in engineering or scientific discipline or extensive experience in data systems
Familiarity with HIVE or similar big data systems
Experience with MES architecture and automation system (SECS/GEM, OPC, etc.) communications
Experience in semiconductor development manufacturing
Design of databases/data aggregation systems

Southern Maryland Electric Cooperative has an immediate opening for a Meter Data Analyst. This position provides direction and support services in assigned area through the development of business processes and use of data analytics tools and software to ensure SMECO’s compliance with regulatory specifications, policies and accurate customer meter information.
This position requires a self-motivated individual with proven analytical skills. Core competencies include critical thinking to research, organize and analyze large data sets combined with strong verbal and written communication skills to disseminate the results.

Candidates are required to have a two-year college degree or equivalent work experience with emphasis in data management, mathematics, business administration, and business management.

Job Title: Quality Control Analyst, Data Review (QC Reviewer)
Job Description:
Position Summary
Glenmark is actively seeking a Quality Control Analyst, Data Review . The QC Chemistry Data Review Analyst position supports the Quality Control group to maintain process optimization and manufacturing activities. The Data Review Analyst is a highly motivated member of the Quality Control (QC) Lab at the Monroe manufacturing facility, reporting to the QC Director, Chemistry. Primary responsibilities for this position will be the data review function of QC testing within the Quality Control laboratories and select third party laboratories plus the QC data compilation for Annual Product Review Reports associated with Glenmark marketed products in accordance with company and government regulations.
Major Responsibilities
Responsible for QC Data review and trending to ensure integrity and adherence to standard operating procedures and cGMP’s.
Be cost effective and vigilant of laboratory purchases to ensure department is within the Revenue and Capex Budget as per spent analysis project.
Provide feedback to management with laboratory standard hours for financial prudence in resource planning, allocation and manpower to ensure within approved budgets while building best in class quality processes and systems at site.
Execute and maintain quality system controls to ensure no critical and major market complaints.
Take appropriate steps to reduce waste and losses in the analysis process and build improved efficiency.
Responsible for the compilation and interpretation of QC Analytical data including OOS and Microbiology for applicable Annual Product Reviews.
Responsible to draw conclusions from real-time data and statistical reports. (if available)
Responsible to ensure that established testing control procedures are followed.
Responsible to ensure good documentation practices are followed.
Maintain compliance to data integrity and cGMP in QC lab in line with standards prescribed by USFDA.
Communicate with Supervisor and/or report any preparations or data that may result in an incidence and out-of-specification (OOS).
Ensure that the QC Laboratory is in a ready state of compliance for internal and external audits.
Maintain accurate and complete test records.
Maintain current knowledge of regulatory and industry standards, trends and advancements.
Review technology transfer of analytical methods and cleaning validations for new products.
Assist in the monitoring of changes in the monographs Pharmacopoeia requirements, Regulatory agencies recommendations and implement the same in QC Lab.
Review deviations, tasks and CAPA for Lab failures in OOS.
Review departmental change controls as assigned.
Review results of lab investigations when test results fall outside pre-established specifications (OOS) as assigned.
Prepare in timely fashion updating and revision of SOP, specification, STP and any other document.
Review of equipment and instrument qualification, calibration, and preventive maintenance, as assigned.
Establishes good working relation with contract laboratories.
Supports activities regarding audits of suppliers and contract labs in support of vendor certification program.
Review completion of Tech Transfer of Finished products
Prepare QC Data Review metrics as applicable.
Ensure during review that all equipment is calibrated.
Perform the Training Tracking Tool/Software for Quality Assurance and Quality Control.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Chemistry, or closely related scientific discipline.
Degree in Chemistry is highly preferred.
Minimum of five (5) years in the field of Pharmaceutical (manufacturing facility).
Background in the functional areas of Quality Control in stability, finished product and raw material testing.
Basic understanding of cGMP’s, cGLP’s, FDA regulations, and industry guidelines, as well as international regulatory guidelines.
Knowledge in general laboratory equipment including but not limited to: HPLC, GC, UV-Vis and FTIR.
Must be proactive, results oriented, with a strong attention to detail.
Self-starter with good work ethic and ability to work independently with minimum supervision and use good judgment, or as a contributing member of a team.
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously, meet deadlines, and handle an ever changing, fast paced critical work environment.
Strong organizational, analytical, troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.
Ability to analyze details and perform structured decision-making on a daily basis.
Excellent verbal and written communication. Must be able to read, write, and speak English.
Strong interpersonal skills with ability to interact with all levels of personnel in a professional manner.
Good computer skills with basic knowledge of Microsoft programs, particularly Outlook, Word, Excel, etc. Knowledge of LIMS (Laboratory Information Management System) is a plus.
Knowledge of cGMP, Regulatory guidelines, Compendial testing (USP), Internal auditing.
Skills in coordination of calibration and preventative maintenance services, including but not limited to: setting up vendor contracts, processing quotes, generating purchasing orders and handling vendor invoices.
Technical writing skills to generate SOPs and serve as the Subject Matter Expert.
Support the Management to organize and maintain the QC team, good communications skills, front runner, and cGMP trainer.
Must have worked in Regulatory environment.
Will be an added advantage if the individual has dealt with multiple audits personally.
Location
Monroe, North Carolina, USA
Work Schedule
Monday - Friday 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM
Tuesday - Saturday 9:00 AM - 6:00 PM
Our Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to fostering diversity in the workplace, both in its employee workforce and in Company leadership. (minorities/females/veterans/individuals with disabilities/sexual orientation/gender identity)
