Company Description

Hi there! We’re Razorfish. We’ve been leading the marketing industry with our digital expertise since the start of the internet. But in 2020, we did a full reboot. What’s different? It all starts with people. Weird, wonderful, complex people - with diverse backgrounds in strategy, creative and technology. But no matter how different we are, we all have one thing in common. We believe our differences are our strength. So we push for inclusion, challenge convention and bring in new perspectives, to inspire new ideas. Because when we connect by understanding what makes people different, we can create unforgettable experiences that enrich lives. Join us at razorfish.com.

Job Description

WEB ANALYTICS SENIOR ASSOCIATE
Job Description
Razorfish is seeking a full-time Senior Associate of Data Analytics for our New York office. Candidates should be proficient in digital/website KPI frameworks, reporting, insight, and analysis. Day-to-day instruments include Adobe Analytics and Excel/PowerPoint.
Responsibilities:
Analysis & Insights
Analyze website performance data (overall trends, clickstream, pathing, UX) to uncover meaningful insights, across a variety of global markets for a prominent e-commerce site
Create and maintain bi-weekly and monthly reporting
Build ad-hoc analyses as needed to unearth page, experience, or market-level learnings
Independently prioritize analytical needs of team and business, based on complexity, timing, and visibility
Perform basic statistical analysis, such as calculating statistical significance, distributions, etc.
Effectively communicate complex ideas to primary client contacts, both verbally and in writing
Qualifications
The applicant should have at least 2-4 years of work experience in a business environment, with a minimum of 12 months successfully working with or adjacent to websites, such as in digital media or an intensively client-focused model such as an external consulting or marketing services firm
Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Statistics or equivalent experience
1+ year Adobe Analytics or Google Analytics experience preferred
A storyteller, be able to make sense of data and extrapolate meaningful and actionable insights
Experience in creating and delivering presentations using PowerPoint
Experience in the any or multiple areas below would be a plus:
SQL querying
Basic knowledge of website tagging or tag management systems (Adobe Launch, Google Tag Manager, etc)
Paid or owned media campaign knowledge that would drive to a website
Advertising (both online and offline)

Job Description

Infina is looking for a passionate Data Analyst to turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions. The Data Analyst will conduct full lifecycle activities to include requirements analysis and design, develop analysis and reporting capabilities, and continuously monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements.
Duties & Responsibilities
Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
Develop and implement data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Filter and “clean” data, and review computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems
Work closely with management to prioritize business and information needs
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities

Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics
At least three (3) years of professional work experience with data analytics
Proficiency with data visualization tools; Tableau, Python, R, Looker
Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
Knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc.), databases (SQL etc), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks)
Skilled in using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS, etc.)
Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings
Use of analytic techniques such as classification, regression, similarity matching, clustering, co-occurrence grouping, profiling, link prediction, data reduction, and causal modelling, as well as experience developing and deploying automated processes
Ability to obtain a Public Trust security clearance

Additional Information

Infina, Ltd. is an equal employment opportunity company. All individuals are encouraged to apply.

Description
The City of Boulder is a great place to live, work, grow and play.

With over 300 miles of dedicated bikeways and more than 150 miles of hiking trails, Boulder values active lifestyles and access to nature. Forty-five thousand acres of land provide open space for parks and a green belt around the city. With world class restaurants and art and music venues, The City of Boulder values diverse culture.

Respect is one of our five City Values (including Customer Service, Collaboration, Integrity and Innovation) and we are committed to equity, diversity and inclusion. We celebrate and support our differences across all spectrums, including but not limited to ethnicity, gender, age, disability, and sexuality. Through our focus on Racial Equity, our employee benefits, and the many programs resources we offer our staff, we continually strive to weave respect for one another into the fabric of our organization.

Add your voice and talents to the City of Boulder and help us grow in service excellence for an inspired future.

This job posting is "continuous" or "open until filled” and will close when a qualified candidate is identified and/or hired.

OVERALL JOB OBJECTIVE:
This position provides financial, analytical, and rate/data support for the Utilities Department and performs related duties as required. Participates as a member of an analytical team supporting the efforts of a customer service-oriented organization, and works in a collaborative manner to foster teamwork, coordination, and financial and analytical support across the Utilities Department and the city organization.

JOB TITLE: Finance/Data Analyst

PROFESSIONAL COMPETENCIES:
Participates as a member of customer service-oriented organization, and works in a collaborative manner to foster teamwork, coordination, and financial and analytical support across the city organization.
Organized – Can proactively and effectively plan and execute work in a timely fashion and meet deadlines associated with the city’s annual budget cycle, including board and council presentations.
Technically proficient – Highly skilled and proficient at data manipulation and analysis, simplifying big data and generating reports using a variety of computational tools, including spreadsheets and unique enterprise software.
Strong Communicator – Can distill detailed technical information and provide written and verbal presentations and can adapt style and level of detail to fit the needs of a variety of audiences.
Supportive Teammate – Can effectively partner with department managers, supervisors, and staff to evaluate business needs and funding for staffing, equipment and consumable resources with integrity and solid financial stewardship of public funds.
Flexible, Creative and Courageous – Can quickly adapt to changing circumstances and priorities, can identify and suggest creative solutions to unique problems while also demonstrating courage and objectivity in evaluating expenditures in relation to city policy and broader department business needs.

Duties and Responsibilities:
1. Provides Financial and Budget support. This includes, but is not limited to, the following:
Assists in budget development including preparation of documents for budget submission.
Regular reporting including revenue, expenditure, and consumption reports.
Assists with research and analysis as requested: cost/benefit analysis, statistical analysis, and administrative processes.
Reconciles financial transactions to ensure accuracy of financial information, as well as compliance with citywide financial and management policies and work processes.
Provides financial, rate and/or water use information for annual reports, utility master plans, studies, surveys, study sessions, and board or council items.

2. Provides Rate and Data Support, including but not limited to the following:
Assists with development of Utility rates, including understanding the rate methodology for the three utilities, running rate scenarios, and calculating rate impacts.
Compiles and analyzes water and wastewater usage information for rate development and other policy analysis.
Assists with updates to the rate model.
Coordinates with the Utility Billing team to provide hands on support and analysis.
Assists with performing analysis or working with consultant to provide analysis for changes in billing methodology that would impact utility revenues or rates.
Responsible for ensuring integrity and reasonableness of data exports for rate consultants and/or other studies and analysis and research anomalies.
Assists with testing of billing system upgrades.
3. Assists with management of processes and projects. This includes, but is not limited to, the following:
Assists in planning and conducting rate studies.
Administering annual customer payment plans.
Assists in grant research and administration.
Acts as a liaison to other city departments and other governmental agencies. May participate in task forces on specific issues of concern. Assists in grant research and administration.
Assists with preparation of materials and data for City Council and Advisory Board sessions.
May answer questions from the public.
Coordinates with supervisor to supports the financial analysis needs of other departments when requested.

4. Maintains a high level of professionalism, integrity, and communication with other staff members and with the public.
Provides excellent service to internal and external customers. Listens to questions and concerns, evaluating issues and possible solutions, fixing the problem as appropriate, working with managers to address systemic problems.
Recognizes the needs of team members and is direct, specific, and respectful in communication and behaviors.
Uses feedback from others to continue to develop and improve.
Generally, duties are listed from most to least critical or time consuming.

Required Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Public Administration, Finance or related field.
A minimum of two years administrative, budgetary, and financial experience or equivalent combination of education and experience. Interest, desire, and ability to communicate courteously and effectively with the public and city staff and to provide good customer service.
Previous professional experience in financial management, research and analysis.
Work experience demonstrating progressively responsible administrative skills and strong organizational skills.
Demonstrated ability to assume responsibility, to prioritize and resolve problems, to pay close attention to detail, to coordinate tasks to completion, to provide quality control for responsiveness and customer satisfaction, to meet deadlines and to complete tasks while working under pressure.
Expertise in using spreadsheet software and financial database systems.
Experience using word processing software.

Desired Qualifications – In addition to the required minimum qualifications:
Previous professional experience working in a utility or working with water utility rate and consumption data in some capacity.
Experience with federal grants.
Experience using database queries and Tyler Technologies (Munis) or other financial systems.
Municipal government experience including familiarity with municipal codes.

ACCOMMODATIONS: Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of this position.

The City of Boulder provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, genetic information, age, or any other status protected under federal, state, and/or local law.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Team-oriented approach

XSELL is committed to a culture of teamwork; where everyone works together to plan, do, learn, and continuously improve. We accomplish that by staying true to our core values.
Best Chapter: Every XSELLer is plugged in and focused on writing their “best chapter yet”, both personally and professionally. We believe in working hard to achieve success, but that success only comes if we are doing it together. We do this with a high level of humility, integrity, and compassion towards our coworkers. We celebrate and recognize each other and have a lot of fun along the way.
Know Us By Our Results: We do what we say and say what we do. Our coworkers and clients will “know us by our results” – we welcome that and embrace transparency and measurement.
Do It The XSELL Way: Together we are building an inclusive culture full of top-performing, talented people that are striving towards common goals with resilience. People will admire not only the work we do but also that we “do it the XSELL way” – as one team. We do this through strong communication, collaboration, and accountability to each other.
Open for Business: We are always “open for business” – fiercely committed to improving ourselves, our team, and our company. We stay curious and approach every situation as an opportunity to learn and grow.
Conversations Happen In the Room: Feedback is imperative to our collective success. We approach the “conversation in the room” with respect, empathy, and candor. Our dialogue with each other is always open and honest.

Job Title: Issuer Services Operations – MIS – Data Analytics Lead Analyst
Job Description:
Facts:
Issuer Services Ops Tampa Hub perform the contractual obligation activities for more than 300 contracts for the following countries: Panama, Colombia, Peru, Brazil and Argentina.
The Operational Sr. Analyst is a seasoned professional role. Applies in-depth disciplinary knowledge, contributing to the development of new techniques and the improvement of processes and work-flow for the area or function. Integrates subject matter and industry expertise within a defined area. Requires in-depth understanding of how areas collectively integrate within the sub-function as well as coordinate and contribute to the objectives of the function and overall business. Evaluates moderately complex and variable issues with substantial potential impact, where development of an approach/taking of an action involves weighing various alternatives and balancing potentially conflicting situations using multiple sources of information. Requires good analytical skills in order to filter, prioritize and validate potentially complex and dynamic material from multiple sources. Strong communication and diplomacy skills are required
The candidate must have good skills in learning the different systems uses in the countries that we provide services.
Keep in mind that the candidate will have a short learning curve, due to the complex and dynamic nature of the business. Therefore, the candidate must be aware of this challenge.

Support Regional Issuer Services Operations Management team in tracking and reporting of key metrics.
Prepare data analytics for tracking business performance including progress against initiatives
Drive metrics to enable cross functional collaboration and participate in internal business forums
Prepares trending reports using software tools such as Microsoft Excel for presentation to management team.
Manage and co-ordinate regular ad hoc requests in terms of liaison with stakeholders, tracking and reporting of progress
Identify data points that can help build new metrics to monitor our performance and provide new insights
Help in simplify & automating the process of data collection
Filter, prioritize and validate potentially complex and dynamic material from multiple sources.
Influence decisions through advice and counsel and applies professional judgment when making recommendations
Drive best practices through an innovative and proactive approach to optimizing processes
Project Management support of business risk and control oversight and other large global strategic initiatives
Management reporting of business intelligence and other key Investments initiatives
Data Collection and evaluation
Assembly, development and structuring of presentation decks
Ability to manage team level processes.
Work on holidays and at different time-zones to service the respective Latin American countries.
Act as backup of other colleagues of the area.
Provide support in any other activity that is assigned.

Bachelor’s/University degree.
5-8 years relevant experience
Required skills include project management, and the ability to effectively synthesize and communicate complex business issues through concise presentation skills.
Good interpersonal skills to oversee cross disciplinary work streams.
Project management and strategic analysis skills

Ability to produce high quality work under rigid time constraints.
People Management experience
Well organized to implement and monitor change for multiple initiatives
Must be a self-starter, flexible, innovative and adaptive
Advanced skills in MS Office applications (Excel, Word, PowerPoint)

Job Title: Data Analyst – Level 2 – Analytics & Visualization | TS/SCI CI Poly
Job Description:
Customer / Program Description
Our customer is an Intelligence Agency (IA) providing the United States Military and Government Agencies with intelligence on foreign militaries to help prevent and win wars. The contract under which we are supporting this customer provides worldwide coverage of IT requirements and technical support services through system design, development, fielding, and sustainment of global intelligence and Command and Control (C2) assets vital to the security of the United States.
The particular program we are working under provides the Engineering Division of this agency's CIO's office with overall system design, architecture, engineering, testing plan, security accreditation and implementation documentation for core IT and Infrastructure Services. The work includes a wide array of infrastructure engineering, monitoring, management and security services.
Team Description
Blackspoke is a trusted member of a larger team of strategic partners. This contract was just awarded and has the full 5 year contract life remaining. Work is to be performed at Contractor SCIFs in Annapolis Junction, MD.
Job Description
Develops, analyzes and models operational, economic, management, accounting and other organizational data to quantify the competitive performance of business segments, evaluate potential operational changes, and design new approaches and methodologies. Applies and integrates statistical, mathematical, predictive modeling and business analysis skills to manage and manipulate complex, high volume data from a variety of sources.
Develops data visualization resources and strategy to strategically increase enterprise view of data within customer's specific context
Engineers solutions for presenting hierarchical views of systems status and usage, and providing single-pane-of-glass enterprise views for a decision advantage
Creates visual displays for collection system usage statistics from algorithm output, etc. (e.g., dashboards and automated system reports)
Collaborates with domain experts to ensure data interpret-ability
Measures individual and aggregate end user desktop experience including login times, use of common web sites, and use of common core desktop applications
Reviews and analyzes collected data to determine the performance and health of a system or network; assists in developing, implementing, monitoring, and
analyzing key performance indicators
Identifies new patterns and areas requiring attention or improvement
Maps and performs data transformation (database development, large-scale file manipulation, data modeling, data mapping, data testing, data quality, and
documentation preparation)
Performs data analysis interpretation and data management duties
Performs requirement analysis functions
Education
Bachelor of Science + 5 years of relevant experience
Master of Science + 3 years of relevant experience
PhD + 1 year of relevant experience
Qualifications
Active TS/SCI clearance and ability to obtain and maintain a CI polygraph
DoD 8570 IAT II certification
Applicable software or hardware training and certifications

Familiarity with ticketing system(s)
Familiarity with event monitoring system(s)

Wellvana joins together independent physicians into a comprehensive management program, comprised of a common set of quality goals measured across all insurance carriers, with a focus on improved health outcomes and reducing the long-term cost of care.
Job Summary:
The primary responsibility for the Healthcare Data Analyst is to support Wellvana Health in providing high quality patient care and meeting quality and value-based outcomes through the management of large clinical data sets and application of advanced data analytics. The Healthcare Data Analyst will also be responsible for supporting the strategic needs of the company and helping to answer diverse business questions and initiatives.
This role will report to the Wellvana Health Director of Analytics and Program Design but will work closely with leadership and the clinical management teams in Wellvana markets.
Responsibilities:
Work with leadership to understand and interpret the impacts to cost and quality of initiatives using relevant data sources and analytic platforms.
Leverage data to inform population health management, quality initiatives, and provider practice support.
Formulate strategic recommendations and present findings to leadership and members of the Wellvana team.
Work with analytics team to discover new analyses that will contribute to the strategic needs of Wellvana Health.
Identify opportunities for improved clinical utilization impact and follow up through coordination with clinical operations teams.
Help develop actionable dashboards and reports to support network market operations and management
Apply critical thinking with the ability to identify and/or analyze potential opportunities for utilization management and cost containment.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree (4-year program) preferred.
4+ years’ experience in data analysis or related area.
2+ years of data analytics in healthcare field, preferred experience with value-based care, population health management and/or clinical networks.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Experience working with large, complex healthcare data sets.
Understanding of population health analytics, and an understanding of clinical and claims-based data systems and measures.
Strong data manipulation and analysis skills.
Detail oriented, strong organizational skills, ability to manage multiple demands.
Highly intelligent; possesses very strong analytic and critical thinking skills.
Strong leadership, presentation, communication (written/verbal) and information gathering,
Demonstrated ability to work effectively both independently and in a team setting with individuals having diverse professional backgrounds including business, technical and/clinical.
Experience with Clinical Integrated Network, Independent Physician Associations, or Accountable Care Organization preferred
Proficiency with SQL, Tableau, Excel and BI reporting

Job Title: HR Data Analyst - HR Data Management
Job Description:
Description
Become part of an inclusive organization with over 40,000 diverse employees, whose mission is to improve the health and well-being of the unique communities we serve.
Summary:
This position is responsible for providing analysis, quality and accuracy of employee data. Researches and corrects human resources related data to ensure data integrity and eliminate errors through downstream processing. Runs queries and performs audits to support risk, audit and data privacy compliance. Completes data changes and data validation activities to support the HR function.
Responsibilities:
1. HR Systems Data - Responsible for HR Services Systems data maintenance (organizational level information) and analysis. Responsible for validation of data and data audits while maintaining a high level of confidentiality. Identifies and corrects incomplete, improperly formatted and/or incorrect data through final review and approval of system workflow. Maintains various database information; provides tracking; processes data for reporting and updating/entering information for reporting purposes. Responds promptly and provides frequent updates to keep the user informed of status.
2. Audit and Compliance - Performs data maintenance/validation and data corrections as necessary to for HR Services support. Assists with maintaining the integrity of various HR related databases to retrieve accurate and timely information.
3. Measurement & Analysis - Identifies a business or process problem and options for solving problem (root causes). Applies analytical skills to process problem and report results. Measures and evaluates process improvement initiatives. Reports information necessary to inform decision makers. Utilizes basic statistical concepts, tools and techniques and maintains awareness of advanced topics.
4. Problem Solving & Implementation - Develops recommendations with supporting facts for best course of action to increase accuracy and efficiency regarding employee data and to ensure accurate personnel records. Assist with testing and data conversion regression testing from HR Systems.
5. Case Management - Respond and resolve Tier II cases from Employee Services regarding employee data changes. Review and approve requested data changes to ensure compliance and adherence to established business processes.
6. Tools, Methodologies & Technologies - Effectively utilizes new and existing tools, methodologies and technologies to solve business problems and provides solutions that enhance operations, capabilities and competitiveness.

Other Information
Other information:
Education Requirements:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent.
Licensure/Certification Requirements:
None required.
Professional Experience Requirements:
If a Bachelor’s degree: No prior experience required.
If an Associate’s degree: Four (4) years of relevant experience.
If a High School diploma or GED: Eight (8) years of relevant experience.
Knowledge/Skills/and Abilities Requirements:
Demonstrated ability to interface with both internal and external business partners and act as liaison when needed. Strong team facilitation, process improvement, data analysis, quality assurance skills. Excellent organization skills, strong attention to detail, and process oriented. Proficient with Excel. Excellent interpersonal skills including written and oral communication. Ability to identify and resolve exceptions and to interpret data. Demonstrated ability to maintain a confidential work environment, including handling issues with discretion and good judgment. Ability to manage workload and achieve results with minimal supervision.
